11.content:
You sat back in your recliner on the edge of the beach looking out at the new sunrise over the ocean. The view was perfect and unspoiled aside from the massive atomic warhead just off the coast. It hadn't gone off in all the years you'd lived here but the damn thing was leaking even more radioactive poison into the surrounding waters. That couldn't be good for the wildlife.

Still, the water here was probably cleaner and safer than up in Sawtooth Shores. The wildlife there made this place look like a 5 star resort, even with your crappy scrapheap of a trailer serving as the only local landmark that would probably give you tetanus just by looking at it. You took a long sip from your freshly opened can of beer and lowered your hat to keep the sun out of your eyes.

With a good chunk of the atmosphere gone due to a natural disaster or some sort of mad scientist bullshit the sunlight in most parts around here tended to be even more brutal than elsewhere. But hey, its a home, right?

You crumple up the can and throw it at the gathering pile of trash collecting on the shore and reach down to grab a fresh one from your six pack. Unfortunately, that was the last beer you had out here, if you wanted a new one you'd have to go inside and grab one from the ice box.

You swear that if your buddy Daniel didn't have the skills to keep that piece of crap running you would toss his lazy ass out, but deep down you know you could never do that. The two of you didn't always get along, but you were partners in the scavenging business and relied on each other for survival.

It wasn't like there were many other people living out here these days. You sigh as you get up and head inside to check the ice box, knowing Daniel that last six pack you got stored could still be all there or almost gone. You hadn't seen him drinking before he crashed in his hammock last night, so maybe there were a few beers left.

Just as you head inside you check your mailbox, surprised to find a letter addressed to you sitting on the bottom. The last time anyone bothered to send a message out to these parts was when you accumulated that 50 Cap tab down at that bar in the Brownsand settlement.

You tear open the dusty envelope and sit down on a dirty bean bag chair in front of your makeshift table. "Well I'll be damned... its from Taylor. That old bastard finally passed on right after he found a fresh vein of that Glowing Ore crap out in the Dustbox region outside of Scrap City." you say in amazement as you read on.

"Since he didn't name anyone in his will the whole place is up for grabs and they're handing out shares to former employees... huh." You sit the envelope down and think for a few moments about what you just read. You had spent a good 5-7 years working for Taylor and were close friends for a time but you didn't expect he'd remember you after living out here for a decade or so.

The scavenging business had been a little slow lately and this almost seemed too good to be true. You read the letter once more and tried to calculate how long it would take you to get to Scrap City. "I don't have the money to hire transport there but they may really be offering something worthwhile if I show up before the others get there." you say as you stuff the letter in your pocket.

Your days of working around the quarry and hanging out with Taylor flashed in your mind. "Hmmm... I'll do it. If I set out today I could probably make it in a week on foot or just a few days if I can hitch a ride with a caravan." you say excitedly as you put the note in your pocket.

There wasn't much you had to barter with but you quickly picked up a few bits of junk to trade to help fund your journey. "Hey man, what's with the racket? I'm sleeping here." Daniel called as he rolled over in his hammock and pulled a torn piece of clothing over his head. "I'm setting out for Scrap City and taking in this weeks haul early, want to come with me?" you ask as you stuff some of the junk into a pocket on your backpack.

"Nah, I'm cool. We still got a months worth of water in storage and some food stashed in the ice box. I'll be fine while you're gone, but if you're going all the way to Scrap City make sure you bring back some decent beer this time. That piss water we got on our last trip out there wasn't worth half of what we paid for it." he replied as he scratched his ass.

"Sure thing, I might even bring us back some whiskey if this little errand provides me with some good cash." you say as you walk back to the ice box. "Awesome, last time I had some of that good shit was about five years ago..." Daniel muttered as he began falling back asleep. Since he was out of it you decided to take the remaining beer with you as it would make a good trade if you needed it to.


[Roll a D6 and add X Beers to your inventory, where X is the number you rolled.]


After putting the beer and some water and food rations in your pack you head out the door and begin walking to the nearby settlement of Shady Wood Park. Once there you could gather supplies for your journey. After walking for about two hours you come to a small collection of shacks on the edge of a dying forest surrounded by a chain-link fence and a lone guard tower.

The settlement was small, only about 7 houses and a bazaar, but its location next to the forest and heavy traffic from people passing through on their way to Brownsand meant that the little town was well protected. You waved to the sniper up in the guard tower who quickly returned the favor to welcome you to town.

From there you spent about an hour talking to people around town and exchanging goods to prepare for your journey. Soon, you were ready to set out.

[You gain $100. You gain 5 Caps.]

11.title: Time For A Trip

Return fire as best you can
111.content:
You knew most of the people of Shady Wood Park since they were the settlement you traded most of your goods with but you had never really gotten to know most of the caravans that passed through. As such it took quite a bit of effort to get a leaving caravan to trust you enough to allow you to accompany them to Scrap City.

"Fair warning, I like the folks at Shady Woods Park. They always take care of our crew and keep us running when we pass through, they're good people. You seemed to be friends with them, but we didn't even know you until you walked up to our caravan this morning. You seem alright, but if you cause any trouble we'll leave you tired to a rock for the bugs to pick apart, understood?" the lead caravaner asked from his mount.

"Yes sir, I'm just hoping for an uneventful journey like the rest of you." you reply quickly, trying to ease the tension a bit. The man only laughs as he turns around to face you. "I don't know where you're from, but out here in this wasteland there are monsters that eat people left and right, not to mention bandits. If you're expecting an uneventful ride give me back that little horse I lent you and walk back to town. You'll die out here."

You felt a bit offended at his words but just let it pass. Pissing him off would just delay your journey and make things harder. You've managed to survive out here before, something he wasn't aware of so you just decided to forget it and keep an eye out for danger. It had been about 3 hours since you left Shady Wood Park and the afternoon sun was murder. If not for the shade provided by the other caravaners this would have been unbearable.

The group passed by a Sand Hornet shortly after lunchtime and everyone was a quick enough shot that the only injury was an unlucky man who had been slow on the trigger. He could've lost his hand and judging by his screaming wish he had, but the group doctor was skilled enough to save it. You yourself had a close call when one of the buggers nearly got you in the eye, though your skill with the revolver you had bought back in Shady Woods Park kept you safe.

The lead caravaner even complemented you on your shooting and allowed you to eat dinner with him and his men after leaving you to eat your lunch by yourself. "You handled yourself pretty good out there today, guess you're not a bad addition to this group after all." he said as he looked over to the setting sun. "Thanks, a lucky shot is what saved me though." you reply as you take a sip of water from your canteen. "Luck... skill... its all the same. Let's set up camp for the night here."

After a mostly uneventful first day you fell asleep and relaxed near the wreckage of an old airplane the had fallen from the air years ago. By the next morning you were back on the road and making good time. Nothing really exciting happened that day and it wasn't long before you were once again resting under the stars.

As you set off on the morning of day three you asked how long it would be before you got to Scrap City. "About a day, little less probably." one of the caravaners replied as you passed a burnt out gas station singed by a powerful explosion. As you got further down the road a single shot rang out and one of the caravaners fell off his horse as a bullet ripped through his neck. "Bandits!" yelled the lead caravaner as they returned fire on the gas station.

The group scattered when a grenade landed on the road and nearly blew away one of the riders. A single man yelled out as bullets tore through the gas station and two more people, a man and a woman, came running out guns blazing. Both were killed almost instantly, but not before one of them manage to hit another caravaner in the head.

"Spread out, surround them on all sides!" The lead caravaner yelled as the group closed in on the gas station. Suddenly, bullets flew out from a boarded up window and struck the lead caravaner off his horse. "Damn it, they hit Paul!" one of the other caravaners screamed as a second grenade flew out of the window and land at his feet. There was almost no time to react, but you knew you had to do something.

Environment: Wasteland, Ruins
111.title: On the road

choices: See if anyone is up for a game of poker
1111.content:
You quickly rode closer on your horse and pulled a small magnetic device from your pocket. You had seen this model of grenade before and knew it was entirely computerized in nature... as well as the fact that a simple magnetic pulse was all it took to disrupt the inner timer mechanism. Without a second to spare you tossed the device next to the grenade and hopped off your horse to properly attend to the deadly explosive.

More shots rang out as the other caravaners rode up past the gas station window to finish off the last of the bandits inside. You hardly noticed, however, as you pried open the grenades outer shell to disarm the explosive mechanism completely. After a few tense seconds a soft tick signaled that the thing was dead.

"Holy shit, you just saved my life..." the lead caravaner said as he slowly got to his feet while clutching his bleeding side. "You gonna be okay?" you asked as you tossed the disarmed grenade away. "Yeah, we got a Military Stimpak saved up that I can use to fix this, I'll be good as new within the hour." he replied as he slowly got back on his horse and reached into a pouch on the side.

Suddenly, the young man who had been riding next to you came running up yelling "PA!" at the top of his lungs. "Relax son, I'll be okay, this here wastelander just saved my life. Disarmed the damn thing if you can believe it." the head caravaner replied as he jabbed his bleeding side with some kind of drug injector.

For a moment he bled even more heavily as bits of the bullet that hit him poured out of his gun wound before it slowly began to fuse shut. In minutes a small scar would be the only sign of his near fatal injury. "Here, take this!" he called out as he tossed you an item he had retrieved from a pouch as he rode by.

"Nice, thanks!" you call back quickly as you look down at the tightly wrapped wad of dollar bills in your hand. Undoing the rubber band holding the money together you took a few seconds to count it all up.

[You gain $500.]

"Hey, thank you for saving my dad." the young man said as he got back on his house and rode over to join his father and the rest of the group. "We've gotta bury our dead and check the station before we get back on the road. Take a break while we get everyone back in gear."

After a brief burial for the dead and lunch the caravan was back on the searing hot pavement on the road to Scrap City. With no more delays the group quickly arrived at the Neon Sunset Inn for a quick resupply. "We'll only be here for about ten or fifteen minutes." the lead caravaner warned as he dismounted his horse and walked inside the door to the bar.

You have some time to kill before you continue to Scrap City, what do you want to do?

You had just become several hundred dollars richer and decided it was at least worth a look to see what this place had to offer. You accompany the lead caravaner inside and follow him up to the bar. "Well hello there, what can I do for you fine folks? Need a room for the night?" the bartender asked with a smile as she leaned over the counter to give you both an eyeful of her ample bosom. "No thanks, we're just here to resupply before we get back on the road." the lead caravaner says as he pulls out some money and quickly counts it up.

"Oh, of course sweetie. Just a moment." the bartender replies as she begins placing items on the counter for you both to look at. A lost of it was just junk or booze, but more than a few things caught your eye.

By sunset you had arrived at the edge of Scrap City and parted ways. Having finally made to your destination you wasted no time in visiting an old friend who ran the Bluebrick Hotel. Reunions would have to wait until later, though, as you were exhausted and very thankfully to have a free room to spend the night in. 11111.title: What's On Tap?

11112.content:
You are about to head inside when you notice that two of the other caravaners have set up a small box to play cards on and head over to join them. "What's up boys? Mind if I join in?" you ask as you take a seat next to them. "Sure thing, but we've got a fairly large buy in. You know how to play poker?" the man shuffling the cards asks as his buddy pulls a wad of crumpled bills from his pocket.

You nod your head and retrieve a sizable sum of the money you were just award for helping the caravan leader. "Let's get this game started." you say with a sly smile as the dealer gives you your first few cards. After a few tense seconds of everyone looking over their cards the game officially begins.
11112.title: A Friendly Game Of Lies And Deceit

111121.content:
You grin as you reveal your cards to the other two men and scoop up your winnings. "Straight." you say gleefully as one of the men angrily throws his two pair onto the table to be shuffled back into the deck. "This punk must have cheated!" he growled as his partner shuffled the deck and then put it away. "The new kid didn't cheat, I would have caught it... some people just have more luck with this game." the dealer replied as he shook your hand.

[You gain $600.]

"Good game, but if we meet up again I'll be the one taking all your cash. Luck doesn't last forever, especially out here." he said as he tossed you a spare deck of cards.

[You gain Deck Of Cards.]

The other caravaner was still sore over losing so much of his cash, but he at least shook your hand before getting back on his horse.

"Thanks for the game guys, better luck next time!" you call as the lead caravaner emerges from the motel with a fresh bag of supplies. "Time to move out, we can still make it to Scrap City by sunset if we get going!" he yelled as everyone got ready to get back on the road.

The rest of your trip was uneventful and you soon found yourself on the border of Scrap City just as the sun was disappearing on the far horizon. After saying your goodbyes to the caravan you parted ways and headed for the Bluebrick Hotel. An old friend who ran the place gave you a free room to stay in and you quickly found yourself falling asleep in a nice warm bed.
111121.title: Card Shark

111122.content:
You rake in a small pile of bills as the other two caravaners grumble over their decent heads being outwitted by your bluff of a Royal Flush. The dealer is about to start a new round when the lead caravaner appears with some fresh suppliers and tells everyone to prepare to move out.

"Damn, looks like the game is over, for now at least." the dealer says as he takes everyone's cards and splits the pot. The other cravaner grumbles about finally having some luck and lets out a sigh as he puts away his money. All in all you have a small net gain with your sharp tongue and good old fashioned luck of the draw.

------------------
You gain $200.
------------------

"Thanks for the game, gentlemen. Now let's get back on the road." you say as everyone mounts up and heads out. In a short while the outer limits of Scrap City soon appear in the distance, marking the end of the first part of your journey. After bidding the caravan farewell you head to the Bluebrick Hotel, an establishment run by an old friend of yours. Within minutes you were drifting off to sleep in a warm cozy bed.
111122.title: Good Game

111123.content:
You were always a decent poker player, but these caravan types had years on the road to hone their skills and improve their game. Despite having some pretty good hands you found yourself constantly folding due to intimidation or bluffs, only a few of which turned out to be true.

By the time the lead caravaner returned you had lost almost all of the money you had been wagering. "Time to pack up and head out. It was fun playing with ya, kid." the dealer said as he put away his cards. "Yeah, thanks for the cash." the other caravaner laughed as he took his small pile of winnings and put it into his pocket.

---------------
You lose $200
---------------

You sigh as you take the cash you have left and put it away before getting back on your horse and following the caravaners as they head back onto the dusty road ahead. When you finally arrive at Scrap City you say your goodbyes and make a beeline for the Bluebrick Hotel. With all the money you had lost it was nice to have a free room courtesy of an old friend and you soon found yourself falling asleep.
111123.title: You Can't Win All Of Them

choices: See what the shady guy in the black coat is selling
1112.content:
Time seemed to slow down as bullets whizzed through the air and people yelled out in surprise and shock. Just as the grenade landed next to Paul you instantly aimed your revolver towards a fleeing horse whose rider had just been shot dead. You had maybe two seconds to line up a shot, pull the trigger and hope the dead animal shielded the caravan leader from most of the blast.

As the horse passed in front of Paul you squeezed the trigger and sent a bullet straight into it. Without a word the creature stumbled forward without so much as a grunt and landed right of top of the grenade as it detonated. A thick red mist splashed amid a storm of broken bones and torn muscle, covering the ground with a thin sheet of blood.

Some of the caravaners gasped amid the ongoing gunfight, but continued to surround and bombard the gas station with a hail of bullets. Paul let out a soft groan as he rolled onto his back, his hand clutching his bleeding side. "Pa! PA!" the young caravaner next to you called out as the two of you rode close while the others finished off the last attacker inside the station.

The lead caravaner was in pretty bad shape, with a nasty gunshot wound and some scrapes and bruises from the blast that had nearly killed him. Luckily for him, the horse blood made things look worse than they actually were. "Son, get the Military Stimpack... my side..." Paul groaned as you walked over to examine him.

"What's hurt? I tried to stop the worst of the impact, but it looks like a bit of it still hit you." you said as the young caravaner returned and jabbed a medical syringe into his father's side. The wound bled out some small bullet and shrapnel fragments before the tissue began slowly repairing itself. "Thank god we had that and thank god you were here..." the man said weakly as his son helped him to his feet.

"I'll still need to get checked by a medic once we reach the city, but you saved my life wastelander." Paul said as he handed you a small roll of dollar bills. "Wish I could give you more, but that horse will set us back a bit."

------------------
You gain $250
------------------

You thank him for the cash and join the rest of the caravan as they begin to bury the dead and prepare to leave. A short while after you get back on the road you pass by a small motel settlement surrounded by a chain-link fence. "Aren't we going to stop there?" you ask as the caravan moves further down the road.

"Wish we could, but they don't have any good doctors there. We need to get Paul to Scrap City as soon as we can so he can rest and heal up at Doc Sancho's place." One of the caravan members replied as he lit a cigarette. "Don't worry though, we'll pass a few decent merchants on our way there if you want to stick with us a little longer."

You nod your head and remain silent until the city finally starts coming into view. Instead of heading straight to the Bluebrick Hotel like you planned you followed the caravaners to a small bazaar area made up of makeshift cloth tents, piled cinder blocks, old tires and rusty scrap metal. Nearby were settlers attending to a small garden and cooking something in a large metal pot. There was even a blacksmith smelting the scrap into useful tools and items.

"The doc is a little further ahead, but everything you might need is here. Thanks again for saving my dad." the young caravaner says as you climb off your loaned horse and wave goodbye. Once they disappear behind a building you then turn your attention to the many open shops in this small market. You wanted to check them all, but it was almost sunset and getting later by the minute.

You really didn't want to be walking around after dark so you quickly decided to check out one store before heading on your way.

11121.content:
You head over to a large tent where two men with beards have set up shop next to an old water pump. On the ground I from of them was a ragged yet durable rug that had several items carefully laid out upon it. You walk over and give them a smile. "Hi fellas, I'm in a bit of a hurry, what have you got for sale?" you ask as you take a seat in a nearby lawn chair.

"We have plenty, whether you want to buy or simply browse and compare us to what others are selling." one of the men says as he holds up a few objects that were on the rug. "We may not having everything, but most of the time we have something for everyone."

You walk over to a man and woman in tattered clothing sitting on a bench in front of a large bonfire with a few pots and pans scattered about. From the looks of it a few people had placed some small critters on sticks to cook by the flames while others had set up little makeshift grills made from stacked rocks and metal wires.

You felt your stomach rumble slightly at the smells and sounds of the sizzling meat and quickly greet the two chefs with a friendly wave. They smile at the prospect of a having a customer so late in the day and quickly offer you a seat. "What can I get you, sweetheart?" the woman asks as her husband pulls some type of lizard off one of the grills.

11123.content:
You see a man in a dark black coat wink at you before disappearing down a nearby alley next to a ruined building. Intrigued yet cautious you follow him closely and keep an eye on him. You are ready to draw your weapon when he leans against a rusted barrel and gives you a friendly smile.

"Why hello there, friend." he begins cheerfully as he pulls a stubby cigar from his pocket and lights it. "You definitely ain't one of my normal customers, but you sure look like you need something to take the edge off. I've got a few things for sell that can help get you back on your feet..."

You cross your arms as he opens the right side of his jacket to reveal several bottles and baggies of pills. "Not your style? Don't worry, I got plenty of variety." he says as he opens the left side to reveal several syringes and needles as well as a few small boxes and pipes.

"Well?" he says somewhat impatiently as you look over what he has. "Are you gonna buy or what?"

111232.content:
You politely excuse yourself and bid the man farewell as you walk out of the alley and look for a guard to report him to. After a few minutes a man in thin leather armor bolstered by bits of scrap and a worn helmet walks by on his evening patrol. It was clear he wasn't an official part of the Scrap City Police Force, but a local militiaman who kept order in the outer slums and camps.

You quickly call him over and tell him of the man who had just tried to sell you drugs. The Militiaman crosses his arms and takes a bite out of a strange blue fruit. "I see, we don't tolerate hard narcotics here with all of the strung out junkies making trouble, but things like pain pills and medical aid are fair game. Was he selling anything heavy?" the man asks as he puts away the fruit for later.

You knew that the guy must have had some good stuff on him to invite you over like that, especially judging by all of the strange chemicals he had tucked away. You just needed a way to prove it...
111232.title: Users Are Losers!

1112321.content:
You list all of the various chemicals and substances the man showed you when you took a look at his inventory and explained how they could be used to make some dangerous stuff. The militiaman nods his head and asks you to take him back to the drug dealer immediately. "Right away, sir." you say as you walk back over to the alley.

"Hey hey hey, what the fuck is this?!" the dealer growls as he takes a step back. "What the fuck you doing bringing a goddamn guard out here?" You smile and step back so that the militiaman can do his job. "Easy sir, this person just reported you for possession and attempted dealing of banned narcotics. I'll need to search you." the militiaman says as he walks over to the dealer, who draws a small switchblade and holds it up defensively.

"Put that toothpick away before I have to blow your brains out!" the militiaman demanded as he drew his 9mm pistol out of a holster tucked under his shirt. The dealer glared at you both for a few seconds before dropping the tiny blade and raising his hands. After a few minutes the dealer was in handcuffs and three small plastic bags filled with his illegal merchandise was being carried away by another militiaman who had been radioed to come and help secure the area.

"Thanks for the tip, this asshat is suspected of selling fixes to kids and the elderly." The militiaman said as he bent down to check under a nearby dumpster for any more stashed goods. "I normally advise folks to keep away from the streets at night, but I'm glad you were here."

After a few more minutes of chatting and dong a sweep of the nearby area you were back on the road and headed towards the Bluebrick Hotel with a militia escort. Before saying goodbye the militiaman handed you a small stack of bills as a bounty for helping bring in that drug dealer and wish you luck on your journey ahead.

You were happy to have a little extra cash, but the day had been exhausting and you soon found yourself drifting off to sleep in a complementary room courtesy of your old friend who ran the place.

You saw some shady stuff being offered by that dealer, but probably nothing that was outright illegal. "I'm sorry, I didn't know he was clean." you reply to the militiaman as you turn to walk away. Before you head out the militiaman offers to escort you to your destination since things seemed to be fairly under here control tonight.

After you arrive at the Bluebrick Hotel you wave goodbye to the militiaman and head inside to greet your old friend who ran the place. After a brief talk you headed upstairs and went to bed in your free room.

You had no choice but to watch as the grenade went off the lead caravaner before he could crawl away, blasting bits of his legs into the air as his body was knocked backwards. "No! NO! 1113211.content:
You ignore the person and continue onwards to Scrap City. The sun begins setting just as you reach the outskirts where various bums and other unfortunate people have set up makeshift homes. In another hour you're resting soundly in your room at the Bluebrick Hotel. Since the owner was an old friend he gladly let you sleep here free of charge.

Of course, you didn't have much time to talk since the long walk in the hot sun left you quite tired. After promising to have a chat in the morning you had excused yourself and went to bed without even bothering to visit one of the local merchants.

Tomorrow you'd have a fresh start though. For now you were just happy to have a really comfortable bed to sleep in and being done with traveling for the moment.

1113212.content:
It was getting late, but you never know what kind of deals you might find out here in the wastes. You run to catch up with the person and begin calling out to them once you get close enough. The man turns around to reveal himself as an old bum with a short beard and a tattered t-shirt under his coat. "Well well, looks like I might get a customer today after all." he says with a grin full of unhealthy teeth.

You ask what he has to sell and he opens his coat to reveal several exotic items and drops a blanket on the drop to sit some of his better merchandise on. "Tell you what, since you're my first customer today and I really need the money I'll give you a special deal. You buy just one item so I'll have the money to stay at the Neon Sunset Inn instead of camping and I'll give you a discount on all my items." he says eagerly as he takes off his backpack to retrieve more items.

Once he has everything available set up he sits down and lights up a cigarette while you look over his goods. "Take your time, I'll sure you'll find something you like here." he says as he turns over a few items for you to get a better look at.

1113212.title: End of a long road

111322.content:
"Hey, I don't mean to be a pest, but is there any way you could give me a lift to Scrap City?" you ask as she puts a hand on your chest gives you a kiss. "I dunno, gas isn't cheap. Is there some place you gotta be?" Cloe asks.

"Yeah, my old boss passed away and he might have left me some stuff. I figured the sooner I get there the sooner I could collect whatever it might be." you reply as you give her a small kiss on the cheek. She takes a moment to consider your offer as she leans her head back on the pillow.

"I've got an old motorcycle." she finally says as she stretches out on the bed. "I could gas it up and be ready to head out in about 10 minutes. Since Scrap city is so close we could easily make it there in about an hour and I should be able to get back before my shift starts."

"Sounds like a plan. I'll get dressed and meet you downstairs after you get it set up. Thanks Cloe." you say gratefully as you hop out of bed and begin putting your clothes back on. After a quick breakfast you meet Cloe outside her garage and climb on the back of her motorcycle.

"We don't have any spare helmets, so hold on. The last thing I wanna do is peel your cute ass off the road." Cloe yells over the roar of the engine. "Got it." you call back as she speeds out of the settlement and onto the sand covered road.

A little over an hour later you're speeding through the outskirts of Scrap City past several makeshift campsites and shacks. The motorcycle comes to a stop just as you reach the main gate and Cloe bids you goodbye before she leaves.

"This is as far as I can go hon, so I'll have to head back now. You just remember you're always welcome at the Neon Sunset Inn." Cloe yells as she turns the motorcycle around and waves goodbye. You wave back and watch as she disappears down the road in a cloud of dust.

Its only the afternoon, but you wanted to hurry up and book a room for the night so you immediately headed for the Bluebrick hotel, which was owned by an old friend of yours. He was happy to see you and give you a place to stay free of charge, but was too busty with his work to talk much at the moment.

You figured it was just as well since you wanted some piece and quiet after the eventful past days. After spending the rest of the day relaxing you then drift off to peaceful sleep.

111323.title: Wake up call

11133.content:
"Are you sure, hon? We may be close to Scrap City, but it's still dangerous in these parts with all of the wild animals and such that like to come out at night." the bartender asks as she begins putting away her inventory. "Yeah, I can handle one night out there, it wouldn't be the first time." you reply with a confident smile.

"Look, I understand you wastelander types like to prove how tough you are, but we've had problems with scorpions and snakes these past few weeks. If you're going to camp outside, at least let stay inside the fence. We've got some spare sleeping bags, only five bucks to rent, what do you say sweetie?" the bartender pleads as she opens a trunk behind the counter and holds up a green bedroll.

You didn't want to spend any money if you could help it, but it was hard to say no to that cute face and worried smile. You gave it some thought and decided to...
11133.title: Under The Stars...

111331.content:
In the end you caved and decided to accept the bartender's generous offer to sleep in the parking lot just outside the motel. "Good night sweetie, I'd say don't let the bedbugs bite, but these parts are infested with them." the bartender calls as you walk out the front door. It's still pretty early, but you figure it was best to get set up before some bum found the best spot for himself.

After several minutes of clearing away some garbage and refuse from a spot near the fence you unrolled the sleeping bag and climbed inside. It wasn't too comfortable and a had a mild smell to it, but it beat trying to sleep on the ground. It took about an hour to fall asleep, but after that you got through the rest of the night undisturbed.

By morning, however, it became quite clear that you hadn't gone unnoticed the previous night. Nothing was stolen, but some large red bumps and stinging sores made it clear that some desert creepy crawlies had some fun with you last night. By the time you climbed out of bed a dull numbness from their weak venom was shooting through your arms and legs.

--------------------------
You lose 1 hit point.
--------------------------

The bartender tried to suppress a laugh as you handed her back the bedroll while scratching at a rash on your left arm. "I told ya hon, nobody sleeps in the wasteland without waking up with a little something in the morning. At least you stayed in the fence though, I hate to see what would have happened f you slept outside with the critters." You roll your eyes and walk out the door, eager to get to the city and get some medicine so you wouldn't have to worry about stuff like this.

Amazingly enough, you manage to reach Scrap City by the end of the day and are able to sleep in a warm hotel room free of charge. An old friend owned the place, but you were too exhausted to catch up with him now. You promised to chat with him tomorrow, but for now you just wanted to sleep.
111331.title: Buggin' You

111332.content:
The bartender shakes her head and lets out a sigh. "Well alright then, it was nice knowing you hon... take care." she says as you walk back out the door. The night was fast approaching so you quickly got on your way and began moving down the road. After you had traveled about a mile from the Neon Sunset Inn you climbed up onto a smooth rock near the edge of the cracked asphalt and unfolded a light cloth from your backpack.

It was getting dark, but you took some time to gather up brush and bits of dried up foliage to help mask you from bandits and predators. When you felt concealed enough you laid your head on your backpack and pulled the covers over you head. Amazingly enough, no humans found you and the night went by peacefully...

Unfortunately, the wild animals of the waste did find you and didn't much care for you disturbing their home. A Sandman Scorpion stung you twice on one foot as you slumbered and a swarm of insects pestered and pinched your exposed flesh. The venom from the scorpion numbed you just enough to dull your senses, but the itching and stinging from the wounds would become apparent by morning.

As you opened your eyes the sun was just barely rising over your makeshift bed and peeking through the cracks of your cover. The light burning of the poison in your veins and several fresh red bumps and scratches told you all you needed to know about your late night visitors. You really should have listened to that bartender...
111332.title: Nocturnal Pests

1113321.content:
You honestly felt pretty bad, but your body was strong and healthy, the last leg of your journey to Scrap City would be a pain, yet not nearly bad enough to cause you any lasting distress. Even now, the numbness from the scorpions venom began to slowly fade as you got up and got back on the road.

You lose 1 hit point.
---------------------------

You moved slow, but arrived at the city well before nightfall and soon made your way to the Bluebrick Hotel. An old buddy of yours ran the place and was eager to see you, though you declined the opportunity to catch up until you had gotten some rest. Luckily, he gave you a room on the house and you were soon well on your way to a peaceful nights sleep.
1113321.title: Roughin' It

1113322.content:
You lean over and begin puking your guts out as your head swirls with dizziness. The poison in your veins began to flow throughout your body as you stood up, but by sheer luck wasn't quite enough to kill you. The road ahead would be painful, but at least you were close to Scrap City.

You lose 3 hit points.

You begin stumbling down the road as best you can in your condition, pausing every half hour or so to catch your breach and take a sip from your canteen. It's nearly night when you finally arrive and by then you barely have the strength to seek out the Bluebrick Hotel, which was owned by an old friend of yours. Luckily, he gave you a room on the house to sleep off your illness and stay at while you were in the city.
1113322.title: Ain't Nature Grand?

choices: Get some sleep at the Boxa Nova Hotel
112.content:
You weren't able to secure a spot in the larger caravan, but as luck would have it a smaller one arrived in town roughly half an hour later. It was just two brothers and their buddy and his girlfriend, but it beat traveling alone. After a few minutes of talking while they watered their large lizard mounts you had secured a ride to Scrap City.

Unfortunately, the group only had two lizards so you hade to hold onto the back of the straps securing the saddles of the two brothers as the lizard stumbled along. As you rode in the hot wasteland heat you passed the time chatting about what you would all do when you got to Scrap City.

Apparently, Tom and Jonah (the brothers) had a decent stash of iron and copper to sell and the two lovebirds (Nat and Jake) were planning on setting up a big wedding that all of their friends and family could attend. You spoke very little about yourself, but mentioned that you were visiting your old business to see about a possible inheritance from the company.

The day dragged on slowly and you soon found yourself heading down a worn dirt path away from the highway. "Why did we leave the main road?" you asked in confusion. "Didn't you say you were headed to Scrap City?"

"Yeah, but its too dangerous to stick to the highway at night so we're gonna take a detour through Kniferock Point, its a little settlement near the mountains that mostly just the local merchants know about." Tom replied over the sound of the lizards climbing over a pile of fallen rocks.

Several more hours passed, but just as the sun sank behind the distant horizon you noticed a small oasis of lights shining ahead at the base of a tall jagged rock that jutted out from the ground at an angle that obscured the town from most of the surrounding area. If not for the lights most people wouldn't even notice the place until they got real close.

"Here she is!" called Jonah as his brother steered the lizard towards the small town. It was a bumpy ride getting past all of the gravel, sand and brushed littered about the area, though you were happy just to see a nice bit of civilization this far out from the main path. As everyone dismounted the brothers headed towards a large building on middle of town with Nat and Jake heading straight for what seemed to be a hotel of sorts.

"We've got rooms reserved at the Boxa Nova Hotel, head on over if you're tired." Tom called as he and Jonah wave to Nat and Jake. "Or you can explore the town a bit if its your first time here." Jonah added. With that they all disappeared inside well lit buildings, leaving you out in the cold desert air alone.

You were a bit tired, but you knew even a small town like this with only a couple dozen residents was likely to have something of interest to you. You could head out now or wait and see if you had time in the morning...
112.title: Small Town

1121.content:
The town wasn't huge, but up close you could see that it was a fair bit bigger than you had expected it to be. Aside from a few old trailers, houses and a run down series of boxcars on a rusty railroad track most of the town was safely tucked away in a wide cave mouth just under the cliff that gave the town its name.

The outcropping of rock from the cliff connected all the way to the side of the opposite hill, proving a nice bit of sturdy shelter for everyone in town. The chain-link fences and gates near both ends of the town were all the security this fortified little place needed. Hell, it was probably one of the safest places in the entire wasteland.

You walked through the open gate past a guard in leather armor that was dyed blue in places to show his authority as a member of the town police force. He tipped his hat as hat as you passed and welcomed you to town. From there you made your way over to the mouth of the cave as it looked like that was were most of the businesses were.

Strands of lights hung from the ceiling powered by an unseen generator and a big sign hanging over the archway of the cave between two buildings advertised many services that could be found ahead. Lined up were a few buildings that were easily recognized as bars, stores and even a small clinic.

What caught your eye, however, was a small set of metal stairs leading deeper into the cave lit up a pink sign hanging overhead that read "Diamond Moon Strip Club" in big neon letters. At the end of the stairs about forty feet below was a thin metal door and a guy in a suit and sunglass with a sour look on his face.

You had been on the road all day and could use some entertainment, but it might also be a good idea to resupply before you head out tomorrow. What'll it be?
1121.title: Big Charm

choices: [$80+ Spending Cash] Join the poker game
11211.content:
You walk over to a large trailer with a crude wooden sign that simply read "BAR" in big red letters hanging over one of the windows. As you walk up the wooden stairs to the front porch you begin to hear music coming from inside and are immediate hit with a wave of sound as you open the door and step inside.

It was louder than you though, but smooth enough that you could still hear the conversations of the various bar patrons gathered around you. The inside of the trailer was small, but not cramped due to the owner knocking down several walls to make the kitchen, living room and one of the bedrooms into one big area lined with couches and tables. There was even a small spot where patrons could play pool near the sealed off back door.

You walked down a short hallway past a door leading to the restroom and took a seat in the kitchen area where a pile of crates and old doors had been turned into a counter of sorts. The bartender was a middle aged guy with a brown mustache and a stylish bowler hat to cover up his receding hairline.

"What's your poison, stranger?" he asks cheerfully as he pours a drink for another customer.

Moonshine (4) $18

Glowing Water (4) $2

After about an hour of sitting at one of the couches you decide to have a look around see if anything was happening. As you head to the bathroom to take a quick piss you encounter a man in a suit selling fancy packaged condoms.

Condom (3) $15

===================

Everything was still the same though, guess you'll just have to pick something to check out...
11211.title: A Wastelander Walks Into A Bar...

choices: [Lucky] You have a pair of queens
You have a queen and a two of hearts
112111.content:
You head over to the guys playing poker and take a seat next to a man in a black cowboy hat and a woman in a very tight t-shirt. "Mind if I join the next round?" you ask as a fat man with a trimmed beard rakes in his winnings. "Sounds good to me, I could use some more sheep." he taunts as the others roll their eyes.

"Ignore the jackass, honey." the woman in the shirt says as she takes a sip of her Absinthe. "Two lucky hands and he thinks he owns the place. I've got a good feeling my next hand might shut him up though." You laugh as the man in the cowboy hat deals a fresh round of cards to everyone.

"Ante up." he calls as he puts a crinkled bill in the center of the table. Everyone follows suit, including yourself. "Wow, a ten dollar ante, you guys don't play for chump change I see." you say nervously as your opponents look over their hole cards. Before anyone can reply the fat man with the beard puts an extra fifty on the pile. "I raise." he says smugly.

"Damn! Shit the bed!" come the replies as the woman, the cowboy hat guy and a lean man in a torn tuxedo throw their cards into the center of the table. "Fold." they groan in unison as you look down at your own hole cards. You hadn't even checked them yet when you found yourself putting a fifty of your own into the now sizable pot. "I'm game if you are." you reply.

The man smirks as you finally lift up your two cards to see what you have. "I have a pair of aces loser. The point is to look at your cards before you call...but I'll be glad to take your cash." You don't reply and only give the man a smirk before continuing...
112111.title: Deal Me In

1121111.content:
You and the fat man stare each other down as the next five cards hit the table one by one. Both of you had long since gone all in and this hand was gonna decide who walked away rich and who walked away a chump. "No way you can beat me now, asshole." the fat man taunts when he sees an ace of spades drop.

"Don't be so sure." you reply as the last card is revealed, a queen of diamonds. You grin as the fat man wipes a bead of sweat from his forehead. "No way did I lose this bitch." he sneers as he flips his hole cards. True to his word, he had two aces, clubs and diamonds, which were now a three of a kind. "Impressive, getting two aces right at the start, plus another just now." you reply as you look down at the queen on the table.

"Quick staling asshole, show us your shitty hand." the fat man growls as you continue to smile. You flip over your two queens and fatty goes pale in the face when he notices the OTHER queen that came right before his precious ace. "Queen of spades, queen of diamonds...along with my two beautiful hole queens..." you smirk as the other players gasp in surprise. "Four of a kind, motherfucker."

The other gamblers immediately begin cheering as you scoop up your winnings and return your cards to the deck. "I'd love to stay for a few more hands, but I just got a shitload of drinkin' money." you reply as you put your cash away and say goodbye to the other gamblers. The loser with the trimmed beard merely crossed his arms and told you he'd fuck you up next time. "Til' then, I guess." you reply as you head out the door.

[You gain $175]

With a freshly fat wallet and a sense of proud accomplishment you head back to the Boxa Nova Hotel for a well-deserved rest. The next days flies by quickly as you and your new caravan buddies get back on the road and finish your long journey to Scrap City. After waving goodbye you split up and head to the Bluebrick Hotel alone. An old buddy of yours ran the place and made sure you had a comfortable room for the night. Pretty soon you fell asleep in the nicest bed you'd had in a long while.
1121111.title: Cashing Out

1121112.content:
You try to hide your displeasure at your hole cards but it was clear from his smirk that fatty know you had made a grave mistake. "It ain't over yet." you say calmly as you toss another ten onto the pot. "It will be soon, I raise again." comes the reply with a moments hesitation. This guy really was playing for keeps.

The next card hits the table... a four of clubs. Useless. You pick up the deck and get ready to deal the next hand, knowing that if you didn't get something soon this would all be over. "What do you say we cut the bullshit and go all in?" you ask confidently as you push your remaining money into the pot. "You're on." the fat guy replies with a sneer.
1121112.title: All Or Nothing

11211121.content:
You distract your opponent just long enough to slip a two of spades over the deck for the next round. "Oh, look at that, now I've got a pair!" you say smugly as the card hits the table. "My pair is still better." grumbles the fat guy as you hand him the deck for his deal after slipping a few more cards on top. The last three cards then hit the table.

Two queens and another two. "What have you got?" you ask as the fat guy flips his hole cards. "Two pair, aces and twos. What about you bitch?" The whole table falls silent as you flip over your own hole cards. You grin as the others gasp in surprise. "A two and a queen. Along with the two and queens on the table I'd say I have a full house."

"No fuckin' way!" the fat guy curses as you scoop up your winnings. The other players begin clapping as you smile and pocket your cash. "That was fun, but I think I'll call it quits for the night. See you around." you call as you head for the door. The last thing you hear on your way out is the fat guy swearing to beat you next time. That didn't matter now though, as you were only concerned with getting back to the Boxa Nova Hotel for a good nights rest.

[You gain $175.]

After the morning came it wasn't long before you and your new caravan buddies were back on the road again. There wasn't much to talk about but you soon arrived at Scrap City just as the sun was beginning to set. After a few minutes of goodbyes you headed straight for the Bluebrick Hotel to meet up with an old friend of yours. He owned the place and gave you a free room to stay in while you were visiting Scrap City. You hardly have time to talk, however, and quickly found yourself drifting off to sleep.
11211121.title: No Luck Involved

11211122.content:
You knew it was too risky to try anything with everyone's eyes on you and play out the rest of the game fairly. Unfortunately, this proves to be your undoing. You manage to get two more queens for a nice three of a kind, but another ace means fatty also has a three of a kind, a higher one unfortunately. You both turn over your cards even though you already know the outcome. The fat lady sings and the fat man grins from ear to ear as he takes your cash.

"Damn close, I'll give you that... but we both knew right from the start that my aces were gonna win this." he says as you sigh and get up from the table. You'd love to earn your cash back but there was no way you were gonna recover from a loss like that... if only you hadn't gone all in. "Hey, better luck next time sweetie." the woman calls as she takes another sip of her drink. "Yeah, sorry you had such bad luck on your first hand." the tuxedo guy adds.

[You lose $80]

"Thanks, I'll see you all around." you reply as you wave goodbye and head back to the Boxa Nova Hotel. The next day went by fast as you and your caravan buddies got back on the road. After nearly a day of travelling you then came upon Scrap City just as the sun was beginning to set. :Thanks for the ride everyone, good luck with the wedding." you shout as the caravan rides off to their destination.

You continued on alone and soon arrived at the Bluebrick Hotel. You weren't exactly rolling in cash at the moment so it was a good thing the owner was an old friend who let you have a free room. Catching up would have to wait though, as you were tired from the events of the past day and quickly fell asleep.
11211122.title: Busted!

choices: [Melee 4] Hustle her with some fancy trick shots
112112.content:
You walk over to the pool table just as everyone was finishing setting everything up. "Howdy friends, mind if I jump in for a game or two?" you ask as a large fat man in a cowboy hat and leather jacket takes his first shot. "Sure, I'll play a couple games with you handsome." comes the reply of a blonde woman in a leather jacket similar to the fat guy.

"Just be careful not to wager any money on your game." says a man with a handlebar mustache and bandana as he slumps over in a nearby seat. "She took me for damn near a hundred bucks." The woman just smiles and handles you a pool cue. "Don't worry, I'll go easy on you. It's not fun to crush the newbies."

You laugh and stand back as the next guy takes his shot while chatting with the woman. After just a few minutes its your turn to play a game so you and the woman step up and you take your first shot. You hadn't played a huge amount of pool before, but you did know the rules and a few tricks well enough.

Unfortunately, you lose the game as the woman takes her final shot and claims victory. "Not bad for a beginner, want to play another round?" she asks as she resets the table. "I'm not so sure, but I guess I can't say no if you think I'm just a beginner." you chuckle as you move in for your first shot.
112112.title: Pool Party

1121121.content:
You get ready to line up your first shot, but pause and turn to the woman with a slight grin on your face. "What do you say we put a little money on this game, I'm just a beginner, right?" Before she can answer you take your first shot and the game begins. The woman gives you a smile as she looks over the pool table. "I'm in." she replies as she gets ready to take her own shot.

After a few games you come out ahead, with only two losses (one of which you threw on purpose to divert suspicion) and three wins. "Well damn, honey. I guess you aren't just a newbie at this after all, that or you're extremely lucky." the woman says as she tosses a few bills onto the table. "Either way, I lost fair and square. Guess I'll have to earn some more beer money in my next game."

You laugh as you hand your pool cue to the next player and count up your cash. "Thanks for the games. It was real close but I guess I'm just a really fast learner." you say as you head for the door. "It was fun for me too, I'll play you again if you're ever in the neighborhood." the woman replies as she takes her first shot against the new guy.

[You gain $200]

You smile to yourself as you put your hard won money away and head back to the Boxa Nova Hotel. You were out pretty late but you still manage to wake up at around noon the next day and head off with your new caravan buddies to finish your trip to Scrap City. Just as the sun begins to set you see the giant settlement appear on the horizon.

After taking a few minutes to say goodbye to your new friends you head to the Bluebrick Hotel where your old friend was waiting with a free room. Catching up would have to wait until later however, as you were too tired from your journey to stay awake for much longer and soon fell asleep in a nice comfortable bed.
1121121.title: Shark Attack

1121122.content: You play a few more games and even manage to win one of them before deciding to call it quits for the night. You hand the pool cue to the next person waiting to play and head back to the Boxa Nova Hotel. Sleep comes pretty fast and you soon find yourself waking up around noon the next day.
1121122.title: In Progress

112113.content:
You decide to see what the miner is bummed out about since you've had a decent amount of experience in mining yourself. You pull up a seat and offer a slight smile as the man takes a long drink out of his mug and lets out a sigh.

The plan is to get in and get out quick as we can, but you never know out here."

After a few more minutes of driving you reach the passage and bask in the cool shade of the towering rock walls. The place wasn't as narrow as you had expected but still pretty creepy. A few dens, burrows and bone piles could be seen just off the road, most animals but also a few that looked distinctly human.

Kyle raises a finger to his lips and and whispers to keep your voice down until you're back out in the open. Up ahead near a large cavern opening was the remains of a massacre spread out from the road all the way to the mouth of the cave. Dead horses, half eaten bodies, bags and boxes strewn about and a large trail of blood leading deeper inside the nearby rock tunnels. This was the place.

"Okay, we'll only have a half hour or so at the most to grab stuff so lets secure what we can to the jeep and then collect some smaller stuff." Kyle whispers as he shuts off the engine and opens the door. You nod your head and follow him up to the ruined caravan, revolver ready to draw at the first sign of trouble.

It didn't take long for Kyle to find and secure Rob's body, which had been almost torn to shreds along with both his children. As for Rob's poor wife all you managed to recover was her severed head. "Jesus, I'm sorry Kyle. I don't thing we'll be able to find any more of them." you say as you step over a severed arm clutching a kitchen knife. Kyle merely nods his head and covers the remains with a sheet before tossing them in the back seat of the jeep.

"That takes care of the personal stuff. We still got about ten minutes to grab what we can. Hurry up and let's get the fuck out of this godforsaken place." he replies as he grabs a duffel bag from behind his seat. You nod your head and begin looking around...
113211.title: Picking Up The Pieces

1132111.content:
"Woah, are you fucking crazy?" Kyle whispers when he notices you walking over to the mouth of the cave. "I'm gonna take a quick look inside and see what I can grab. These hoof prints indicate that at least two of the horses fled inside, which means most of their supplies are likely to be in good condition. Don't worry, I know how to be careful." you reply as Kyle shakes his head and lets out a week laugh.

"Hey, its your funeral. I'm staying by our ticket out of here and booking it at the first sign of noise. If you can't make it back without any new friends I'll be forced to leave you. We clear?" he replies as he stuffs a small first aid kit into his duffel bag. You turn and give him a thumbs up along with a confident smile. He merely rolls his eyes and resumes scavenging.

The inside of the cavern was dark, but you dared not risk any sort of light. With night fast approaching you'd need to focus on the areas that were still lit up by beams of light peering in through cracks and the mouth of the cavern itself. Even in the dim interior of the rocky room ahead you could make out a few slender shadows.

"Seems I've found the Nightcrawlers..." you think to yourself as you step over a puddle of water and grab a stalactite for support as you crossed over a jagged pile of rubble. You had seen these nasty creatures before during your mining days, though you had only directly encountered them twice. They were large worm-like lizards with eight legs, clawed hands and large jaws lined with sharp teeth.

Killing one or two was no big deal if you knew their weaknesses, even a dozen would be manageable with soon good backup, but taking on a whole nest with just a revolver? Suicide. You were far too deep inside now to run if they woke up and with Kyle leaving at the first sign of noise you wouldn't have any form of escape even if you did somehow make it back outside. To survive this you would have to be quick and quiet.

You let out a small sigh of relief when you see a headless horse carcass propped up against a boulder up ahead. In front of the horse remains was a mangled man in a cowboy hat who had large chunks torn from his body. It was a grisly sight, but the saddle bags strapped to the horse proved you had made the right decision in coming inside to loot supplies. With a few careful steps you passed a slumbering Nightcrawler and bent down to check what the saddle bags contained.

In addition to basic goods like books and socks was a bit of advanced tech and some chemicals stored in tiny vials. You take some of the more valuable stuff and look over the exotic remaining loot to see if you could figure out what was worth taking. After a few minutes you pack up what you can and prepare to head back out to meet up with Kyle.

[If you have the Drug Crafter perk you may add 2 Steroids and 2 LSD to your inventory.]

[If you have the Explosive Crafter perk you may add 3 TNT and 1 Homemade Bomb to your inventory.]

[Add 2 Bitter Root, 3 Condoms, 1 Silencer, 1 Lab Coat, 1 Stylish Sunglasses, 1 Wasteland Herbs and 5 Junk to your inventory.]

On your way out you carefully step over another sleeping Nightcrawler and gently step down from a small cliff onto the lower floor of the cave that led outside. You grin as you step back into the warm air and notice Kyle securing the last of his loot in the back seat of the jeep. You wait a few seconds for him to turn around and then hold up a few of the items you found on the dead horse.

"Damn. I thought you couldn't do it... I thought for sure I'll be pulling outta that mess alone and leaving you to the Nightcrawlers. That was some damn impressive work you pulled off." Kyle says in an impressed tone as he starts yo the jeep. "Now hop in and lets get out of here. I still gotta drop you off at Scrap City before I can head back with my haul."

You nod and get inside as a few noises echo from the caves. "Nice timing..." Kyle mumbles as he pulls away from the ruined caravan and speeds down the road. It is already dark by the time you reach Scrap City, but the rest of the trip was smooth and uneventful. "Take care of yourself and thanks for helping me out back there. It was damn good working with ya." Kyle calls as he lights up a smoke and drives off into the night. "See ya!" you call back as you turn to look over the sprawling metropolis in front of you.

Since you didn't have anyway to carry or transport the excess goods you found at the caravan wreck you had to work out a deal with Kyle on the way here. He offered you a flat one hundred dollars for your share but when you pointed out that a lot of it was near mint condition stuff taken from the cave he agreed to throw in a little extra. Just as well, honestly, as you had no use for half the stuff you found, though you did keep a few of the more practical goods for your journey.

[You gain $125.]

As much as you wanted to hit the town after finally arriving you were exhausted from everything you had done today and headed straight for the Bluebrick Hotel to get a good nights rest. Your old friend owned the place and gave you a free room to crash at. Within minutes you were sound asleep and ready for a new day of adventure.
1132111.title: Getting The Goods

1132112.content:
You spend the next ten minutes picking over dead bodies and opening various bags and containers. The smell was the biggest problem, though the buzzing insects and pests swarming over some of the riper corpses were no picnic either. You had to keep one hand over your mouth at all times just to keep from gagging or throwing up. This made it a lot harder to search but you still found some good stuff.

[Add 2 Cans Of Beer, 1 Wasteland Herbs, 1 Condom, 1 Motorcycle Helmet and 1 Car Battery to your inventory.]

"Alright, that should be enough, let's hit it." Kyle calls as he loads a small wooden box into the back of the jeep and hops into the driver seat. "Alright, I'm coming." you call back as you pick up a bag of scrap and head over to join him. You put the stuff you found in the back next to Kyle's loot and climb into the passenger seat. "Good haul?" he asked as he lit a cigarette. "Can't complain." you replied. "You?"

Kyle exhales a plume of smoke and smiles. "Pretty good, I found some vintage shit that'll pull in a couple hundred easy if I can find the right buyer. Since you'll be traveling on foot I'll also buy your half of the loot for a fair price if you want." You nod your head and loot back at the loot you managed to recover. "Sure, I already took out the stuff I want to keep. You can have the rest for... say, seventy five bucks?" Kyle smile as he pulled out of the passage and back out into the setting sun.

"Tell you what, I'll give you an even hundred for helping me find my buddy's family. I can probably get at least that much for your haul even if its mostly junk." he replies as he turns the CD player back on. "Sounds good to me. A little extra spending money is just what I'll need once I get to the city." you say as you look out at the passing hills and barren fields.

[You gain $100.]

It's already night when you arrive at Scrap City, but the rest of the trip was uneventful so you didn't mind. After saying your goodbyes to Kyle and wishing him luck you headed over to the Bluebrick Hotel. An old friend of yours ran the place and gave you a free room to stay at during your time in the city. You thanked him and retired to your bed for the night, exhausted from your long journey. As you drifted off to sleep you thought of the next phase of your trip and about what future rewards fate would have in store for you.
1132112.title: A Good Haul

113212.content:
Two mercenaries decked out in thick combat armor and helmets walked in front of you at a leisurely pace with their weapons drawn and ready for action. You hadn't talked much with them since you negotiated terms about an hour ago, but you had learned that their names were Brie and Alexander. They were both seasoned mercs and had known each other for roughly a year now since they both joined up with the Silverpine Outpost around the same time.

The sky was getting a bit darker and from the looks of things your two bodyguards were looking to go around the outer edge of the pass to avoid the Nightcrawler nests. You didn't like the idea of camping for the night, but it was probably your best option at this point. Traveling around in the dark could be dangerous in an area like this and camping too close to the city would probably get all your throats slit in your sleep by bandits.

"We'll more for about another hour, then find a spot to make camp." Alexander called back to you as he looked over the towering stone that made up the passage. "If we keep moving we'll be able to cut around the pass in the morning and make to Scrap City tomorrow." You nodded your head to show you understood and put a hand on your revolver as you looked over the surrounding open wastes.

There wasn't a lot of cover in this area, which would make it hard to find a good camping spot. Brie had what looked like a small tarp on her back which would make a decent tent, though that was about it. None of you even had any good sleeping bags. What bothered you the most wasn't the discomfort though, it was the danger. Nightcrawlers loved to hunt in packs, but some were solitary enough to catch prey on their own. If one found its way to your camp in the night you'd be in trouble.

After a modest supper at the base of a crumbling cliff you all decided it was a good time to begin looking for a campsite. You had about an hour of daylight left and would need to find someplace safe and secure. Alexander suggested that you move up ahead along the passage to find a snug little corner at the base of the cliffside. Brie liked the idea, but was concerned about stumbling across a small Nightcrawler nest and suggested they find a spot further out away from the passage.

You didn't think either option sounded particularly great, but both mercs looked at you to be the tiebreaker. Alexander had a point that the rock wall would give great protection, though Bries concerns over stray Nightcrawlers was extremely valid. Staying out in the open would eliminate the Nightcrawler danger, but the group would be sitting ducks if some other form of trouble came across them.

With night fast approaching you'd have to made a decision soon...
113212.title: Passing The Passage

choices: [Melee 3] Try to fight off the Nightcrawlers
Try to fight off the Nightcrawlers
1132121.content:
After spending several minutes walking along the jagged side of the rocky passage you came across a small vein of Glowing Ore that had been embedded into the face of the rock at some point in the past. Normally, you would smile at your good fortune, but part of the deal you struck with the mercs was relinquishing all valuables the group finds to them. You sigh as Alexander pulls a pick from his belt and chips a few chucks of the ore free.

"See, I told you this was the best choice!" he says happily as he splits his small fortune with his friend. "Yeah, good call Alex." Brie replies as she packs away her share of the tiny greenish rocks. You fold your arms and wait for them to get done celebrating when she tosses you a spare chunk of the ore. "Huh? What's this for?" you ask as you catch the tiny rock. "Me and Alex just made a thousand dollars easily, more than enough to cover this trip. I figure you might need some cash once you get to Scrap City, it's a bad place to be broke." she replies with a smile.

[You gain 1 Glowing Ore.]

You thank her as you pocket the valuable little space stone and continue onward as the sun sets in the night sky. Thankfully, it doesn't take long to find a nice little bend in the rock formation that gave you perfect cover from both the weather and any random rock slides. It almost seemed too good to be true but there it was. "There. That's the spot!" Alexander said happily as he walked under the smooth rock and set his supplies down.

"Nice find." Brie says as she walks over and sets her own pack down right beside his. "We found this place just in time. I'll get a fire going while you guys set up camp." You and Alexander both nod your heads in unison as he begins taking some supplies out of his pack. The three of you then get to work making your new little home a little more livable.

When you were all done a nice sizzling fire was cracking and popping in the cold inky blackness of the night and a nice warm blanket was spread out over the hard ground. The thing was old and tattered, but it would make a nice comfortable bed for the evening. Brie even had a long folded up pillow you could all use packed away, which was a nice bonus.

With everything nicely put into place Alexander pulled out an old bottle of scotch from his pack and poured everyone a drink. There was only about half a bottle left, so it went quickly, but it was a nice taste of luxury you hadn't expected. You all spent the next several hours talking about what you would do with your newfound wealth and what you hoped the future held as you got ready for bed.

The night went by peacefully for the first few hours, not so much as a peep from any vermin or insects... but at about three in the morning disaster struck. A loud scream shook you out of your tranquil sleep and you immediately went for your gun. The voice was immediately familiar, it was Brie screaming her lungs out as something skittering just beyond the long extinguished campfire menaced her in the darkness.

"Fuck! FUCK! I can't see!" you shouted as you raised the revolver in the pitch blackness of the morning as another scream broke out from slightly further away. Immediately, a spark of light erupted from a tiny lighter as Alexander got out of bed. "I'll light the campfire! Help Brie, goddamn it!" he yelled as he rushed over and ignited the ashy remains of the once roaring flame.

You fire off a shot in the night sky, hoping to either scare off or at least get a better look at your target. No such luck. You dashed past the fire Alexander was making and tried to follow the screaming. In all this darkness it was hard to find your mark, but a loud gasp of pain clued you in to where Brie was. You knew you couldn't hope to properly hit whatever monster had caught Brie without risking a fatal shot on her so you grab a heavy rock on the ground and ran over to her.

A hiss passed the lips of a hungry Nightcrawler as it loosened its grip on its potential prey and lashed out at you from void. A quick shot gave you a brief look at its hungry face and Brie's shaking form mere feet away. You quickly nailed the creature with a follow up shot that took off a nice chunk of its head. The thing feel to the ground with a thud as you rushed over to Brie with your rock and revolver still in hand.

You were about to ask if she was okay when you heard more skittering legs coming closer. You were surrounded...
1132121.title: Cliffside Camp

11321211.content:
There were only a few of them, no more than three or four at the most, but you were starting to run low on bullets and Brie was likely out of commission for the foreseeable future, if not bleeding out or dying. "Shit..." you cursed under your breath as a Nightcrawler suddenly lunged at you. You pulled the trigger twice on your revolver and felt slightly relieved as the beast collapsed to the dirt mere inches from your feet.

Brie was moaning softly as the others went in for the kill and you rushed over to defend her. You had maybe one bullet left in the chamber and no time to reload so you waited for the creatures to make their move first. A final shot rang out before you clicked on an empty chamber... and one more Nightcrawler hit the dirt on the edge of your vision. You eyes were a bit more adjusted to the darkness now and aided by the growing light of the campfire flame... hopefully, it would be enough.

"Help me..." Brie cried out in a weakened voiced as the two remaining Nightcrawlers closed in on their prey. "Shit, this isn't gonna be fun." you groan as make a desperate swing with your revolver. To your surprise it grazes the body of the nearest crawler causes it to hiss aggressively at you. Without missing a beat you then follow up with the rock in your other hand and bash the bastard's brains in. It sinks to the ground and twitches as you finish it off with a stomp.

A fresh scream then escapes Brie's lips as the last Nightcrawler bites down on her hand. You immediately rush over to help swing for the crawler's head. Unfortunately, it let's go of brie at the last second and pounces on you. The surprise attack knocks you off your feet and sends your revolver rolling off into the dirt. The thing attempts to rip out your throat, but you manage to shove your rock into its mouth and throw it off before it can slash or bite you.

You try to get Brie to her feet while the Nightcralwer writhes on the ground. Then a single burst of gunfire cuts through the night and sends streaks of gooey mutant insides splattering over the nearby rocks and ground. Alexander said nothing as he moved over to you as quick as he was able in the dim light. "We're over here, Brie's hurt!" you call out to him as he nearly trips on a tall rock.

"Brie, oh my god, I'm so sorry..." Alexander blurts out as he get his partner back on her feet and you move back over to the campsite. Brie was just barely conscious and had lost a lot of blood from two separate bite wounds on her left hand and arm. That was probably for the best, however, as Nightcrawler saliva, while mildly venomous on it's own, was filled with deadly bacteria and germs.

As you both stretch her out over the makeshift bed Alexander begins sobbing as he finally sees the damage done to his friend in the light of the fresh campfire. Her fingers were already red, swollen and puffy and the skin around the bite wounds was slowly becoming discolored and bruised. "We've gotta take off the hand..." Alex choked out finally as he pulled a hatchet out and sterilized it with the last few sips of scotch in the bottle you all enjoyed earlier.

"I'll hold her down and keep her steady." you replied in as comforting a tone as you could manage. Alexander only nodded his head as he wiped away his tears and laid out her arm over a fresh cloth. Thankfully, Brie had passed out from shock, blood loss, trauma or all three and wouldn't be awake for this. With a few careful yet swift whacks her hand and the damaged part of her arm as severed about seven inches below the elbow.

The resulting wound was the cauterized with a spare log from the fire and bandaged. It wasn't pretty in the slightest, but it would do until she could get proper medical treatment and probably let her keep most of her arm. You quickly disposed of the now purplish-red hand away from the camp as Alexander watched over his sleeping friend.

Neither of you managed to get anymore sleep that morning, but that was the least of your worries. Brie woke up to Alexander applying a fresh bandage on her stump and broke down in tears as he held her close. There was little you could do but watch and pack up camp as Alex got Brie ready to finish the last mile of this little road trip. By noon you were all packed and ready to head out.

"It's all my fault. If I had just listened to Brie she'd be okay right now. We'd all be okay." Alexander moaned as he wiped some fresh tears from his eyes. "You don't know that." you replied as you looked out across the winding edge of the passage. "If we hadn't camped there we might have all died. You could have saved Brie's life with your choice." Alex lets out a bitter laugh as he gathers up his supplies.

"Yeah, I'm a real hero. I'm glad you sided with me." he replies in a darkly sarcastic tone. At this point Brie gets to her feet and walks over with an upset look on her face. "Hey Alex, you know that's not fair!" she says in an upset yet calm tone. "We survived the night and got a good haul. Once we sell off this Glowing Ore I'll be able to afford any surgery or medicine I might still need... maybe even get a prosthetic augmentation. I've had my eye on a certain model for a while now." She then finishes by giving a soft laugh and putting her good hand on Alex's shoulder.

He looks up at her and you can't tell if he smiles or frowns. "Heh, I guess we could go that." he finally replies back as you walk ahead to give them a little space. "A cyber arm might come in handy during our next job. I always thought the ones with the retractable blades were pretty cool... it'd definitely make you look like a badass. Well, more of a badass..."

They both share a laugh as you begin heading around the other end of the rocky passage back towards the road. As unpleasant as this little detour was, it didn't delay you by much. In another hour or two you'd be back on the road and it in the next five to seven hours you should finally arrive at Scrap City.

Sure enough, just over six hours later you were moving along the outskirts of the city under the early evening sky. You were glad you managed to make it before nightfall, another night of camping might have just sent you off the deep end, Nightcrawlers or not.
