You slow your pace a little as you allow your companions to catch up and gather near a rusted fence running along the side of the road leading out of the city.

"Thanks for the help, I don't think I could have made it without you." you say as you dig out the piece of Glowing Ore they gave you the other day. "I've got plenty of cash, if you need this to help pay medical bills go ahead and take it." They both exchange glances and smile as Brie folds your hand over it. "That's sweet of you to offer, but we'll be fine. We both got a plenty big haul, besides I want to thank you for saving my life."

You give them both a smile and wave goodbye as you each head down separate streets. "Take care of yourselves." you call out. "Hey, we're a couple of seasoned mercs, give us some credit, waster!" Brie calls back playfully as Alexander lets out one last little chuckle. Even after everything that happened you feel like those two will be alright, especially with their newfound riches. Speaking of which, you had your own fortune to seek.

After a short stroll to a towering building located deeper inside the city you breathe a sigh of relief and head inside. An old friend of yours ran this place, the Bluebrick Hotel, and would set you up with a free room while you prepared for the next leg of your journey. As much as you wanted to chat and catch up you were exhausted and immediately crashed in your snug hotel bed for the night.
11321211.title: Give Her A Hand

1132122.content:
You gave Alexander a shrug and a nod to Brie. "Alright, we'll go find a spot out in the wastes." you say as you point towards the western skyline. "Let's just hurry up, we'll be in deep shit if we get stuck out in the open without any light." Alexander let's out a soft groan as Brie gives you a smile and a wink. " I see our new friend here is more than just a pretty face." she replies as she takes the lead and you all begin marching away from the side of the passage.

After several minutes of walking you noticed a small structure sticking out of a wispy sand dune about two or three hundred feet away. It was hard to make out in the dim light, but it might just be what you were all looking for. "Nice find." Brie replies in a somewhat flirty sounding tone as you all begin walking over to it. "Let's see what we got." Alexander replies.

As you get closer it becomes clear that the object is a ransacked wooden wagon, a somewhat uncommon sight in this part of the wasteland due to the scarcity of horses and other critters that could pull them. It looked like it had been out here for years, maybe even decades judging from its chipped wooden frame and faded torn cloth. The wheels were made of metal but had long since rusted and the only signs of its former inhabitants were sun bleached bones strewn about in the surrounding area.

"Yeesh, talk about a nasty bandit attack." Brie said suddenly to break the eerie silence. "Just look at the arrows sticking out of this thing, whoever did this nailed the driver right in the left temple from the looks of it." In the fading light to was a bit hard to spot but it soon became apparent that Brie was right as you got closer. A lone skeleton stood at the helm of this once noble vessel, reigns still in hand and a thin broken arrow point out of his cracked skull. Lovely.

"Just keep an eye out." Alexander warned as he scanned the nearby surroundings for movement. "This looks like it happened a while back, but the people who did it could still be in the area. We'll have to set up camp here, it'll be too dark to move in another half hour, if that. At least we'll have some decent cover in that thing once we throw the tarp over it. No sleeping on the ground tonight.

"Relax, Alex." Brie teased playfully as she pulled an arrow from the wagon's side. "No way the asshole's that did this are still around, the nearest road is over a mile away from here. They'd have a pretty long walk if they wanted to come back, let's just get the camp set up and eat... I'm starving." Alexander merely rolled his eyes and started unpacking. "Give me a hand with this, will you?" he calls to you as he begins making a campfire.

You walk over and help him set up a proper campsite while Brie pulls the rest of the arrows out of your temporary home and gets the tarp set up. It didn't fully cover the destroyed roof of the wagon, but it would be good enough for a single night as long as it didn't rain or a sandstorm started kicking up. At the very least, it was better than sleeping on the ground.

You all enjoy a quick supper as you tell stories about what you planned to do once you reached Scrap City and have a quick look around the area before settling in. As you are looking around you and Brie stumble upon a small metal box uncovered by the sand near a small skull that resemble that of a young child or teenager. Gruesome, but you were never one to trun away free supplies.

Brie picks it up and brings it over to Alexander, who had better experience with locks than she did. It took him almost an hour to get the thing open, though the click of the rusted lock brought a quick smile to everyone's faces. You let out a sigh as he flips it open to reveal several magazines stacked inside, which counted as loot that you had offered to the mercs as part of your deal. You didn't expect to find much stuff so close to the city so it seemed like a smart offer, but now you felt like kicking yourself for not haggling better terms.

You enjoy the leftover food as Brie and Alexander divide up their shares of the bounty. "Here, you should take these." Alex says with a smile as he hands you a small stack of the magazines. "Are you sure? I promised to turn over stuff like this to you guys until we got to Scrap City as part of our deal." you reply in a somewhat confused tone. He laughs and holds up his own stack of magazines. "Don't worry, me and Brie found plenty of duplicates and thought you might enjoy having some reading material for the night."

You give him a smile as you put the gifts away for safekeeping. "Thanks, it's been about two or three years since I had some fresh books to read. These'll definitely be good to have during my down time while I'm in the city, you guys are pretty awesome traveling companions." you reply. Brie and Alex both smile as they put away their own stacks and head over to the wagon.

"Say, you wouldn't mind joining us in bed tonight, would you cutie?" Brie asks as she climbs into the back of the wagon. The suddenness of the proposal surprises you and catches you off guard. Despite the flirty tone she took earlier you figured she was just messin' around or trying to be polite for you agreeing with her... you hadn't expected her to be serious. "You don't mean you want me to accompany you by having a threesome, do you?" you reply in a slightly awkward tone. Subtlety was out the window.

"Why yes, I reckon we do." Brie says with a sweet laugh. "We got this comfy little shelter instead of the hard ground, why not enjoy ourselves a little?" she replies as take a swig of water. "It's cool with me." Alexander replies as he puts an arm around his friend. "It's been a while since I had a threesome, I wouldn't mind some double action for the night. Of course, it's cool if you wanna pass, we ain't gonna be insulted or anything."

You rub your chin as you glance over at the magazines the two gave you earlier. As nice as it would be to chill and get in some light reading before bed it wasn't every day you were offered a threesome by two reasonably attractive mercs in a dirty old wagon. It wouldn't be boring to just read a little, but it wouldn't be nearly as exciting as getting intimate with your new friends either.

[You may choose to have sex or not. If you do flip a coin. If the result is tails you get the Sprained Groin STD and -1 to your Speech skill for the next 3 pages.]

All all is said and done the three of you drift off to peaceful sleep in the back of the wagon and rest for several hours. Unfortunately, by the time you wake up you find yourselves in a bit of a pickle. A man with a thick bushy beard and eyepatch is watching you intently as you slowly open your eyes. Immediately, he smiles and waves with his free hand as his other hand clenches a makeshift spear made from a pair of knives attached to a broom handle.

"Mornin' sunshine. I didn't wake you did I?" he says with a laugh as a few of his buddies approached from outside. You stayed calm as they pulled down the tarp and sat up slowly as the bright morning sun washed over the wagon. "No screaming? No begging? Not even a little whimpering? You must be a seasoned waster, huh?" the man asks in a friendly tone as his crew share chuckles among themselves.

"What do you what?" you say evenly as you lowered your hand onto your revolver hidden beneath the covers of the fallen tarp. There were about a dozen guys surrounding you, all carrying melee weapons like baseball bats, golf clubs and crowbars. Easy to take out with your fully loaded revolver, but you'd only get half before the others would descend upon you... and that's if you managed six headshots in about three seconds.

"Just your loot, friend." the leader says as he stands up and hops off the wagon. "I'm Draco of the Slick 69s, you're not on our current shitlist so you can go if you hand over all of your valuables. Resist and we'll have to kill you, might even use a couple of you afterwards... got a few here into that shit. But you cooperate, you walk. You have my word."

You look around at the various gang members smirking and grinning at you. Most only wore leather jackets, t-shirts and vests, though a few had some basic armor. Metal pads, kevlar vests and one guy who was wearing an old gas mask with broken lenses. All easy enough to take down, but you were still outnumbered.

You should choose your next actions very carefully.
1132122.title: Out In The Open

11321221.content:
You grin and try to appear relaxed as Draco raises an eyebrow. "What the hell is so funny waster? We run shit out here, now hand over your goods or we'll start smashing your soft goods." he threatens as he leans on the front of the wagon. "You want to be the next asshole I run through with the end of this spear? If not, I suggest you wipe that smile off your face and wake your two buddies up, I doubt they'll wanna sleep through this shit."

As soon as he finishes the words you pull out your revolver and level it at his chest. "A gunshot'll wake them up pretty fast, so unless you wanna be today's alarm clock I suggest you and your crew fuck off before I get pissed and ventilate some of that smugness out a couple of new assholes for you." you reply as he grits his teeth and withdraws his spear.

"What the fuck? What kind of psycho sleeps with their weapon like that?" Draco growls as he followers look at each other nervously. "I'm guessing you're just a petty street gang from the city, then?" you reply in a confident tone as you keep the barrel of you gun leveled right at his chest. "You're clearly only been out here a short time or you'd know that people who don't prepare end up dead. Am I right?"

Draco attempts to regain some of his composure as he grins wickedly. "Ha! You got us, I guess! No point in hiding it then, we aren't bandits... the Slick 69s are a street gang from the Old Town section of Scrap City. My brother Demon got caught with one of our leader's girls and I took the fall for him. Me and my group here were exiled until we can scrape together the funds to pay off my little brother's crime."

"Hmmm... I see. So you're just a bunch of street thugs then." you reply. "Tell you what, leave now and I won't call for reinforcements and fuck your little band of misfits up until they can't walk straight. Sound good?" Before Draco can answer you then fire a round into the sky and give him a nasty sneer. "Oops, there goes the warning shot, MY crew will be here within minutes."

"What the hell was that?" Alexander says as he shoots up out of bed as Brie yells out in surprise. "You may have us surrounded, but my guys can hold yours off easy until the back up gets here. Better run." you taunt as Alexander looks around in shock. "Who the hell are these assholes?!" he demands furiously as he looks over to where his and Brie's supplies were.

"KILL THEM!!!" Draco suddenly screams as you rush to your feet and fire your revolver. Two shots hit him square in the chest as Brie goes for her gun. "They killed the boss, fuck em' up!" comes the scream from one of the Slick 69s as he swings at you with a nailboard. "Shit, get your guns!" you shout as you blow the guy away anong with another behind him who was advancing towards Brie.

"Shit, I'll help you hold them off, grab our guns Brie!" Alexander calls as he catches the lead pipe one of the gang members swings at his face and punches the guy in the throat, disarming him in the process. The others close in as you fire off another bullet into the face of a woman who was about a second away from stabbing Brie with her machete. "Cover her!" Alexander shouts as he hops off the side of the wagon to engage the remaining fighters as they close in.

"Shit, there's too many for you to handle!" You call as you rush over and shoot a guy that was about to bat Alex aside with his sledgehammer. Two skinny young twins rush in as he backs up against the wagon and swing their weapons. He catches the first on his pipe and kicks him away but the second manages to swing his sickle in the opening and aim it right at Alex's face.

You pull the trigger on your gun again, but it clicks on an empty chamber. "Fuck, I'm out!" you curse as the edge of the blade cuts through the flesh along Alexander's face. He screams in pain and rage as he then cave in the skull of the sickle guy with one mighty blow of his pipe, twisting it in a curve near the end. "Alex!" Brie screams in horror as she opens fire with her shotgun.

A couple of heads pop like watermelons as the buckshot finds its mark and you hop down to grab a melee weapon. The others circle around the wagon towards Alexander as Brie rushes over, firing another shot into the face of the guy in the (now mangled) gas mask. She tosses him his rifle as you pick up a dropped crowbar and smack the teeth out of a fat guy with a bunch of tattoos.

The last few remaining enemies attempt to muster a desperate last stand, but with Alex and Brie both fully armed they go down in seconds in a misty spray of red as their bullet riddled bodies hit the dirt. As the last guy, a blonde man with a mohawk, falls you lean back against the wagon for support and take a deep breath. "Fuck, that was pretty close... you guys okay?" you call in between pants.

A horrified gasp from Brie quickly answers you question as you remember the hit Alex took form the guy with the sickle. You turn around to find Brie in tears as blood pours down Alexander's face. "Is it bad?" he asks weakly as she slumps to the ground against the side of the wagon. The hit bad been nonlethal, but the damage it did was still severe.

A long thin gash ran from the base of Alex's right cheek all the way through his eyebrow, stopping right at the base of his forehead. More concerning, however, was the ruined eye leaking long streaks of red down the side of his face. From the looks of things it had been sliced clean through the pupil and outer half of the eye. Not a pretty sight, even to a harden wastelander.

Brie begins crying softly as she bends down to hug Alexander. "I'm sorry, I'm so sorry... it's all my fault, I should have known better than to try camping out here. We should have stayed at the passage." she mumbles between sobs as you rest your hand on the wagon and toss your crowbar aside. If only you had an extra bullet in the chamber this might not have happened.

You help Brie lay Alexander down on the floor of the wagon as she digs some medical supplies out to treat his wounds. After cleaning up and bandaging the eye as best as she could you help her and Alex pack up. It was already morning and you'd be stuck out here again if you didn't get a move on back to the passage and get back on the highway. Luckily, Alexander was a tough mercenary and had no trouble keeping up pace with you and Brie as you found your way back onto the highway.
11321221.title: Eyes On The Prize

114.content:
You spend about an hour talking to passing caravans and traders before giving up on finding a group that you could accompany. Everyone either had no room or didn't feel like playing escort to someone with so little to offer to make it worthwhile. Ah well, you'd been out in the wasteland before and knew how to handle yourself when things got dangerous. So long as you had your revolver and packed supplies you'd do okay.

The only major downside was the fact that you didn't have a mount and would have to walk the entire way on foot. There were a few shortcuts to be found that could make your journey faster, but you didn't feel like taking the risk of going offroad. You knew most of the highway pretty well from your past journeys and had a good idea of where you could stop to rest and what places to avoid. Your trip would probably take an extra day or two, but it was a small price to pay to make sure you arrived in one piece.

The sun beat down on you as the afternoon passed by and you stopped to take a short rest in the shade of a crumbling billboard. You wiped a bead of sweat from your brow and took a quick sip of water while leaning against the base of a large rock. You were making good progress so far, if you kept this up you could still arrive in Scrap City and get back on schedule without any additional delays.

Once you were good and rested you got back onto the scorching hot blacktop of the highway and continued onward past the ruins of a roadside tollbooth. After about an hour on the road you came to your first real pit stop at the base of a large hill with a water tower on top. Trading Post 15, named after the route it was located on. The place was pretty small, but it had a trader and a small rest area for travelers to stay out. You could even rent a bed in the old barn out back if you had the money.

A young woman with a blonde ponytail smiles and waves to you as you walk off the road towards the main building. The place had once been a farmhouse until the roof collapsed and half the upper flood gave away during the end of the world. Luckily, the current residents knew how to fix things up and managed to salvage most of the rubble to make a nice little shack and wall around the garage, which is where they stored most of their supplies.

You smile and wave back to the woman as a guard in leather armor opens the little wooden gate for you and welcomes you to the settlement. "Hey, I think I seen you here before, you that scaver who trades junk out near Shady Woods Park?" he asks as you step inside and move over to the shade. You nod your head and take a sip of water as he closes the gate back and locks it shut.

"You know the rules, then. Don't steal, don't cause trouble and don't get piss drunk and break something. We just had a caravan pass through a week back full of rowdy drunkards, damn near tore a hole in the wall. We still sell booze, but Lucy knocked the price up a bit. She's in the garage if you want to trade." he replies as he moves back to his post. You thank him and head over to the open garage door where the woman you saw waving at you had set up a small table and some shelves lined with goods.

"Howdy, partner." she says with a smile as she notices you walk in. "I believe I saw you walking up the road a few minutes ago, you on your way to Scrap City by yourself?" You grin as you pull out your revolver and give the cylinder a spin. "Yep, don't worry about me, I know these roads pretty well." you reply. Lucy folds her arms as you put your weapon away and looks you over. "I don't doubt it, I've seen you stop by before, but the roads are pretty dangerous these days. Just had a bandit attack a few miles up the road a month back, killed five armed guards and about ten merchants."

You shake your head as you let out a sigh. "Yeah, I heard about that from a man in Shady Woods Park, stripped the bodies bare and just left them. Bastards even shot up the dogs, the kids and a couple of the horses. We could use more order on these roads, I hear some folks are even talking about starting up a united militia. We sure could use one." you reply as Lucy nods her head.

After a few seconds of silence Lucy pulls out a small metal box and unlocks it with a key. "I just got a fresh shipment of goods from one of the passing caravans, got plenty of food, booze and junk. I'll also buy any spare supplies you feel like selling." she says with a smile as you look over the shelves. She had a lot of merch for such a small settlement, definitely a few things you could use on the road.

"I don't have a lot of cash, but it can't hurt to take a look." you say as you dig out your money and count it up. "Show me what you have."

==============
Can Of Beer (4) $16
Moonshine (2) $33
Roasted Meat Chunk (3) $8
The Forgotten Dead $12
Ninja Boy And Gadget Girl $11
An Encyclopedia Of Wildlife Vol XXXI $38
==============

After perusing her wares you chat for a few minutes about the local news and caravan routes. "You know, it'll be getting dark before long and I hear there's a huge nightcrawler infestation somewhere along the road." Lucy says as she rests her hands on the counter. "Why don't you stay the night? It's safer than camping and I'll give you a good rate. Scrap City is still a few days away if you're moving on foot, so it'll be good to a have a peaceful nights rest. What do you say?"

You glance out the window at the beams of light reflected by the sun and growing shadows stretching across the nearby landscape. You had three or four more hours of light, which could be spent traveling, but Lucy had a point. Without much in the way of camping supplies and no practical shelter for miles it would be pretty dangerous to spend the night out in the wasteland. After a few moments of thought you make your decision.
114.title: Rest Stop

1141.content:
"Alright, I guess I'll stay for the evening." you say cheerfully as you hand Lucy a ten dollar bill. She smiles and hands you a red ticket with a small logo scrawled on it. "Thank you. Just take that over to the barn and the guard will let you inside. Take any spot you want, but don't bother the other guests. Have a good sleep." she replies as you pocket the ticket and head back outside. "You too." you call back on your way out.

It was still fairly early, but after such a long time walking in the hot sun you decided to just find a nice spot to chill for the rest of the day. You walk up the hill a shot ways to a man in leather armor standing guard over a faded barn with chipped paint and a few patched holes on the side. "Ticket please." he requests as you walk over. You pull out the ticket and show it to him, after which he pulls open the door for you. "Thank you, please enjoy your stay."

You nod and then head inside into the relative coolness of the barn. The place wasn't huge, but it was pretty cozy by wasteland standards. Most of the lower stalls had been stripped for materials to build dividing walls between six fairly large living areas. One was a sort of lobby or living room, with a few folding chairs and a small bookshelf stocked with old magazines. The other five were living quarters each stocked with a dresser, a footlocker, a mattress with a straw stuffed pillow, a table and a chair. Pretty basic, but you get what you pay for.

After finding your way to an unclaimed bed you secured your belongings in the footlocker and dresser and headed back out into the living area to meet with some of the other guests. There weren't many other people here at the moment, just a few workers on their way to a new job, a mother and her son heading towards the city to start a better life and an older man on his way to visit his sister at a settlement further down the road.

You had several hours to talk and exchange stories with the others as the sun slowly sets over the distant horizon. By the light of a small lantern you continued talking for around an hour in the dark before everyone decided to pack it in for the night and headed off to bed. The mattress and straw pillow weren't super comfy, but still better than trying to sleep outside and you managed to sleep peacefully during the night.

The next day you awoke to thin beams of sunlight crawling along your face through tiny holes in the far wall. With a yawn you quickly pack up your belongs and go to check out before it gets too late. On your way out of the barn you eye catches the bookshelf where about a dozen magazines were stacked neatly in a pile. You could easily steal one on your way out since no one else was around.

[You may add 1 Go Outside Monthly, 1 Workin' Indoors, 1 High Rollers Digest, 1 Doctor Bags And Pill Bottles, 1 Ninja Boy And Gadget Girl, or 1 The Forgotten Dead to your inventory. If your Stealth skill is 3 or higher you may also take 1 of the other magazines listed above as well.]

You head out in the warm early morning sun and check out with Lucy before heading back onto the road, hoping to put a few miles behind you before it gets too hot out. Luckily, the steep cliffsides on either side of the highway gave you a good amount of shade for an hour or so before you came back out into an open area that stretched for miles.

The next several hours pass by uneventfully as you move down the cracked and broken highway past the collapsed ruins of houses, trailers and shacks. Most were good for little more than firewood these days, but a few homes were still standing and looked tempting in the hot afternoon sun. Even if there was nothing to loot at least you could rest for a half hour or so.

After coming across a trailer home with a broken front door you decided it was just as good a place to stop as any and head up through the remains of the front yard past a rusted lawnmower and a few charred boards that looked like the remains of a dog house. Not the most inviting place, but that was what you had your revolver for. After peeking into the darkened interior through the thin cracks of a boarded up window you head over to the door.

With a single powerful tug you managed to pull it free of its hinges and stepped into a murky hallway that stunk of mildew and rotting wood. You had your revolver drawn in one hand and your lighter in the other to see your way around. Behind you were two doors, one that appeared to lead to a closet and one that led to what was likely a bedroom. In front of you was another door that probably led to a bathroom or perhaps another bedroom. Beyond that was what appeared to be a darkened kitchen at the very end of the hall.

You check the closet first, which was empty save for the tattered remains of an old coat, some rusted hangers and a magazine filled cardboard box that had fallen apart completely due to some sort of water leak. Bummer. After closing the door back you headed through the door behind you into what was indeed a bedroom, or at least the remains of one. Raggedy curtains hung from the windows like moss around the nailed plywood and scrap lumber. Aside from a dirty mattress, an empty dresser and a broken television set the room was another bust.

You sigh as you move through another door frame that lead into a small bathroom that was connect to the hallway. After checking the medicine cabinets you came up with some spare medications and a bit of spare change. Not a whole lot, but enough to make the trip inside worth it. You pocket the loot and do a quick sweep of the rest of the room to see if they was anything else hidden nearby.

[You gain 2 Unlabeled Bottle Of Pills and $3. If your Stealth skill is 3 or higher you also find a sealed drug stash in the back of the toilet tank and gain 2 Aspirin and 1 Premium Eye Drops.]

With this side of the house clear you step back out into the hallway and head into the kitchen. There was a little more light here and in the nearby living room but you stilled needed the lighter to make your way past an overturned chair in the middle of the floor. You seriously doubted that there was anything in the fridge, cabinets or microwave but checked anyway to make sure before moving on.

[If your Stealth skill is 2 or higher you notice a magazine stuck under some empty spice bottles. It's a bit faded, but still readable to be worth taking. You gain 1 Workin' Indoors.]

The living room was easy to search, just some broken furniture, a hollowed out television with a nest of bugs inside and a ceiling fan hanging from torn wires. Nothing of value whatsoever. Connected to the living room was a tiny hallway with two additional doors inside. One led into a side room and the other led to a room on the opposite side of the house. You checked the side room first and found yourself in some sort of small rec room.

Aside from a pool table and a couch was a large stack of boxes. Most contained things like old video games, board games, comics and books. Most of the goods were too damaged to be useful, but you managed to salvage a decent haul after about half an hour of careful searching. Once you were sure you found everything you headed through the door to the final room.

[You gain 1 Ninja Boy And Gadget Girl, 1 Guns And Gold: New Roads, 1 Pristine Cross Book and 1 Dice.]

The last room was another bedroom with the windows barricaded by the bed, mattress, dresser and a chair in addition to the boards nailed over the outside. Seems like whoever lived here really wanted to keep something out. Despite being a little disturbed you searched the room, including a small closet along the side wall. You found some more money, but little else. After doing one final sweep you pocket your findings and head back to the front door.

[You gain $16. If your Science skill is 3 or higher you noticed that an old VCR in the closet has a loose back and a hollowed out interior. After moving some of the inner parts aside you find another money stash hidden inside and gain an additional $45.]

As you head back out into the cooling wasteland air you notice the western sky turning a soft orangish pink on the far horizon. It would be getting dark out soon and you were pretty far from the next settlement. You rub your chin as you look back at the house and then to the road. Up ahead was a small burned out woods that could serve as a decent makeshift campsite if you knew how to set it up. Otherwise, it looked like you might be spending the night inside this worn down old home.
1141.title: A Profitable Detour

choices: Stay at the settlement tonight for tonight
Keep walking until you arrive at Scrap City
11411.content:
You figured that setting up a proper camping spot would be better than staying in a rundown house that could be infested with vermin. Sleeping on the ground under the starts would be be better than waking up to find a rat or snake gnawing on you for disturbing its nesting area. The last thing you needed was to catch some disease and end up bedridden for weeks while everyone else makes a claim to your old boss' fortune.

You settle into a small clearing near a large rock and roll out a thin blanket over the ground under a tall tree with moss growing along the side. You recognized from the strong odor that this particular species of moss grew a natural insect repellent and was safe to expose to human skin, quite the lucky find. You take a few chunks free and place them around the edges of your blanket before throwing a thin sheet over a broken tree branch. It wasn't pretty, but you now had a decent shelter to sleep in.

After gathering some spare wood to make a campfire you roast up a small supper and soon fell asleep in your makeshift tent. A few animals scurried past your campsite in the darkness, but kept their distance due to the smell of the moss masking your scent. By the time morning arrived you had gotten a full nights sleep without so much as a stray scorpion pestering you. After taking a half hour to pack up your supplies you headed back out onto the highway to continue your journey.

The day passed quickly and you soon found yourself at an old toll booth as evening set in. It wasn't very comfortable, but it was sturdy and secure enough to make a good spot to rest. Once again nothing bothered you and the morning came with a wave of warmness just like the previous night. You yawned and set out again in the early hours as light slowly returned to the world. By this point you were about halfway to Scrap City and still making good progress as far as you could tell.

At about an hour after noon, just when the heat was starting to get unbearable, you came across a large caravan bus parked along the side of the road near an empty parking lot that sat in front of a collapsed general store. You smiled and waved to the traders as you walked up and took a free seat on a ring of folding chairs situated around a table. In exchange for letting them have all of the salvage from the store they agreed to let you have a free bottle of water and a snack while you took a break under a shady tarp they had set up over the roof of their bus.

Given that the long destroyed store was likely only good for scrap and maybe a few food items you figured it was a pretty good deal. Even if you wanted to fight them over it you were far too tired from walking to turn down their offer. For the next few hours you all talked and exchanged stories with each other. As it turned out, they had just made a big delivery of Glowing Ore in Scrap City and were heading out towards Brownsand to spend the huge stash of Caps they got in trade.

A few of them even offered to trade some spare supplies they had for cash to help fund the rest of their journey. As awesome as their caravan bus was, it needed fuel like any other vehicle and gas was in pretty short supply with so few people still able to make it. You didn't have a huge amount of cash yourself, but experience told it was better to be broke and supplied over rich and unprepared. After everyone finished their lunch a few guys lugged out some boxes from the trunk of the bus and began placing items from inside them onto the table.

====================
(8) Can Of Beer $9
(2) Anti-Venom $15
(5) Pack Of Cigarettes $10
(3) Condom $12
(2) Guns And Bullets Without The Bullshit $7
(3) Go Outside Monthly $6
(4) Workin' Indoors $6
An Encyclopedia Of Wildlife Vol XXXI $41
Stylish Sunglasses $43
Fingerless Gloves $32
Swiss Army Knife $57
====================

After packing things back up a few guys came back from the ruined store and turned over their findings to the lead caravaneer - a few bits of scrap, canned food and some salvageable electrical parts. Just as you thought, a bunch of useless junk. You waved goodbye as the crew packed up their gear and began driving off down the highway into the distance. With renewed stamina you headed off in the opposite direction towards Scrap City and your own fortune.

As night fell once again you set up a small bed in an abandoned RV that veered off the road and crashed into a tree some time in the past. Anything of value had already been looted long ago, but the place was still intact enough to be a passable shelter during what would likely be the last night of your journey before reaching Scrap City. It had been a good while since you had a chance to visit and you dreamed of seeing the massive settlement once again.

As you got out of bed the next morning you noticed a small lizard crawling along the burned husk of a nearby tree and put a round through its head from the door of the RV. Smiling at your good fortune you lit up a small fire and began roasting the sizable amount of meat you got off of it. After enjoying your modest breakfast you downed a fresh gulp of water and got back on the road. If you hurried you should at least make the outskirts of the city by nightfall.

You headed off the main highway for about a mile to avoid a roaming pack of wild mutant hounds that had taken down some sort of larger creature and were feasting on its carcass while some of their other members patrolled through the wrecked cars and trucks in search of more prey. You had seen a few mutant hound attacks in the past and they could get pretty vicious. That was actually a small settlement near Brownsand made up of farming families that lost a couple kids to a pack passing through the area.

Luckily, mutant hounds were very nomadic creatures and rarely stayed in one place for long before moving on in search of greener pastures. The only time they settled down was during the mating season or on the rare occasion they found a place with abundant prey and minimal larger predators to serve as a threat to the pack. If you avoided them and moved out of their temporary territory you should be find. These things were ruthless, but also smart enough to not attack stronger prey and risk losing members in a fight.

About an hour after your detour you headed back onto the main highway to get a move on since you were now behind schedule and didn't want to be caught outside in the dark again. The outskirts of Scrap City were probably more dangerous than the wasteland due to bandits, thugs, gangs and even slavers roaming around in search of easy marks. The only safe place to sleep at night would be with a caravan... and even then there was no guarantee that one of the bolder groups might attempt an attack anyway.

You looked up at the position of sun and figured you had about six to eight hours of daylight left, plenty of time if you hurried but dangerous if you ran into another detour so close to the city. There was a small settlement you could stay at nearby, but it was about four or five miles off the main highway. There was no way you'd get to Scrap City today if you stopped there for the night, but it would be a lot safer and free if you didn't mind staying in the common house instead of the motel.

As you walked you weighed your two options and came to a decision.
11411.title: Another Stop

114111.content:
The sun began to set just as you walked into town and most of the residents were heading inside for the night. The place wasn't huge but it still had a good amount of people for what was basically just a speed bump on the way to Scrap City. Most were farmers who grew crows in what little fertile dirt they could find and raised mutant animals for meat and labor. A few others dealt in minor repair work or scavenging, but that was about it.

A man with a scoped hunting rifle waved to you as you entered through the small wooden gateway at the bottom of the hill the small settlement was built on. It was a bit of a hike to get to the main buildings, but it was good exorcise. The motel had been there since before the end of the wood along with most of the various houses while the common house had been built roughly twenty years ago as part of some sort of housing initiative by the mayor.

The place wasn't very fancy, though it was sturdy and spacious, which was a pretty deal considering it was free. The motel would be a lot cleaner and far more comfortable... if you didn't mind paying for a room. You took a moment to rest as you looked over each building. It would be nice to stay in a relatively clean bedroom for a change. Of course, saving your money for later was probably the smart move in this situation... and the common house probably had a few interesting people to talk to.

You would consider camping out if not for the lack of open space due to the jagged rocks and cliff side of the surrounding area... and you doubted that any of the farmers would be happy to find you sleeping in their gardens or animal pens. For all of its charm and peaceful atmosphere this little village was a bit clostraphobic. Ah well, you'll be at Scrap City tomorrow and won't need to worry about finding a spot to sleep for much longer.

Where will you spend the night?
114111.title: Arrival At Dusk

1141111.content:
As much as you wanted to save your money the allure of a comfortable bed and a bit of luxury for a change was too great to resist. You head into the main lobby and greet an older man who was sitting behind a desk. He offers you an empty room on the second floor with a nice view of the town for twenty bucks a night. It was a bit pricier than you had hoped, but you could afford that for just one night.

You hand him the money and he gives you a key with the number 06 on it. "It's at the end of the walkway on the second floor, second door from the right. Can't miss it. Enjoy your stay." the man replies as he pockets your cash and begins filing some documents. You thank him and head back outside to where the staircase to the second floor was. The steps creaked a bit as you walked over them and you wondered how much longer this place would last before something would collapse.

Luckily, the rooms themselves seemed to be in much better condition. Aside from a thick layer of dust on the windows, some cracks and a bit of peeling paint you'd barely be able to tell that they endured the end of the world with very little damage. "Guess that's one of the perks of being in such a remote and guarded place." you chuckle to yourself as you walk over to the door with your key number and unlock it. "They just need to maintain their steps a bit better."

You smiled as a cool breeze from an air conditioning unit washed over you and stepped inside your temporary residence. You flicked a nearby light switch and a tiny overhead light bulb illuminated the small room with a dim glow. It seems old Wendell finally got their generators working properly again. Those things ran on specialized power cells and could probably keep this place juiced up for a thousand years if it needed to. One day you'd have to ask him where he found those things and get some for yourself.

That would have to wait for another day, however, as you were on a tight schedule as it is and intended to get some rest before heading out tomorrow morning. Still, it was every day you got to enjoy a bit of electricity and some comfy furniture. You place your gear at the foot of your bed and begin having a look around.

The first thing you noticed was a refrigerator in the corner near a microwave and a small broken oven. The fridge was was clearly powered as it had a thick steel lock on the side with a money slot. If you wanted some grub during your stay it looks like you'd have to pay for it. You didn't like the thought of spending more money, but it would be great to have some supper.

[You may pay $10 to the machine. If you do you find 2 Beers, 1 Purified Water and 1 Roasted Meat Chunk. You may add any of these items to your inventory. If your Science skill is 4 or higher you may access these items at no cost.]

After checking out the fridge you head into the bathroom. Next to a surprisingly clean toilet seat was a sink and a medicine cabinet. Inside the cabinet were a few bottles of medicine, some empty boxes, a toothbrush and a small bottle of what seemed to be a few drops of mouth wash. There were also a few stay mystery pills with no label or bottle to identify them.

[You gain 1 Aspirin. If you have the Drug Crafter Perk you also manage to make a stronger drug as well. Roll a D6. If the result is 1-2 you gain 1 Steroids, if the result is 3-4 you gain 1 3-Way, if the result is 5-6 you gain 1 Stonewall.]

With both the kitchen and bathroom out of the way you head back into the main bedroom and investigate the shelves and tables. There wasn't a whole lot here aside from some empty wrappers, some loose change and a couple worn out magazines that where falling apart from being read so much over the years. You figure that the motel wouldn't mind if you took some of this junk with you on your way out and put a few new items next to the rest of your gear.

[You gain $2, 1 Ninja Boy And Gadget Girl and 1 Guns And Bullets Without The Bullshit.]

With the entire area fully explored you decide to hop on the bed and get a few good hours of rest. Tomorrow would be a big day and you wanted to be fresh for your arrival in Scrap City. After a few minutes of relaxing on the soft sheets you dozed off and slept for about nine or ten hours before the sound of insects buzzing around outside woke you up. You yawned as you got up and gathered your things.

A tiny swarm of mutant flies picking at what appeared to be a dead lizard flew off as you opened the door and walked out into the warm early morning sun. You let out a sigh as you closed the door back and sealed off the refreshing air flowing from inside. You almost considered paying for another night, but knew getting on the road would be the best thing to do.

After turning in your key at the check out desk you headed back out into the town as the various farmers and scavengers got ready to go about their day. It really was a nice little place to visit, but a much larger settlement was waiting for you and you didn't wan to get stuck out during the hottest part of the day.

The rest of your journey went smoothly. After stopping to take a rest in the shade of a wrecked cargo truck you got back onto the main road and continued until you reached your destination. Scrap City came into view just as the sun began its descent over the horizon and you breathed a sigh of relief that you could avoid another day of camping out in the wastes. It had been a while since your last visit but you knew the streets pretty well and headed for a big building called the Bluebrick Hotel.

An old friend of yours ran the place and was happy to give you a free room during your stay in the city. You thanked him and headed off to your new luxury suite to catch another night of rest before preparing for the next leg of your journey. For now though, you were just happy to not be camping outside again.
1141111.title: A Small Taste Of Luxury

1141112.content:
As enticing as a clean motel room was you knew it was better to save your funds for when you arrived at Scrap City. The next phase of your journey would lead you through some pretty dangerous areas and blowing your supply money on frivolous things would likely end up getting you killed. "Ah well." you say with a sigh as you head over to the entrance to the common house. "It's just one more night."

You nodded to the guard standing out front and turned in your weapons for the night. It make you feel uneasy to give up your revolver for the night, but ever since some jackass shot and killed a resident over a dispute a few years back the guards confiscate anything bigger than a butter knife from people staying at the common house. You figured it was probably for the best but it was still annoying.

With your gear stored away in a locked chest for the evening you headed through the main door into the interior. The place really wasn't much to look on the outside and the inside was no better. The whole building was just a bunch of salvaged house pieces taken from destroyed homes all nailed and duct taped together to form one large empty square room with a high ceiling and some mattresses. That was about it.

You wondered if maybe it wasn't too late to stay at the motel and walked over to a free mattress next to a little wooden end table. The place only had four tiny windows on each of its sides along with a few cracks in the ceiling that let in a few tiny strands of light, which made it almost too dark to see during the evening. If not for a few lamps placed about on a few of the tables the whole place would be pitch black come night.

You stretched out on your mattress and most of the other folks gathered around an older woman in the far corner playing a guitar and singing. "In the pines... in the pines... where the sun never shines..." A light chuckle escaped your lips as you smirked and stared up at the ceiling. The lyrics were pretty funny given your current situation, sitting in a darkened room on a dirty mattress. "At least I'm not camping." you say to yourself.

"You can say that again." came an unexpected reply from behind you. You turned around to see a young woman with a thin scar on her cheek sitting on the mattress behind yours. She was wearing a greasy mechanic jumpsuit and had short unkempt hair. It was a bit hard to tell but she also appeared to have tan skin and green eyes along with a few splotches of grease on her cheeks and neck.

"Where did you come from?" you asked in a surprised tone. You didn't see her when you walked in and hadn't noticed anyone behind you until she spoke up. The young woman grins and she leans in a bit closer to get a better look at you. "I snuck in through the side with the loose paneling. It was a tight squeeze, but I don't like giving up my switchblade around a bunch of strangers. The name's Kara, by the way."

You smile and introduce yourself, telling her about your trip to Scrap City. Upon hearing the city's name she perks up and listens closely to the details you give her. "Wow, so you've actually been there before?" she asks with the awestruck tone of an excited child. "My pa is from out near the Dustbox region past the city, I've never been out there but I hear Scrap City is amazing! They got things like working computers and vehicles, and even big buildings called casinos where you can gamble and drink and have sex!"

You laugh as you give her some more details about the place and where you intended to stay at, a big hotel called the Bluebrick. She listens intently as you talk about your previous trips to the city. Most visits were about business, but you've been to a few of the bars and clubs as well. You even lived there for a eight months during one of your longer jobs, but that was several years ago during your youth.

Kara smiles as she glances over to a duffel bag sitting near the edge of her mattress. "Hey, you can handle yourself pretty well out there in the wasteland if you're able to travel alone like this, right? Any chance you could give me an escort to the city? I'm bored to tears out here in hicksville. I've already read all the magazines a hundred times and can't even get a good whiskey or tequila most of the time. I'll pay you a hundred bucks."

You raise an eyebrow and you think it over. Scrap City was pretty close now and most of the danger was past at this point, but you could still run into trouble. You doubted this kid had spent even one day out in the wastes, not exactly an asset and maybe even a liability. On the other hand, she was offering you some good money for what would be at most a day of work.

"Tell you what." you finally reply. "I'll sleep on it and give you my answer in the morning." Kara gives you a smile as she pulls a few bills out of a pocket on her suit and holds them up. "Remember, I'm offering you a hundred bucks, cash. It's most of my savings... but I've always dreaming of going to Scrap City even since dad died. You might be the only chance I'll have for the next several years.

With the she stuffs the bills down her neckline and pulls her duffel bag onto her lap. "Anyway, something to think about. Now do you want to do some trading at least? I make some pretty good cash collecting and repairing stuff. I got some choice items that are hard to come by out here." she offers as she unzips the bag and takes out a few items. You glance over at the people listening to the signing woman and sigh. "Sure, I guess. I got nothin' better to do right now anyway. Show me what you got."

=============
(3) Beer $7
Cherry Liquor $107
(2) Premium Eye Drops $18
Discreet Prescription $31
(4) Swag Bag $25
(3) Magic Brownie $36
(3) LSD $47
Pheromone Extract $42
(2) Tribal Tea $16
(3) Cigarette Pack $19
(5) Condom $12
(2) New People New Passions $23
Workin' Indoors $18
High Rollers Digest $21
Frilly Panties $39
Sneakers $33
Lacy Bra $35
=============

You take a look over her wares but you notice that a lot of these items are contraband in most areas. You weren't sure about what the local laws were, but chances are at least some of this stuff was illegal. You play it cool as you look over everything and don't voice any concern until you are done. Just as Kara goes to pack everything back up you confront her.

"If I may ask, where do you get this stuff exactly?" you say in a reserved tone. Kara shrugs as she packs up the stuff into the duffel bag. "All over. Some I get from traders, some I get as payment from work, some I make myself. What does it matter, anyway?" she replies in a somewhat agitated tone.

You frown and lean back to give her some space, but make sure not to take your eyes off of her. "I'm not entirely sure what the laws are here..." you begin. "...but I'm pretty sure that certain types of drugs are illegal. I noticed that you were selling marijuana products and a few other questionable substances. You could get in big trouble if someone catches you dealing that stuff."

Kara freezes as she tries to read your expression. "Alright then, yeah. Not all of the stuff I sell is legal... why do you think I snuck in past the guards? I don't make a lot of money doing work around here, sometimes it takes months for something to break down and I don't always get cash for fixing it. Some of what I got here was payment from work and some I make myself when I can get the supplies. One of the farmers here sells me good pot on the cheap, for example."

You take a deep breath as you let Kara continue. "Look, I sell a product some people want and will pay good cash and supplies for. I'm not some big bad wastelander like you, I can't make a living just fixing stuff, not here. If I make it to Scrap City things might be different... I..." she trails off as another resident walks by and sits down on their own mattress.

"Look, just... help me get to Scrap City... or don't... I don't care just as long as you don't get me in trouble. Thanks for taking a look at my stuff... we can talk more tomorrow." she finishes as she zips up the duffel bag and uses it as a pillow. In just a few minutes she is sound asleep and you are left to think alone in the dark. After a few more minutes pass the woman with the guitar turns in for the night along with most of her crowd.

You worry that Kara might do something desperate like stick a knife in your throat during your sleep, she did mention having a switchblade. Of course, it was unlikely she'd get away with that with so many people surrounding you. Even if no one woke up or caught her she'd still leave a tone of evidence behind, along with several people who saw you both talking. Reasoning that she couldn't possibly kill everyone in the common house you stretch out on your mattress and fall asleep.

Tomorrow would come soon enough, but you also have a big decision to make before you leave...
1141112.title: A New Friend...?

11411121.content:
You wake up early and stretch out on your mattress as the other residents begin getting up and going about their daily routines. After enjoying a quick breakfast Kara stirs from her peaceful slumber and let's out a yawn. "Good morning." you say with a smile as she begins stretching and rubbing her eyes. "Mornin'. Have you made you decision yet?" she asks in a hopeful tone.

You sigh and turn to face her as you made sure your belongings were all packed up and ready to go. "Yes, as a matter of fact I have. Go ahead and say your goodbyes to everyone, I'll be waiting for you here. I'm leaving in an hour though, so you better make sure you have everything ready cause I'm not heading back any time soon." you reply as she grins in delight.

"YES! Thank you! I'll go sell off my shack and get my gear ready, watch my stuff here, I'll be back in a jiffy." Kara says as she heads out through the main door, nearly knocking off some a chubby guy in the process. Your thoughts turn to the journey ahead as you look over at her duffel bag. She seemed like a resourceful person, but the big city wasn't like out here. It had many unique dangers to face, especially if you wandered into the wrong part of town.

"Ah well." you say as you relax on the mattress. "If she can survive out here in the wastes she'll probably be alright, I'll just need to make sure she properly understands how things work." After about twenty minutes pass you see Kara walk back inside carrying a large backpack on her shoulders. She smiles as she walks over and grabs her duffel bag with her free hand after placing her switchblade in her back pocket.

"You ready? I pawned off most of my old junk and bought some extra clothes and supplies. I also got plenty of cash to cover at least two or three months worth of rent. I'll all ready to start my new life, so let's go!" she says excitedly as get up off the comfy bed and grab your own stuff. "Got everything? I ain't coming back just cause you forgot something... you sure you didn't leave anything behind?"

She nods her head and pats her backpack. "Everything I could sell off is gone and I double checked to make sure I didn't leave any essentials behind. Let's hit the road!" she replies as he begins heading to the door. You chuckle as you follow behind and reclaim your weapons from the guard at the door. After Kara waves one last goodbye to some of her buddies you both head down towards the crumbing highway to finish the next leg of your journey.

Despite the sun heating up the asphalt you made good time and didn't run into any trouble as you neared the city limits. Kara gasped in awe at the lit up lights shining in the dim cloudy haze of the setting sun. Even though you had visited this place many times before you still were impressed at how much electricity and other luxuries Scrap City had on offer. Hopefully, Kara would have a good life here.

"Come on, it's getting dark. We really don't want to get caught out here during the night, tons of lowlifes and scumbags prowl around looking for easy marks." you warn Kara as you quicken you pace a bit. "In fact, we need to go over some simple rules for living in the city that you'll need to learn if you want to survive and stay out of trouble..."

You spent the next several minutes explaining to Kara what types of places to avoid and how to find work as you walked past the crumbling buildings of the outskirts. She seemed a bit distracted but nodded her head as she listen to show you that he heard what you were saying. You invite her to the Bluebrick, but she turns you down saying she heard about a nice cheap place run by a retired merchant from some of the travelers that passed through her town a while back.

She hands you a few bills and you wish her luck as you part ways near a crowded intersection lined with market stalls and food stands. You wave at each other as she disappears behind a tall gray building and continue onwards to your own destination. The air was starting to get cool now, but you were close to your current goal.

[You gain $100.]

You smile as you head inside the Bluebrick hotel and chat with an old friend of yours who ran the place. After spending a few minutes catching up you excused yourself to a free room he had offered you and head to bed. After such a long day it was good to have a proper bed for a change instead of a mattress or sleeping bad. You yawned as you fell asleeping, think ahead to what the future had in store for you.
11411121.title: An Easy Escort

11411122.content:
You wake up early and quickly sneak out of the common house as Kara and most of the other residents are fast asleep. You hated leaving her alone without any sort of goodbye, but you knew this was for the best. Even if she could handle herself out in the wasteland she'll only be a liability on the road. You could handle bandits, but if they captured her as a hostage or forced you to cover her in a firefight? Not good. You didn't even want to think about what could happen to her once she actually got to the city...

After retrieving your weapons from the guard and taking one final look at the serene little settlement you headed back down to the broken pavement of the crumbling road to finish up your journey. Things were quiet in the early morning as light slowly returned to the wasted world around you. You hated to rush, but you wanted to be long gone before Kara woke up, otherwise she might try to follow you.

After a few hours the sun began heating things up again and you took a small break in the shade of a large jagged rock off to the side of the highway. You were making excellent time and should arrive at Scrap City before the day was out, especially if you kept up a good pace. With a sigh you downed a fresh gulp of water and stepped back onto the burning hot pavement. It sucked to have to move during the hottest part of the day, though it was better than heading off road and risking running into outlaws or raiders.

At just a few hours past noon you came across a strange woman heading west with some sort of reptilian bird bird creature that looked like a mix between an ostrich, a raptor and a frilled lizard. On its back was a large knapsack filled with clinking bottles and around its neck was a thin rope leash. The woman smiled and waved to you as you stepped off the highway onto the little dirt road she was traveling.

"Hey there stranger, need a bit of booze for the road?" she says in a cheerfully yet slightly slurred voice. "I'm on my way to a big new bar that just open up about two or three miles down the road, but I got some extra hooch I can part with if you got the cash." She draws her rifle as she talks and points it further down the road as she softly swayed side to side. You think it might be a good idea to buy some of her product just to keep her from hurting herself in some sort of drunken accident.

"Gee, is the bar gonna have any booze by the time you get there...?" you whisper under your breath as she tugs her bird thing closer and opens the knapsack. Inside were several bottles filled with various types of booze. Most of it was just beer and moonshine, though she had some high quality stuff too. "Alright, alright. I guess I can take a look." you reply as you walk over to inspect a few bottles.

==================
(8) Beer $5
(3) Champagne $19
(6) Moonshine $22
(2) Absinthe $24
(3) Cherry Liquor $73
(2) Waster Flask $30
==================

After wishing the woman luck in making her delivery safely (she'd probably need it) you get back on the main road and head further north towards your destination. After several more hours of tiring travel you reach the outskirts of Scrap City just as the sun began to set. "Finally here." you say happily as you begin walking down the streets towards a familiar building.

You enter the Bluebrick hotel and greet an old friend of yours who ran the place. After explaining your situation he agreed to give you a free temporary room during your stay in the city, which you retired to almost immediately after thanking him. After taking a few moments to look around you settled into bed and quickly fell asleep. Today had been exhausting, but you had no idea what still waited on the next part of your journey...
11411122.title: One (Or Ten) For The Road

choices: Take her to Scrap City for free
11411123.content:
You knew dealing contraband was a pretty serious offense in most parts, not quite a killing offense like robbery or murder, but still punished pretty harshly. You climb out of bed with a yawn and head outside while the others are still sleeping soundly, it was lucky that you woke up before anyone else, especial Kara, or there could have been trouble. After reclaiming your weapons from the guard you tell him about the products you had seen being sold.

"I see, we're fairly lax here compared to most parts, but drug abuse is a big problem around here. We've lost a lot of good workers and guards to addictions, overdoses and just plain laziness... this is very serious..." he replies as he pulls out a tiny notepad and writes something down with a small chewed pencil. "Please wait right here while I grab a few guards and alert the mayor, if the suspect moves or attempts confrontation just yell and we'll come running."

You nod your head as the guy walks over to a pale white building cracked with age and filled with broken windows and dusty old furniture. In a few minutes an older gentleman with a graying mustache and receding hairline showed up flanked with three men and one woman carrying rifles. The mayor greets you warmly and tells you to wait with him outside as two of the guards head in to confront Kara.

You nod your head again as the guard from before puts a hand on your shoulder and tells you that you did the right thing. As you hear some angry yelling and shouting inside you aren't so sure. About a minute later the male and female guards walk back out, the woman holding the duffel bag and the man holding Kara herself. She glares at you as the guards escort her to the center of town as several people look on in curiosity.

The mayor asks you to join him and the others to give testament on Kara's conviction. You walk into the center of town alongside the guards while Kara has her hands and feet bound with rope. It's clear from her face that she's struggling not to cry or unleash a torrent of obscenities at the mayor and guards as they dig through her duffel bag. Two more guards soon show up with a thin wooden table and place it down just a few feet away.

The mayor walks over as the guards empty the duffel bag onto the table and begin sorting everything. Apparently Kara had a few extra goodies she hadn't shown you last night, nothing super hard like Neon, but still highly illegal. This was worse than you thought. As a small crowd gathers the mayor raises his arms and calls for order, causing everyone to fall silent save for a few whispers and gasps.

"Miss Kara, you stand accused of heavy narcotic dealing, including the intent to distribute outlawed chemical substances to regular buyers, is this correct?" he asks as he turns to face her. She frowns and nods her head. "Yeah. I was holding half of that stuff for my regular customers, the other stuff I offered to the new arrival." The mayor shakes his head as he gestures for you to step forward and reads the notepad the guard from earlier hands him.

"Wastelander, this woman offered you illegal drugs during the last night, is that correct?" he asks as he adjusts his glasses. You nod solemnly. "Yes sir, that is correct." The crowd begins talking a little louder as the mayor let's out a sigh and nods towards one of the guards who brought out the table. The man draws a long machete and walks over to the table. Kara is freed from her bonds and has her left hand placed upon the table, held in place by the female guard.

"You were warned in the past about this once before, yes?" the mayor asks as he steps forward. "I'm afraid we can't give you another warning this time. Normally, the punishment for selling illegal products is one finger per pound of contraband, however, in light of this being only your second offense and your admission of guilt your punishment will be a single finger and a fine. I'm sorry, miss Kara."

"Just get it over with..." Kara replies as one of the guards cleans the blade with disinfectant and then raises it over his head. She winces as the razor edge comes down on her left pinky finger, severing it clean with a single blow. A soft moan escapes her lips as a stream of blood spurts off from the tiny stump, but nothing more. The wound is then bandaged as two of the guards confiscate Kara's items.

When she is able to stand again she is escorted over to the white building and disappears inside. The mayor asks the crown to please disburse before turning to you with a faint smile. "Thank you for reporting this to us, I know it can be hard to follow the law sometimes but justice was done here, our town thanks you for that." he says as he hands you a few bills rolled up with a small tie and heads over to join his guards.

[You gain $200.]

You wait a few minutes for Kara to come back out with her empty duffel bag and watch her walk over to what you assume is her house. You shake your head and are just about to leave when she comes back out and shouts at you. "Why the fuck did you do that?!" she asks angrily as she walks over to you. "I told you that I needed to sell that stuff to make a living, now I can't risk it because losing any more fingers means I won't be able to do any mechanical work!"

You shrug your shoulders as you look her in the eyes. "I'm sorry, but the law is the law. I could have gotten in trouble for not reporting you." you reply. This only seems to make Kara more angry as she throws her duffel bag to the ground. "Bullshit! You knew you'd get a nice fat reward for turning me in, didn't you?! How much did they give you? A hundred? Two hundred? Five hundred? Well, I hope it was worth it because now I'm almost broke, out of products to sell and missing a goddamn finger you asshole!"

She turns away for a moment before grabbing her duffel bag off the ground and glaring at you. "Can you at least take me with you to Scrap City with you? There's no way I can make a living here and I'll die if I head out into the wasteland alone and unarmed... can you at least do this for me? And before you ask... no, I can't pay you now, I lost almost all of my money and need what I have left to rent a room and try to fix my life. This purely to show me that you're not a complete shitbag, well?"

You take a few moments to think it over. Not getting paid hardly made it worth the risk, but after costing her so much it seemed like a pretty scumy thing to do to just abandon her with almost nothing. What will you do?
11411123.title: Finger Her

choices: "Actually, yes. I DO want the clothes off your back."
"No, I guess fifty will have to do. Thanks."
114111231.content:
"Oh no, no goddamn way, fucker!" Kara yells angrily as she waves her arms in front of her. "I told you, I need the cash I got so I don't become penniless or homeless, what part did you not understand? I AM NOT giving you the little bit of money I got left. Why the hell would you even think you could get another cent out of me?"

You smile as you fold your arms and look out at the horizon. "It's about a full day's walk to the city and the wasteland is filled with bandits, rapists, mutants and much worse. You said it yourself, you lost your primary source of income... the question is, do you want to be poor in a place like Scrap City where you can probably at least find some work... or do you want to be poor out here, in the ass end of nowhere waiting for something to break down so you can barter fixing it for some spare junk... well?"

Kara gives you a look of pure hatred as she clenches her fist on her duffel bag. "Fine. The money is yours you greedy shitbag, get me to the city, I give you my last fifty dollars... and then we part ways, hopefully to never see each other again. Is that okay, asshole?" she says as she begins walking past you towards the highway. You smirk at your superior negotiating skills and follow behind her at a close pace. "Deal."

You both walk for several miles without incident. Around noon Kara nearly disturbs a Rattle Viper nest, but you manage to point it out before she could get too close. It's clear from her expression that she's grateful that you probably saved her life, but she refused to say thank you for it, or even speak at all. This was fine with you, however, as it meant you'd have a nice peaceful trip without her making a bunch of noise on the way or bugging you about what the city would be like.

As the evening sky began to settle in you came upon the outskirts of Scrap City lit up like a christmas tree underneath a swarm of fireflies. It was so beautiful that Kara momentarily forgot her hatred for you and ran ahead to cover the last mile as quickly as possible. You picked up the pace to a jog as you followed her past a few abandoned tents and ruined building frames, not quite enough to catch up but enough to keep her in your sights so she couldn't try and sneak away.

Kara stopped in front of a long street stretching from a nearby pile of rubble all the way to a tall building in the distance. She waited a few minutes for you to catch up and then pulled a few bills out of her cleavage. "Here shithead, my last few dollars. A deal's a deal, even with someone like you." she says as she holds out the bills in a dismissive manner. Your grin as you grab the cash and begin counting it up.

[You gain $50.]

"Fifty dollars? Is that it?" you scoff as you pocket the cash. Kara stares at you in what seemed like a mix of rage and disbelief. "Of fucking course that's it! I told you I didn't have much!" she yells as she pokes you in the chest with her finger. "What? Did you want the fucking clothes off my back as well?!"

You think for a moment before responding...
114111231.title: Petty Extortion

1141112311.content:
Kara stares at you with a look of pure horror, disgust and shock as she begins backing away slowly. She goes to run but you grab her and begin pulling off her clothes. "Get off me you fucking cunt!" she yells as struggles to free herself but you overpower her and have her suit unzipped before she can even begin to squirm away. She desperately tries kicking you in the face but you simply grab her leg and pull off the last bit of her mechanic jumpsuit. Feel proud of yourself?

[You gain 1 Kara's Mechanic Jumpsuit.]

Kara collapses to the ground as you roll up your new outfit and remove her shoes, leaving her with only her pink bra and panties. "You... you garbage... piece of shit..." Kara begins mumbling, but is unable to continue as a cool breeze blows through the street and she attempts to cover herself with her hands. "Next time consider being better company and carrying more cash." you taunt as you leave her on a street corner next to a bum passed out from a empty bottle of whiskey.

Your last sight of her is a woman in a tattered shirt offering her a blanket and some soup her husband made. Ah well, she had to learn what life is like in the big city, but you taught her that lesson firsthand. If anything, she should have thanked you for introducing her to the real world outside her shitty little town. With a smile of satisfaction you head down a new road off to the side and begin heading for the Bluebrick Hotel.

An old friend of yours ran the place and gave you a free room for your time in the city. You thank him and head up to what would be your room for the next week or so. After unpacking your stuff you settled into bed and fell asleep. If tomorrow was as profitable as today had been you would have a lot to look forward to...
1141112311.title: Extremely Petty Extortion

1141112312.content:
"Good, glad you're soooo generous." Kara says sarcastically as she begins walking off towards towards an alley filled with small trinket stands and a few people grilling various tiny critters. "I'm gonna see if I can find a bite to eat and a place to crash. Feel free to fuck off anytime it's convenient for you." With that she walks off and disappears behind a crowd of people standing in line to get some discount grub from a guy cooking a small dog on a spit.

"Guess I better get moving too." you say as you turn around and head down the street. After a few minutes of navigating around the buildings and shops you come to a large familiar building that stood like a beacon in the night. It was the Bluebrick Hotel, one of the finest in the entire city... though that probably wasn't saying much. Even better, an old friend of yours ran the place and offer you a free room for the duration of your trip.

After retiring to bed you strech out and relax for the first time in ages. It was nice to not have to camp or sleep in a run down building for a change. As you drift off to sleep you begin dreaming of all the riches the future held in store for you... and all the suckers you could scam out of their hard earned cash.
1141112312.title: Sour Departure

114111232.content:
"I guess I owe you at least that much." you finally say with a shrug. "Grab your stuff kid, it's time to hit the road." Kara's expression softens a bit upon hearing this and she holds up her duffel bag. "I've already got what I need, let's just put some miles between this place and ourselves." she replied as she joined you.

"Alright then, stay close and follow my lead. The city isn't far now, but it's still pretty dangerous out here." you warn as you take the lead and begin walking down the crumbling road. Kara nods her head and holds up her bandaged hand. "Yeah, I got that part. Civilization can be just as bad, it's a lesson I've learned already." she says in an annoyed tone.

Your journey continues uneventfully as you walk along the scorching hot asphalt of the ruined highway and chat a bit to pass the time. Before you know it a looming group of buildings appear off in the distance as the evening sun begins to set. "Looks like we're just about here." you announce as you quicken your pace a bit. "Let's get inside before night falls, this area gets pretty bad after dark."

About an hour later you and Kara come to an intersection lit up by jury rigged lights and burning trash can fires. It's there that you decide to part ways. Despite everything Kara seems to still consider you a friend, or at least a buddy for getting her to Scrap City and you both manage to leave on fairly good terms. She wishes you luck in your next endeavor and you say the same as you wave goodbye. She then disappears down a branching street and you carry on alone.

It doesn't take you long to find the Bluebrick Hotel, a tall building that overshadowed most of the surrounding cityscape. It wasn't the tallest building in Scrap City, but pretty close. You checked in at the front desk and was greeted by an old friend who ran the place and offered you a free room during your stay. You thanked him and then retired to your room for the night for some rest. As you fell asleep you dreamed of what the future held in store during the next leg of your journey...
114111232.title: Friendly Goodbyes

114111233.content:
"No. Sorry, but I'm not playing babysitter to a kid who's never been out in the wastes before, especially with an injury like that. You should stay here for now and try to hitch a ride with a caravan." you finally say as you turn to leave without her. "Hey! What the fuck?!" Kara yells as she runs to catch up. "I wouldn't have this injury if not for you, not to mention the money I lost paying fines! You owe me, asshole!"

"I'm afraid not, now head back to town before you get hurt." You reply coldly, not caring in the slightest how much you've taken from her. Kara balls up her fist and keeps up her pace. "Screw that! I'll follow you if I have to, I'm coming with you whether you like it or not!" she shouts as she runs up behind you.

You let out a sigh as you draw your revolver and level it with her chest. She stops dead in her tracks as you keep the barrel on her and walk a bit closer. "This ends now. You are not endangering me because you got something to prove or hate your home. I'm leaving now. Alone. You cannot follow. If I see you any further down the road I'm shooting to kill... now go back." Your tone is calm and serious as you stare her down.

Infuriated at your decision Kara screams as she throws the duffel bag to the ground and storms off back to town. You couldn't tell if she was shaking from fresh tears or seething rage but it was probably best to make tracks before she decided to sneak out after you. You holster your gun and walk off alone down the highway as the sun rose high into the sky.

Just as night was settling in and your legs began to get tired from walking all day you came upon the outskirts of Scrap City and breathed a sigh of relief.
