After checking one final time to make sure Kara hadn't followed you all the way here you head off down a street lit up by dim street lights and burning campfires. You were finally here.

In didn't take long to reach the Bluebrick Hotel, your destination for the night. With a smile you headed inside and greeted an old friend of yours who ran the place. After taking a few minutes to catch up he offered you a free room, which you happily accepted. You headed upstairs and unpacked your gear, eager to get a good night's rest. When sleep finally came all you could dream about was the future that lied ahead.
114111233.title: Alone On The Road

12.content:
You yawn as you pull the covers off your refreshed body and rub your eyes. The sun was peeking in through your window as various birds chirped and cawed outside from outside. You stretched your arms as you got out of bed and headed over to the window to take in the view. With all the excitement of the past few days you hadn't really made much of a chance to just stop and admire the ruined beautify of the city around you.

Even from your 11th floor room the city stretched off into the distance under an endless, cloudless blue sky. Most of the buildings were still standing, but several residences and businesses were fashioned together from scrap materials and spare junk. Rusty pipes, clotheslines, draped clothes and cobbled together wooden supports dotted the landscape in front of you along with several cleared out lots filled with tents, camps and even a few trailer homes.

Most striking of all was the huge number of people walking across makeshift bridges, climbing ladders and generally going about their day without a care in the world. It wasn't like out in the wasteland where you could go days or even weeks without finding another soul... this was an urban jungle filled to the brim with everything from sunday school teachers to hardened criminals. It was a sight to behold.

With a sigh you tear your eyes away from the dusty window and begin getting dressed for the day. After doing your best to make yourself look presentable in the cracked bathroom mirror you grab your stuff and head downstairs to meet up with your friend Dalton. You hadn't really had a chance to talk since you arrived here almost a week ago and it would be nice to chat for a while before heading out.
12.title: City Of Scrap

121.content:
You head downstairs to the main lobby and see that Shelly the secretary was on duty again today at the front desk. She was a sweet middle aged woman with a thin frame and curly red hair who always had a smile for the Bluebrick's customers, both new and old. You smile as she hands a key to an older gentleman and walk up to the desk.

"Enjoy your stay with us." she says cheerfully as she waves goodbye to the man and turns her attention to you. "Hey there, sweetie. What can I do for you? You checking out?" You laugh as you rub the back of your head and try not to look nervous. "Not just yet I'm afraid, I still haven't been able to secure a safe way to travel the Dustbox region and I don't want to hit the road by myself without the proper supplies. I actually wanted to talk to Dalton, if I may?"

Shelly laughs as she takes out a flask of rum and offers you a sip.

[If you accept the drink add +1 to your Endurance skill and -1 to your Speech skill for the next 3 pages.]

After downing a large gulp and putting the flask away Shelly stands up and puts a small "closed" sign on the front desk. "I was actually about to take my one hour break, but I've gotta meet with him too." she finally says as she grabs her hat and steps out from behind the desk to join you. "Let's go see him together. He should be at a meeting with one of the merchant guilds at the Bear Trap Bar down near the airport slums. I hate going there by myself."

You nod and the two of you begin heading for the front door. "Sounds like a plan. Let's see what Dalton is up to." you say as you open the door for Shelly and smile at the two guards near the entrance. "I'm taking my break now, I'll be back in a few hours." she calls as you follow her out the door.

The bright afternoon sun reflected off of all the shiny metal surfaces and made you thankful that the tall buildings around you provided so much shade. The road ahead had once been a busy city street in the world before, now it was a crumbling pathway covered in dust with dozens of tiny stands and kiosks set up along either side. If money wasn't one of your top concerns right now you'd probably ask Shelly to go on ahead while you check out a grill stand or clothing vendor.

Ah well, you'd have time for tourism after finding out what your old boss left for you in his will. Right now you needed to be focusing on finding some sort of job so that you'd have the money to get you to the Dustbox region and back. If you didn't get moving soon you might miss your chance and arrive too late to claim anything. The thought of this whole trip being a waste caused you to sigh and focus on the shops passing by as you and Shelly headed for the Bear Trap Bar.

Maybe you could get a drink while you were there, a nice refreshing distraction sounded good at this point. "We're almost there, the Bear Trap is just up ahead." Shelly called as she pointed past a torn chain-link fence at a tall building overlooking a wide open park area. "Alright, I haven't been here before so I'll follow your lead." you reply as Shelly chuckles and leads you past a broken down RV up to the front door.
121.title: Headin' Into Town

choices: Leave and head to the warehouse district
Tell Lyle you're interested in his offer
1211.content:
A cool wave of air breaks over you as Shelly opens the door and steps inside. You take a moment to savor it and then follow her. The interior of the Bear Trap was a little on the small side with a set of creaky wooden stairs off to the left behind a worn down pool table. To your right were a couple round wooden tables and a jukebox and dartboard near the far corner. Finally, right in front of you was a long polished counter table that looked unusually clean by normal standards with a burly man with a thick handlebar mustache standing behind it polishing a glass with a rag.

"Hello Ike, we're here to see Dalton. Is here busy at the moment?" Shelly asks as she steps past a man passed out near one of the tables. The bartender doesn't smile but seems to respect Shelly enough that he at least stops what he was doing and listens to her. "No, he's talking to that rich boy from Brownsand at the moment. I doubt either of them have much to say to the other, go on up if you wanna talk, Shel." he replies.

Shelly thanks him and turns to you before heading up the stairs. "I'll only be a few minutes, why don't you wait here and have a drink while I'm gone? Just put it on my tab." she says as she walks off. "Alright, thanks Shelly." you reply as you sit down at a bar stool to rest your feet. "What have you got on tap, Ike?"

The bartender grunts as he points to a small chalkboard behind him. "We got booze, cheap and expensive, watered down and strong. Pick your poison, I believe Shel offered you a free drink on here tab right? Don't waste it." he says in a gruff tone as he resumes polishing his mugs and glasses. "Just don't take all day, I got other customers I actually like to serve."

[You receive a Can Of Beer, a Moonshine or a Wasteland Martini. Your choice.]

===================
Can Of Beer (5) $8
Moonshine (3) $21
Wasteland Martini (2) $47
Tribal Tea (3) $32
Swag Bag (5) $56
Pink Leaf (2) $41
Condom (4) $18
Pornographic Magazine (4) $26
===================

A few minutes later Shelly comes back down the stairs and takes a seat at the bar next to you. "Your turn sweetie." she says as she pulls out a small envelop and takes a few dollar bills out of it. "Give me something strong and sweet, Ike." The bartender nods and begins pouring her drink as you get up and stretch your legs a bit. "Dang, I was just getting comfortable." you laugh. "Keep my seat warm, I guess."

With that you head up the stairs into a small hallway lined with dust covered windows on the left and two wooden doors with glass windows on the right and at the end. You are about to turn the knob on the right side door when it suddenly swings open and a man with blond hair and a business suit storms out with reddened cheeks and a sour look on his face. He brushes past you without so much as an "excuse me" and disappears down the stairs.

"Guess the business negotiations didn't go his way." you whisper to yourself as you step into the tiny office room. Dalton was sitting on one of two sofas on each side of a glass end table with his hands folded and his head bowed. He left out a sigh and barely noticed you as you sat down on the sofa opposite from him and leaned back on the comfortable leather. "Who was that?" you finally ask to break the silence.

"No one, nobody." Dalton replies as he pours himself a glass of whiskey, emptying the bottle in the process. "Just some idiot who thinks he's entitled to my hotel just because his daddy owns a chain of them out near Brownsand. Wanted me to part with the Bluebrick for only 1000 Caps, can you believe it? I told him that most folks in this city don't even use Caps and he acted like I was turning away a loaded bank vault."

"Wow, sounds like a real asshole." you say as you put your hands behind your head. "I don't suppose he mentioned any work opportunities on his way out?" Dalton took a sip of his drink and shook his head. "I'm sorry, but no. Good paying jobs are hard to come by these days. Most people either own family business, run caravans out in the wastes or go scavenging. With the population rising higher each year its getting harder for people in this city to find steady jobs. Anyway, did you get what you needed for your journey yet?"

You shake your head and lean forward. "Nah, that's kinda why I came here. I couldn't find any work and I don't want to waste any more time travelling all over the city job hunting. I need to gather up some cash in the next couple of days or I might as well head back home." Dalton sighs as he takes another sip of his whiskey. "I'd love to give you a lone, but most of my spare cash is invested in different assets right now. Pulling funding on my business operation could cause me a lot of trouble in keeping the Bluebrick afloat."

"Ah, don't worry about it." you reply as look up at the ceiling. "I know you'd give me the cash if you could, I'll just have to figure something out. I just need an idea." Both you and Dalton are silent for a few seconds as Dalton gets a contemplative look on his face. He seemed to be deep in thought about something, but you had no idea what. "I think I might know a place that can help you..." he finally says as he finishes off his glass of whiskey.

"Oh? Well, I'm all ears then..." you say with a slight smile. "At this point I'd probably be thankful for a job picking up trash in the streets." Dalton grins and puts his hands on his knees. "I was talking to a client the other day about expanding his own businesses into Scrap City, he runs caravans, you see. Anyway, he mentioned that he was planning on shipping in some supplies to his private warehouse near the northwestern slums. That's a bad part of town, but it also means he'll need security, workers willing to haul his supplies and so on."

Your eyes light up a bit when you realize what Dalton was getting at. "In other words..." he continues. "My client needs wastelanders like you who can do some heavy lifting and aren't afraid to get your hands dirty. Most of the work would likely be freelance and high paying for the risks involved, sounds like just your kind of job, right? I can't promise anything, but if you head over and tell them Dalton sent you I'm sure they could find something for you to do."

You smile and get back on your feet. "Alright, thanks! That sounds perfect!" you say excitedly. "I just need to earn enough to be able to afford supplies and travel, a couple days work at most." Dalton smiles as he leans back on the couch and and kicks his feet up. "Glad to be of help old friend. Just be sure you toss some of that loot you get my way the time time you come to the city." he says with a laugh. You shake hands and wish each other luck in your endeavors before heading back down to the bar to say goodbye to Shelly.

She asks you to walk her back to the Bluebrick, which you agree to since it was right along the way to the warehouse district. After thanking you she hands you a few bills before heading inside. "You take care of yourself out there, that region you're headed to is known for its hostility and danger. I'd hate to hear that an old friend of Dalton's had something bad happen to them out there." You thank her for the concern and wave goodbye before heading off alone.

[You gain $20.]

It takes about half an hour to get to the warehouse district on foot and the overhead sun was starting to really warm up the pavement. You'd be thankful to get back inside a building, even one with air conditioning. Not only was the humid weather a pain to deal with you didn't like the looks of the local area. Most of the taller buildings in this part of the city where collapsed with rubble and debris piling in the streets along with the rusted out frames of long forgotten vehicles.

As if navigating though this place over busted cars and stacked dumpsters wasn't bad enough there was a distinct unfriendliness to the local inhabitants. Most looked like penniless bums and street punks, but a few wore jackets, bandanas and motorcycle helmets. The relative lack of police or guards also made the place a haven for drug dealers, prostitutes, gangs, thugs and other nasty types of people.

You breathe a sigh of relief when you come up to a wide open space past the crumbling buildings and blasted open sewers. Before you was relatively clear road stretching around several large buildings protected by chain-link fences and a few small guard outposts. Of the few people walking around most were wearing hard hats or mercenary fatigues. This was the place.

You are just about to head up to the front gates when a voice calls out to you from a nearby building with broken windows. "Hey, hey general badass! Over here!" You keep your hand on your revolver and head over to investigate when a man with red hair and a short beard steps out with his arms raised. He was wearing a grimy trench coat and black aviator sunglasses. "Hey, don't shoot! I'm unarmed over here!" he says with a smile.

You keep your hand on your gun as he slowly walks over to you. "Woah easy, I know this place is a shithole, but I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm just a scout looking for tough characters such as yourself. Can I put my arms down now?" he asks with a slightly nervous tone. "I just want to offer you some work."

You tell him not to do anything funny and lean against a car as he lowers his arms and introduces himself. "Okay, thanks. I'm Lyle, Lyle The Liar... its a, uh, bad nickname I know, but I swear I'm being straight with you. I'm just here to meet tough guys and gals and get them some high paying work. Are you interested?"

You frown and glance at the warehouses before turning back to Lyle. "So you find mercenary types that pass through here and get them to work for you, what if I say no?" you ask. Lyle laughs and gives you a smile. "Nothing, geez. We're not gonna force you to work with us, just make the offer. You can split any time you like."

You pause a moment and look him over. "Is the work dirty?" you ask. Lyle grins. "Sometimes."
1211.title: The Bear Trap Bar

12112.content:
"Sounds like fun." you say with a grin. "I really need some cash right now, so this is pretty convenient. Just don't try to fuck me." Lyle smiles a bit wider and folds his arms. "Good, that's the spirit! That's what I like to hear!" he replies in his own enthusiastic tone. "Just follow me, I'll take you to your new job site."

You follow Lyle over to a manhole cover and watch him climb down inside. You didn't like the idea of crawling around an ancient underground passage filled with muck and grime, but the thought of a big payday kept you going. Nothing ventured, nothing gained, right? To your surprise the place was actually fairly well lit by glowing fungus on the walls and narrow cracks and holes in the ceiling. There wasn't even any nasty water pooling around your ankles or swarms of bugs buzzing around your head, another pleasant surprise.

"You sure these old tunnels are safe?" you ask as Lyle pushes aside a splintered old cabinet and begins moving down a tight passageway off to the side. "Sure thing. Just follow me and we're be at our destination in about ten to fifteen minutes." he replies from the middle of the passage. "Just don't lag behind, it can be dangerous if you head off down one of the wrong tunnels."

After nearly a minute in complete darkness you crawl back out into the light of a wide sewer station with a steel grate pouring in afternoon sunlight about ten feet above your head. "Sorry about the tight squeeze, we don't like normal folks just barging into our business here. I don't get paid if I let people off the streets follow me back." Lyle says as you get back on your feet. "No problem, I know how busybodies like to ruin everyone's fun these days." you reply as you dust off your knees. "How much further?"

"Not much, just stay close for this part up ahead." Lyle replies as he opens a metal door leading into a new tunnel. You follow him past a few skeletons caught in sprung bear traps and head through a blasted hole in the wall leading to an adjacent tunnel to get around a collapsed truck smashed through the road overhead. "Funny, I was just at a bar called the Bear Trap." you say with a small laugh. "Cool place." Lyle responds as he shoves aside a few garbage bags concealing spike traps on the floor. "Lost my virginity in the park behind that place. Follow my lead here."

Lyle carefully navigates past several more traps and and turns a corner. "It's just up here, be careful." he whispers as he steps over a pressure plate. It was much darker here than most of the other tunnels and a lot more dangerous so you decided to stick close to Lyle as he showed you the way. Unfortunately, your foot manages to graze a pressure plate that releases a large sack of concrete which swings right at your chest.

[You lose 1 Hit Point. If your Traps skill is 2 or higher or your Endurance skill is 4 or higher you lose 0 Hit Points instead.]

"Shit! Sorry!" Lyle shouts as he rushes over to help you get to your feet. "I must have missed one, I thought I had this route perfectly memorized." You grab his hand and stumble back to your feet with a groan. "It's fine. It only grazed me. If I hadn't leaned back it could have smashed my ribs though..."

Lyle lets out a sigh and turns to continue forward. "We're just about there, don't hurt yourself now." You laugh and rub your side where the bag had hit you. "Wasn't planning on it." you reply as you follow him to another metal door. "One more tunnel to go." Lyle says as he opens the door for you. "After you."

As you walk the final stretch into wherever Lyle was taking you a small footlocker half buried in the rubble catches your eye off to the side. It had some sort of electronic password lock that had a small number pad on the upper right side of the lid. "Oh, that? Don't bother, I've tried to get that damn thing open at least a dozen times already..." Lyle says when he notices you looking at it.

"Do you mind if I give it a try?" you ask as you head over to inspect it. Lyle lets out a laugh as he shakes his head. "I'll give you a couple minutes before I leave you down here. The exit ladder is right around the corner up ahead, see you in a few." he replies as he disappears behind a pile of rubble. You pull the footlocker free of the rubble and examine the lock more closely. You'd need to either reset the number pad or pry the lock open somehow, which would take some extreme force.

[If your Science skill is 4 or higher, your Melee skill is 4 or higher or if you have the Lucky perk you successfully manage to open the box. Inside is 2 Pornographic Magazines, 1 Lacy Bra, 1 High Heels, 2 Bags Of Batteries, 1 Electric Massager, $100 and 5 Caps. You may add any of these items to your inventory.]

When you are done screwing around with the footlocker you run up ahead to meet back up with Lyle, who was smoking a cigarette and leaning against the ladder to the surface. "Ready?" he asks as he stubs out the cigarette on the wall and tosses it on the ground. "Yeah, I'm eager to see where you've taken me." you reply as Lyle begins climbing up the ladder.

You never thought that you'd be so happy to be out in the blazing sun again, but after about twenty minutes of traveling through dark smelly sewer tunnels it was a nice change of pace. "Oh damn, that's pretty bright." you say as you hold up your hand to keep the brightness out of your eyes. It was kind of hard to see at the moment as your eyes where still adjusting to your surroundings, but behind you was a large wall made from concrete and sheet metal stack in between some of the collapsed buildings.

Unfortunately, you couldn't see much else with a ruined store of some kind blocking your view from the street ahead. "Welcome to Old Town, this is where we part ways." Lyle said as he began climbing back down into the manhole you'd just came from. "Wait, what about your boss? You said you were offering me some work?" you reply in confusion as Lyle stops and laughs. "Of course, this is Old Town! Tons of high rollers and shady businessmen needing people to run jobs for them. Just head up to the bounty board in the center of the plaza near the old statehouse or pay a visit to Wormwood Alley. Good luck to ya!"

Before you could say a word in protest he was gone down the manhole and headed back to his street corner to find more talent for his bosses. Truth be told you had heard a few nasty rumors of Old Town, but if this place had the cash to go with its shady businesses and gangsters you didn't much care. "Guess I'll see what kind of action this place has." you say to yourself as you step out from behind the building.

What unfolded before you was a sight unlike anything you had seen in the wastes. Unlike the rest of Scrap City that you had seen before Old Town was a marvel of wide open clean streets and outdoor gardens. Most of the inner buildings were surprisingly intact compared to the ones lining the wall which encircled the place. The only way in or out that you could see where thin bridges set up at a few checkpoints that were suspended over the wall and connected to nearby buildings. The place even had a few vehicles driving down some of the main roads.

You were so impressed that you hardly knew what to check out first, then you remembered what Lyle had said to you before you left. If you wanted to earn some quick money you'd need to meet with some of the big players and run some jobs. Where are you headed to first?
12112.title: Welcome To Old Town

121121.content:
You decided that sight seeing would have to wait until you got some work done, business before pleasure and all that. After taking a few minutes to walk down the street and have a quick look around you approach a man in a suit and fedora wielding a machine gun. "Yo muscles, you some kind of security force? Where can I find the statehouse plaza?" you ask while the guy pauses to look over over.

"You a merc? Otherwise, you best get the fuck outta here. Old Town isn't a place for poor people or tourists... and the guys in charge don't like being bothered unless its about business." he replies as he tightens his grip on his gun. You give the guy a smile to ease the tension. "Lyle sent me. Lyle The Liar? Said there was work to be had, otherwise I wouldn't be here." The man's expression softens a bit upon hearing this and he lowers his gun to his side. He nods as if he understands why you're here.

"Ah, I see. Sorry for the rude welcoming, me and my boys have been busy dealing with a lot of punks these past few weeks, the Scrap City militia has been cracking down harder on the drug and sex trades in recent years and making things harder for the bosses. I'm glad we got someone willing to do some work visiting us instead of another deadbeat debtor or prissy asshole. You're looking for the bounty board, right? Just follow the street behind me past the greenhouses, it'll lead you through the bar and casino area all the way to Old Town Park. The bounty board is right in the center, can't miss it." the man says as he points off to the right.

"Great, thanks." you reply as you begin walking off. "Just stay away from the Sapphire Dancer, that place is shady as all fuck." the man calls after you as you begin walking down the street he pointed out. You nod in affirmative and wave goodbye. As you passed by the greenhouses you noticed a few armed guards and took a peak inside one of the doorways while a gardener was talking to a woman in a lab coat. You could make out cannabis, poppy and even pink leaf plants growing inside, showing while most of the local drugs come from.

"Maybe I should stop and ask if I can run some packages for them?" you think to yourself as you head further into town. "Drug runners probably make a lot of cash but it would be a pain sneaking that shit past some of the checkpoints that have been set up. Not to mention the risk of some junkie asshole stabbing you to get his fix or steal your stash. Still, it' definitely worth considering."

As the greenhouses fade from sight behind bars, casinos and whore houses you start to notice more people walking around. Some are dressed in fancy suits and dresses, some are wearing torn rags and rubbing their arms, some are geared up like that mobster guy you met before and some were dressed in tight and revealing clothing... almost no one here looked like a wastelander or mercenary, which made you feel like you stuck out like a sore thumb. No one said anything to you though, so you ignored it.

"This place sure is strange." you note as the park finally comes into view up ahead. It wasn't anything super fancy but it was impressive by wasteland standards. It addition to a few leafy trees and moderately healthy looking grass were a few benches, gazebos and even the remains of a stone statue right in front of the statehouse. Just in front of the statue was a large wooden billboard covered in graffiti and pinned with various notes and photos.

"That must be it." you say to yourself. "Now I just need to find some high paying work and get back on the road. If I'm lucky there'll be a few quick jobs I can do with a decent payout. I'll need a lot to get where I'm going and I can't afford to waste any more time screwing around with little jobs anymore, I need a serious payday."

You walked up to the board and noticed a man in a leather jacket and football helmet was reading to himself near the lower right corner along with a woman in combat fatigues looking at a poster she had pulled off from a spot in the middle. Not wanting to cause trouble you took to the open spot near the left side and began studying the various notes and posters. Several of the bounties had great pay but required a time investment you couldn't give while others were just small time jobs with low pay. After about twenty minutes you had found only three offers that seemed feasible.

You pull each of the flyers off of the wall and give them another quick read while you decided which one seemed like the option:

HELP WANTED!!!! SLAVE TRANSPORT - Hey mercs, have I got a job for you. Okay, see, we got lots of sensitive cargo we picked up from a small farming settlement up north near Sawtooth and were need help transporting it ASAP. No vehicle needed or any type of mount... we got that covered. What we need is a seasoned guard who can keep the marks secure and alive until they reach the drop off. We got buyers close by so it isn't far, the problem is that the damn guards got a tip off from someone and they have several checkpoints on alert for slaves. We'll pay top dollar for each person you can get our buyers, just don't let too many die or you'll get nothing. Nobody, not even bandits will pay for dead bodies and I don't like dealing with cannibals. For details hit up Rocksalt and Mr. Pepper at the Black Moon. Peace out. - Rocksalt

Runner Desperately Needed - Look, I'm in some deep shit so I'll make this quick. I'm Dr. Bowen and I work with Al's boys at the northside greenhouse on fifth street. We had a great harvest this year but lost two of our runners to a bust outside the city. We need a skilled runner that can deliver a special package to a very valuable client and I can't trust any rookies with this job. If we don't get moving soon we could lose the package and one of our best customers. If you can do this please contact me or anyone working at the fifth street greenhouse as soon as you can. Thanks. - Dr. Bowen

Doorman Requested - We need a new doorman (or hell, doorwoman, I ain't picky) to run security at the front of the Sapphire Dancer club and casino. You'll need to know how to door pat downs, searches and general security checks. Real basic shit, this isn't rocket science. You'll stand at the door from sundown to sunrise. No mouthing off to guests or visitors unless they cause trouble, you lose your temper and start throwing insults or punches and we'll make you wish you had taken a job as a professional asswiper. This job only requires basic patience, politeness and alertness. Experience preferred, but we'll take what we can get. Job includes a hefty paycheck, no commitment and free drinks during your break. See the casino manager for details. - Sapphire Dancer

After taking a moment to consider the pros and cons of each job you decided to go with...
121121.title: Dirty Deeds Not Done Dirt Cheap

1211213.content:
You pocket the notice after memorizing the directions and headed back towards the casino district. Apparently this place was near one of the shadier parts of the town, but still close enough to the main road that thugs and drunks were only a minor problem. "I wonder why such a place would offer this much for a simple security job, surely they have some bouncers and hired guns watching the place?" you muse as you pass by a woman wearing nothing but pasties and a red thong.

"Ah well, with pay this good I should be able to finish up in just a few days." After heading down the main road you come to a long line up of casinos stretching down the right side of the road all the way towards a small motel on the far end near an intersection. The left side was mostly bars, restaurants and pawn shops along with a few empty lots and collapses buildings. You could see now why security was so important to these guys, being so close to bad side of town likely made them a popular target for troublemakers.

You walked by several of the smaller casinos until you came to a large platinum building with blue flags and lights mounted along the front. A lot of the paint was worn away and faded, some of the lights were broken and the flags were tattered and covered in dust and grime, but it was still the most impressive looking building around. You took a moment to take it all in and then headed over to a tall bald black man in a tuxedo and sunglasses standing near the front doors.

"Can I help you, kid?" he asks in a gruff voice as he nods at a man in a top hat who flashes a VIP pass. "Hello my good man, I'm here about the security position. Is the job still open?." you ask as the man folds his arms and lowers his sunglasses. "You? Ha, you barely come up to my neck... this is a serious job with good pay. If you want to work here you'll need more experience than just watching a few caravans." he replies with a smirk.

"I can handle it. Don't judge a book by its cover and all that." you reply as the man looks a bit impressed. "Alright kid, go ahead and talk to the manager. Just remember, this ain't a job for lightweights or slackers, you don't pull your weight or keep your guard up you won't last long." he says as he lets out a sigh and digs a keycard out of his pocket. "Take this and head on in, the boss is in the upstairs office at the end of the right hall. Tell him Roy sent you and he'll set you up. Best of luck to ya kid, you'll need it in this town."

You give him a smile and pocket the keycard. "Thank you Roy, I'll get that squared away now." you reply as you open the door and head inside. A pleasant wave of coolness from some sort of air conditioner system washed over you as you step into the main lobby and your ears began ringing with loud casino music playing over the loudspeakers. As impressive as the outside was, the inside had it beat by a long shot.

As nice as it would be to stay and enjoy yourself a little you knew the job would just be harder if you allowed yourself to get used to the comfort and luxury surrounding you, not to mention how much money you could lose gambling. You sighed and head up a large staircase after showing another guard your keycard. As you wall down a short hallway you come to a large wooden door flanked by two more men in tuxedos. "Can we help you?" one of them asks as he looks you over.

"Roy sent me." you reply as you hand over the keycard. After giving you a nod the man swipes it and opens the door for you. "You got a couple minutes, don't take too long. The boss is a busy man." the other guard replies as his partner shuts the door behind you. In front of you was a well furnished office with fancy leather furniture, a tiger skin rug and even a large window overlooking the main floor of the casino.

Before you could say anything or take another step a swivel chair spun around with a bored looking blond guy smoking a cigar smiling as his two female body guards stepped to either side of his desk. Each of the women had high powered assault rifles and were wearing beautiful dresses while the bossman himself was decked out in an exquisite pinstripe suit and tie. You kept your cool but it was hard to hide the fact that you were a little impressed at his set up.

"Come on in and have a seat?" he says suddenly as he pours himself a glass of scotch. "I trust you're here about the job listing on the bounty board?" You are surprised he instantly figured out where you were here but did as you were told and took a seat in the big leather chair in front of the desk. "Yes sir, I'm here for the security job." you reply once you've sat down. The man blows a smoke ring as takes a sip of his drink as his two guards look you over.

"Good, good. It's about time we filled that position." he says after a brief silence. "Old Roy is good at what he does but we've been understaffed for a few months now. He's had to deal with all the troublemakers by himself these past few weeks and it's getting harder and harder to convince him to work overtime." The boss rubs his eyes as he takes another sip of his drink and spins around to look out the window at the casino floor.

"You don't look like much, but I'll give you a shot. You'll do a half-day today and then come in tomorrow at nine and work until eleven at night with Roy out front. While working with us you'll be set up at a free room at the Starlight Motel just down the road, it ain't great but it covers the three daily meals and utilities. We'll also need at least a three day commitment to make it worth the cost, sound good?" he says as he lays out the terms and spins back around to face you.

You give him a smile and reach out to shake his hand. "It's a deal boss, three days sounds like just what I need." you reply as he slides over a piece of paper. On it was his official seal and signature. "Very well." he says. "Take that sheet of paper downstairs and take it to the clerk near the exchange windows, she'll get you your gear and show you where the locker room is. Don't disappoint me out there."

After shaking hands and pocketing the paper you wave goodbye to your new boss and pick up your keycard from the guards on the way out. Before doing anything else you check in with the clerk and pick up your equipment. Once you had everything secured in your locker you change into your tuxedo and equipped your concealed baton and a snub nosed revolver.

[All Body, Hands and Feet equipment is removed. Your Tuxedo gives you +1 to your Speech and Stealth skills for as long as it is worn.]

Once you were ready you then headed back outside to stand guard with Roy, who was searching a woman in a tattered jacket. "Alright, you're clean. Go on in." he says as she picks up her purse and follows her boyfriend inside. Roy smiles slightly when he notices you and leans up against the wall. "So you got approved, huh? Guess I shouldn't complain about the extra help. Just do as I tell you and you'll do fine rookie."

You nod your head and take up a spot on the other side of the doors. The warm air was bothersome, but you'd be used to it again some enough. The roof of the casino provided some nice shade as well, probably the hardest part of doing this job wouldn't be the heat, but the long hours and boredom.

"Alright kid, we got some people coming up." Roy calls over as a group of greaser types roll up in a motorized cart. "These guys are members of the Slick 69s, a local gang. They've caused us some trouble in the past, but most of them don't bother us. Search them and stay polite, even if they start acting rude."

The leader of the bunch comes up to you and sneers as his cronies fall in line behind him. "Haven't seen you here before, you the new guard dog protectin' your master's bones?" he says with a laugh as his buddies chuckle. You nod your head and give him a smile. "Yes sir, I'll need to pat you and your boys down before you can go in. I'll also need you to hand over any weapons while you're on the premises."

The leader gives you a sour look. "I'll hand over my weapons, but you don't need to get all grab assy with me. What, you think I'm smugglin' a bomb in these pants? Well, I guess I kinda am..." he replies with a laugh as his friends chuckle again. You cross your arms and try to look tough. "I'm sorry, but your associates have caused us trouble in the past. If you have a problem with being searched you'll need to take it up with the boss and your fellow gang members." you reply.

The leader gives you a glare and the hands over his switchblade and 9mm handgun. "Alright, fine. Me and my boys are just here for a good time. We'll get this shit sorted out so you better just let us in next time." he says as he puts his hands on the wall. After checking him and his entourage for weapons and contraband you open the door for them. "Thank you for your cooperation, sir. Have a good time." you say as they disappear one by one inside.

"Nice job keeping your cool rookie." Roy compliments as the door closes. "Some of those guys like starting shit, but staying polite usually gets them to follow the rules. Don't be afraid to get rough if you get attacked first though. ONLY if you get attacked first." You nod your head and lean against the wall as the next few gamblers approach. Maybe this job would be pretty easy after all.
1211213.title: Gatekeeper

12112131.content:
As the day starts winding down a young woman in a white dress and jacket with disheveled hair begins walking up to you. "Hello ma'am, I'm gonna need to ask you to leave any weapons you have here with me and submit to a quick pat down." you say as she ignores you and keeps walking towards the door. "Ma'am I'm sorry but you can't enter until I'm searched you." you warn in a polite yet firm tone. When she still ignores you you grab her arm and prevent her from opening the door.

"Hey, get off me fucker!" she yells as she tries to pull herself free. "Sorry, but I'm going to have to ask you to leave immediately." you say as she digs inside her jacket and swings at you with a switchblade. You yell "SHIT!" as the blade narrowly misses cutting open you neck and pull out your baton. The woman glares at you and swings the switchblade again, this time aiming for your heart.

[If your Melee skill is 2 or higher you manage to block the attack, otherwise it slice you across the chest and you lose 1 hit point.]

"Damn it, stop!" you shout as you smack her across the face, sending blood flying from her nose and down her face. To your shock she doesn't even react to the blow and makes another quick swing for your heart, slashing open your tuxedo and drawing a small amount of blood. "Holy fuck..." you gasp as you stumble back and give her another good smack across the face, sending several of her teeth flying. Still, she does not even slow down.

She is about to strike again when Roy delivers a sharp blow to the back of her neck, which makes a loud crunching sound. The woman makes a sickening gargling sound as she falls forward onto her own weapon, which pierces her left lung. A pool of blood begins surrounding her as she twitches and then falls silent. "Jesus Christ..." you mutter as you pull your hand away from your chest injury.

The wound wasn't deep but it stung like a bitch and the palm of your hand was now smeared with blood. "Looks like she only managed to wing ya." Roy says as he looks at your torn tuxedo. "We'll have to get you a new one for tomorrow, don't worry, this won't come out of your pay or anything. Boss knows a woman who can repair this stuff on the cheap, it's a common enough hazard on the job after all."

You frown as you wipe away the blood from your chest before it stains your tuxedo and look down at the dead woman. "That was some real shit, drugs?" you ask as Roy shakes his head and pulls the body off to the side. "Most likely. Drugs are one of Old Town's biggest industries and virtually all the local gangs employ runners and dealers. Last incident like this happened about two months back, lost a good man to a couple of tweakers who tried to rip the guy apart. Now you see why we get a big paycheck." he replies as he get back to his post.

Luckily, the rest of the night is uneventful and you are soon able to check out for some well deserved sleep. After saying goodbye to Roy you head over to the Starlight Motel and talk to the manager who shows your your temporary room. It was small and just had the basics, but the bed wasn't half bad, which was the most important part. After a night of mostly sound sleep you headed back to the Sapphire Dancer for your next shift.

Your new tuxedo was a bit more loose fitting, but it was still better than one with a giant hole in the chest. You wave to Roy as you take up your position on the other side of the doors and the day begins. At around noon a nervous guy in a brown suit and hat walks up with a briefcase. "Can I go in, please?" in asks in an apprehensive tone as he looks around. "Sure, but you're not a regular so I'll need to search you. Also hand over any weapons you may be carrying." you reply.

The guy frowns but does as he is told. After checking the briefcase and patting him down you find no weapons aside from a simple straight razor and a pair of brass knuckles. "Can I go in now?" he asks again. You feel like he is hiding something but aren't sure what so you decide to pat him down again. "Alright sir, let me just give one moment to make sure you're clean." you reply.

[If your Stealth skill is 3 or higher you manage to find and confiscate a toothbrush shank before having him escorted off the premises. If not, then he manages to sneak it inside where another guard catches him trying to stab a waitress in the leg and you receive 1 Demerit.]

Later than day a trio of women approach you claiming to be VIPs, but when you ask them for their passes they get angry and claim that they forgot them at home. You tell them that they can't enter as a VIP without a pass and two leave in frustration while the third woman stays behind to argue. After several minutes it becomes clear that she won't be leaving anytime soon without a good reason.

[If your Speech skill is 3 or higher you manage to successfully convince her to go home for the day without causing any more trouble. If not she presents you with a fake pass and runs inside while you're distracted. By the time you catch up with her she is causing a disruption on stage and interrupting some strippers that are trying to dance. After the guards finally pull her out the door she has broken several bottles of wine and assaulted an actual VIP, giving him a black eye. You receive 2 Demerits.]

After all the excitement of the last few hours you were pleased that the early evening visitors were mostly quiet and well-behaved. That all changed about forty minutes before your shift was over when a woman in a leather jacket and sunglasses walked up alongside a man in a tattered white shirt and headband. The woman was holding a wooden bat wrapped in barbed wire and the guy had a kitchen knife with the Slick 69 logo painted on the side.

"Me and my boyfriend are going in. We aren't here to take any shit after the hassle you've caused our boys over the last few days, let us in or I start swinging." the woman growls as she stops in front of you. You cross your arms and try to look intimidating yet friendly, hard as that was. "You folks are welcome, but we gotta search you. You'll also need to turn over all your weapons, including that bat."

The woman laughs as she slings her weapon over her shoulder and spits at your feet. "No, fuck you. We run this town and we came here to enjoy ourselves, not play around with some jackass rent-a-cop. Open that door for us or we fucking break it down." she replies as her companion drags a finger across his throat.

[If your Speech skill is or you have the Intimidating Presence perk you manage to convince them to back off without a fight and they leave. If not they attack you and cause some damage to the front of the casino. You and Roy managed to fend them off without killing them but suffer some nasty hits during the fight. The duo angrily run off swearing revenge and Roy excuses you from work a half an hour early. You lose 1 hit point and receive 1 Demerit.]

You enjoy a lukewarm meal in your apartment and head to bed early so you'll be fresh for your second full day. Amazingly, things mostly went smooth with only a few minor complaints from guests and an incident with a guy trying to convince you to let him sell his wares near the casino entrance. You told him that the boss didn't want any outside business happening right at his doorstep, but he refused to leave even as you searched other visitors and opened the door for them.

Finally, at around noon you grew tired of the guy harassing passersby and asking them if they wanted to buy some canned meat or magazines. You walk over to him and ask what it'll take for him to leave peacefully without causing a ruckus. The man smiles and opens his trench coat so that you could see the various goods he had for sale. "Just buy a hundred bucks worth of merch and I'll hock my goodies on another street corner.

[If you have a Moonsine or Wasteland Martini you can give it to him as a bribe to leave. If not you must buy at least $100 worth of goods from his shop. If your Speech skill is 4 or higher you only need to buy $50 worth of goods instead. If you don't meet any of these requirements you are forced to chase him off just as a senior guard comes to check on you and receive a lecture for moving away from your post. Even when Roy explains the situation he gives you a demerit. You receive 1 Demerit.]

========================
Pornographic Magazine (3) $34
Discreet Prescription $88
Condom (9) $14
Unlabeled Bottle Of Pills (5) $19
Stylish Sunglasses $96
Sneakers $78
========================

With another long day out in the hot sun over you head back to your motel room for one last good night of sleep before your final day of work. Sleep comes quickly but you have a bad feeling as you prepare for work the next morning. It was your last day, but one thing going wrong could screw your big payday, something you really hoped to avoid after half a week of hard work.
12112131.title: Standing Guard

121121311.content:
You wave to Roy as you get in position and lean back against the wall. "Last day, isn't it?" Roy asks as he stubs out a cigarette. You nod and check to make sure your baton and gun were ready and easily accessible. All you have to do is make it through today and you'd have the funds to cover the rest of your trip.

You and Roy talk a bit as the usual bums and gambling addicts show up for their daily fleecing and keep an eye out for anyone looking suspicious. About an hour before noon a woman in a thong, pasties and fancy headdress walks up with a worried frown on her face. She looked to be about ten seconds from crying.

"Hello ma'am. I think I've seen you before, do you work here?" you ask as her eyes fall on you. She seems hesitant to respond and takes a deep breath before replying. "Yeah, I lost my I.D. in a fire last night. My apartment complex suffered a drug lab explosion and half of my room was burnt, including my savings. I barely had time to get out with my outfit before my bed caught fire." she says in an exhausted tone.

"Wow, that's pretty shitty..." you say in a comforting tone. Roy shakes his head as he lets out a sigh. "I know you, Silva right? I can let you in but you'll need to stop by the clerk and pick up a new I.D." he replies solemnly. Silva cringes and folds her hands together. "I know, but those cost $25, right? I just lost all my money and need to find a new place to stay, I can't really afford that... please, can't you talk to someone about this? I can't live on the street... I just kicked a nasty drug addition and I'm still suffering from withdraws..."

Roy frowns as he goes to open the door for her. "I'm sorry Sil, I wish I could help ya but the boss is really cracking down on spending right now, I doubt he'd be happy if I started asking for free shit and I really need money myself right now. This job is all I have." he says as Silva struggles to retain her composure. "It's alright." she says finally as she walks over to the door. "I'll manage somehow, I always have before..."

[You may choose to give Silva any amount of your own money to help her out.]

[If you give her $1 to $25 she thanks you profusely before heading inside.]

[If you give her $26 to $50 she is so relieved that she gives you a hug and improves your mood, you gain +1 to your Speech skill for the next 3 pages.]

[If you give her $51 or more she breaks down crying and tells you that you probably saved her life. The day ahead doesn't seem so intimidating to you anymore now, you get +1 to your Speech skill and +1 to your Endurance skill for the next 3 pages.]

The day wears on slowly as more gamblers head inside. Some argue a bit or try to score freebies but you've gotten used to dealing with the whiners and scam artists. Roy smiles as a wealthy woman in a blue evening gown heads inside and turns to face you. "It's gonna be a shame to see you go, rookie. It hasn't been all sunshine and roses these past few days but it was great to have the help. I'm gonna miss having another watchdog guarding my ass out here with the crazies and troublemakers."

You give him a grin as you gaze at the pink and orange sky overhead. "It was great workin' with ya Roy." you reply as you lean back against the wall of the casino. "I might have to take up some more work here on my way back home after I get done with my business trip. I just hope I made the right choice coming out here, I sunk a good bit of funds on this little vacation of mine... I'd hate for it to just be some wild goose chase."

Roy laughs and you both talk for a few minutes as the light of the setting sun fades into the inky black night sky. The whole street was lit up now with rival casinos and everything from pawn shops to restaurants turning on the signs and lights in the hope of attracting customers. It was all so bright and distracting you didn't even notice the group of figures approaching the front door until they were only a few yards away.

Roy shoots you a cautious glance as he finishes up a story about a friend of his who got robbed downtown and you silenty turn around to greet the new arrivals. It was the Slick 69's again, including the man and woman from before and the guy you met on your first day. There was about a dozen of them in all and most had sour looks painted on their faces while the rest gave you a death glare.

You knew by this point that trouble was coming but decided to keep up the polite and welcoming facade in the hopes of maybe talking them down and avoiding a conflict. "Good evening ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Sapphire Dancer." you say as you casually slip your hand onto the handle of your revolver. "Before you all head in I'll need you to ask you to leave your weapons at the door and submit to a quick search."

A tall guy in sunglasses, a red bandana and spike studded leather jacket stepped up and cracked his knuckles. No doubt this guy was the leader. With a quick wave of his hand the rest of the crew drew knives, clubs, chains and a few guns as well. Things were starting to look more than a little grim. You tightened your grip on your revolver as you waited for the guy to speak.

After nearly a minute of smug smirking he did just that. "Good evening, little pups. I'm Johnny Napalm, the leader of this little posse. Now you wanna tell me why you been mistreating my guys whenever they show up to have a good time? Hell, there's no way you guys will stay in business with such shitty practices driving away paying customers." Both you and Roy stayed silent as Johnny lit up a cigarette and leaned against a support pillar.

Finally, Roy decided to speak up just as Johnny exhaled a puff of smoke. "You should have reigned your boys in more, we lost two guards to conflicts started by the Slick 69's in the past and have even had to repair damages from vandalism done by your crew and the junkies you sell drugs to. If you don't want to get searched every time you come here you should behave yourselves better and no piss off the boss so much."

Johnny laughs along with his crew as lowers his sunglasses. "Well shit partner, all you had to do was ask! Tell you what, you let us in right now and we'll all be on our best behavior, scout's honor." he says with a big grin as a few of his thugs chuckle. "Yeah, you tell these punks, Johnny!" the woman from before yelled as her boyfriend cheered his boss on. You didn't like the way things were going.

"You know I can't just let you in after all the trouble you caused... but I can have a talk with the boss about it." Roy said in a steady tone as he leaned back against the wall. "In fact, my partner here only has a little under an hour of their shift left. If you're patient we can have this whole thing sorted out with no bloodshed, what do you say?"

Johnny smiled and then frowned as he stubbed out his cigarette and drew a 9mm pistol from his jacket. "Afraid not, we came here to party, not wait around. We were thinking of just a little gambling and drinking, maybe a rape or two to put your little club in its place, but now? I think we'll just bust down the fuckin' door and shoot the place up for shits and giggles, what do you say to t-"

Before anyone could react Roy had drawn his own gun and put one right through the back of Johnny's throat before he could get another word out. His entire gang stood in stunned silent for a moment as their leader's body fell to the cold ground with a thud before opening fire and beginning their assault. Roy managed to pick off two more, one with a hatchet and one with a handgun before taking two slugs from a .32 revolver in his side.

You drew your own weapon and put another gangster down just as they aimed their gun at Roy and then dunked behind a nearby support pillar just as they returned fire. Glass shattered behind you as Roy made a mad dash inside to get help while you popped out the other side of the pillar to cap a guy on the edge running up with a machete. Nearly half of the assailants were dead, but they were rushing your position as their buddies provided support fire.

You managed to take out two guys running at you with melee weapons, one of which was the guy who had threaten you back on your first day. You had to admit, seeing his shocked face as two revolver rounds punctured his lungs and heart was pretty satisfying. Unfortunately, just as you finished up a quick reload with some spare bullets the couple from the other day managed to get close enough to knock the gun out of your hand with a bat.

You quickly withdrew your baton as the woman swung her bat at your face and her boyfriend attempted to run you through with a kitchen knife.

[If your Melee skill is 4 or higher you avoid any serious wounds and managed to hold your own in the fight. If not, they manage a few devastating hits that leave you reeling. You lose 2 hit points.]

You wait for the boyfriend to slip up and beat him over the head when he lunges forward, grabbing his knife in the process and planting it in his neck. "Oh no! Phil!" the woman cries out in shock and grief as he slumps against the nearby pillar and slides to the ground. You take advantage of this and slice open the woman's belly while she is caught off guard and then smash her skull into paste with her own bat as soon as she falls to her knees.

You gasp as you wipe a bit of sweat and blood from your face and go to retrieve your revolver from the ground. Just as you go to raise it you see a very pissed off looking man aiming a sawn-off shotgun at your chest. You freeze when you realize you won't be able to get off a shot in time just as a hail of gunfire cuts the man down along with a few of his buddies that were standing behind him.

"Thank god, it's about time..." you say exasperatedly as you slump to the ground and catch your breath. The few remaining Slick 69's flee as fresh guards dressed in tuxedos arrive on the scene wielding machine guns and rifles. The main door was completely shot to hell but at least you were alive...
121121311.title: What A Day...

1211213111.content:
You follow a trio of guards past the shattered glass and twisted frame of the front door while the others head outside to survey the damage and clean up the bodies. "Hell of a night out there, but you did good rookie." one of the men says as he leads you past a guard trying to calm down a small crowd of panicked gamblers and guests. "Thanks. You got there just in time." you reply as you head into the locker room to change out of your messy clothes.

[You regain all of your Head, Body and Feet items and removed your Tuxedo.]

After cleaning yourself up a bit one of the guards excuses you to go head over to the clinic to make sure you were okay. You thank them as you put your normal clothes back on and head back out onto the main floor. By the time you walk across the room to the back hallway you noticed that most of the people had moved backed to gambling away their money on slots, roulette and poker. You shook your head as you opened a door with a large red cross on it and stepped inside.

The room was fairly clean for a wasteland medic station, aside from some dust, a little crime and faded bloodstains everything was nice and shiny. A woman with grey hair up in a bun scribbled something down on her clipboard as she got up from her desk to greet you. "Ah, another one. Let's see what the damage is, follow me." she says as she walks over to a chair and asks you to sit down.

After running some tests she concludes that you're in good enough condition to be moving around and have no life threatening injuries, which means that any fixing up you want done comes out of your own pocket. On the plus side you do get a company discount since you haven't officially finished your three days until you see the boss and collect your payment. Yay.

[You may pay $20. If you do you gain up to 2 hit points.]

[If your Speech skill is 3 or higher or if you have the Doctor perk you manage to convince the doctor to give you a shot of morphine for the pain. You take -1 damage from all sources for the next 5 pages.]

After your check up the doctor asks you to take a seat on a bed near the back room while she checks a few of your x-rays to make sure none of your bones are broken. You head over to a clean white mattress when you notice Roy sitting up in a bed near the corner of the room. "Shit, are okay?" you ask as you sit down on the side facing him.

"Holy shit, kid? I thought for sure you'd died in that bloodbath! Damn, you don't look like you got a scratch on you... hell, I'm impressed. Real impressed." Roy replies with a pained smile. "I took some lead out there, came within an inch of having my kidney popped and narrowly avoided a puncture wound to by intestines. I'm lucky to be alive."

You let out a sigh as you lean back a bit. "I'm glad you made it, I nearly died myself. If not for the back up arriving when they did I'd have a face that looks like swiss cheese right about now. One of those gangster thugs had a sawn off shotgun leveled right at my head when he got mowed down. Another second and I'd been laying in the pile of bodies outside."

Roy shakes his head as he clutches his side. "Damn, sounds like we both lucked out big time. Heh. Maybe we should hit the tables before we go home tonight." he replies through pained gasps. You grin and let him continue as the doctor walks over to you. "The pain is the worst part, you'll get used to it kid. I'm glad I was wrong about you."

You nod your head as the doctor gives you your test results and are relied to find that you have no broken bones, internal bleeding or other serious injury. "Thanks, doc. I'll see you around Roy. You should definitely ask the boss for a promotion for this." you say as you get up and head for the door. "Ha ha, will do, kid. Will do." Roy calls back as the door shuts behind you. It was nice to see that at least a few things went right tonight.

You take a breath and then head back up the stairs to the main office to collect your hard earned money. The bossman was smoking a cigar and sipping on booze as he was last time you met up with him while looking out at the guards returning to their posts on the casino floor. After a minute of reflection on the nights events he turns to face you with a satisfied grin. You simply nod your head and sit back in your chair as he digs your cash out of his suit and puts it on the table.

"You did great work out there tonight. Those assholes were harassing us for months until you show up and take half of the crew out in one night. Shame about the door, but it's like they say... if you want to make an omelette... ha ha. Anyway, he's your dough." he says as he stacks a small pile of bills on the table. You quickly scoop it up and begin counting as the boss pours you a drink. You now have enough money to fund your trip and even have a little extra in spending cash.

[You gain $200 minus $25 for each Demerit you acquired while on guard duty. If you gave money to Silva you lose 1 Demerit.]

You let a satisfied smile spread across your lips as you tucked the money away and stood to leave only for the boss to hold his hand up and stop you. "Just one sec before you head out, okay? I know you just wanted the three day job, but I got another task that needs dealing with... you could always use more spending money, right?" he says as he folds his hands on the table. His lady bodyguards give you piercing glances as you sit back down and cross your legs.

"Alright, I'll hear you out on this offer, but I've already wasted enough time in this city. I wouldn't be able to work more than another day at the most." you reply as you take a sip of your drink. The boss nods in appreciation. "Good. Good. This job won't take long at all. I just need someone to look into what happened to one of my girls. She hasn't shown up for work in almost a week and I think something might have happened."

You sigh and rub your eyes. "Let me guess. You want me to track her down and bring her back here, right?" you asked as you take another sip of your drink. The boss frowns as he exhales a puff of smoke. "It's a bit more complicated than that, she owes me a debt and I don't think she'd have the courage to skip town. Personally, I think she might be a corpse by now, but who cares? All I want is the money. If you find her, great, bring her here and I'll pay you a little extra... but the cash is your number one priority."

You thought over the job this guy was proposing. This would likely require some detective work but you could get it wrapped up tonight if you did a little investigating. Of course, you didn't have a lot of time to waste either... getting started on a job could greatly delay you even more if things go poorly. You didn't really need the money but a little extra cash was always good.

The boss seems to sense your hesitation and gives you a reassuring laugh. "Hey, don't worry if you can't do it. You already fulfilled your contract and are free to go at anytime. I can always get someone else to do this but I know you'll get results, that's why I'm offering you hard cash. If you'd rather head off with a lighter coin purse I'm sure I can find a replacement."

You take a few more moments to think as you relax in your chair.
1211213111.title: Payday!

12112131111.content:
"I'll take the job, boss." you reply before finishing off your drink. The boss grins upon hearing these words and takes out a few bills to hand to you. "Good, good. That's what I like to hear, you're a real go getter kid. Here's a bit up front to handle any minor expenses you run into on the job. You'll get the rest when you complete your assignment, sound good?" he replies. You nod your head and pocket the cash.

[You gain $50.]

"Thank you sir, I'll head out as soon as you give me the details." you say as he lights up a fresh cigar. He smiles and offers you one, but you decline. "I'll get right to the point so you can get moving." he says as he swings his chair around to grab a folder from a nearby filing cabinet. "Just give me a second to find Jenny's profile... ah, here it is."

The boss opens a folder on his desk and hands you a picture of a young woman who looked to be in her late twenties. She had black hair tied up into a short pony tail, green piercing eyes, tan skin and a tiny scar near her lower lip. She wasn't particularly busty compared to most of the other girls you've seen working here, but she still looked to be a cup size or two above the average woman. It was hard to tell in the photo, but she also appeared to be wearing some sort of sleek leather jacket with a tank top underneath.

"Pretty sexy, boss." you note as you try to memorize as many details as you can. "This our missing girl?" The boss nods and blows a ring of smoke as he organizes the other papers in the folder. After giving you a minute to become familiar with your target he hands you a bio and a small folder paper with a directions to a street address on it. "Here's all of her info that I can share." the boss says as you fold the directions up and put them away before reading the profile. The boss continues talking as you do your research.

"Name: Jenny Garland. Sex: Female. Blood Type: O- Age: Unknown. Living Relatives: Unknown. Our girl Jenny here has a contract with my casino that covers her debt owed for past goods and services rendered by the Sapphire Dancer. In short, she owns me a bundle and has tried to get out of it in the past. She hasn't ever tried to skip town, but she has met with many shady characters during her time with us. She's probably dead, but that isn't what's important. What I want is simple: her stash."

You raise an eyebrow as you look up from the biography. "Her stash? Is she some kind of druggie?" you ask. The boss laughs along with his bodyguards as he hands you a small note with a code on it. "No, her addictions were of a different kind. She's an augment junkie, addicted to getting expensive cybernetic upgrades and hoarding tech. Like I said, she's probably gone but there is a small chance I can still get her goods. It won't cover her entire debt but it looks like the best I'll get."

You nod as you take the code and put it away. "I see, this is just a simple retrieval job then." you reply. The boss frowns and blows another smoke ring while handing you a small photo with a small electronic device on it. "No quite. The stash is your main priority, but I what that girl back if at all possible. She still owes me a lot and may have gotten mixed up with some bad people in this town. I'll pay you for the stash, but if you can recover her, dead or alive, or at least bring back this cyber implant I'll give you a hefty bonus."

You look at the photo of the tiny machine before handing it back. "That augmentation? It's valuable?" you ask. The boss nods as he takes a long drag on his cigar. "It's worth fifty times what I paid you tonight, maybe more. It's an ultra rare charisma booster model, worth thousands on the blackmarket scene. I don't care if you trace it all the way to the biggest kingpin in the city, you get it back for me and I make it rain."

You smile as you get up and stretch your arms. "Get the stash, get the girl if possible and return here with the gadget for a massive payday... I think I got." you say as you head for the door. "See you later tonight, hopefully." The boss smiles upon hearing this and tells you not to disappoint him. With that you step out of through the shattered front door and walk off into the night.
12112131111.title: A Girl And Her Toys

choices: Head back with what you have
121121311111.content:
The cool night air blew gently across your skin as you walked down the nearly deserted street to the address you were given. It was a pleasant change from the afternoon heat and crowds of deadbeats and druggies walking about, but the atmosphere was a little creepy under the big crescent moon hanging overhead. Still, you had your gear back and were more than a match for any random punks that tried messing with you, which was a pretty big confidence booster.

After a little over twenty minutes of walking you came to a long desert street dotted with rusted out cars, trucks and a hallowed out bus serving as a sort of makeshift fence on the far intersection. This place was a lot less polished than most of what you'd see so far in Old Town and was clearly some sort of slum where the less fortunate residents lived. The only positive thing you could think to say was that most of the buildings were still standing and relatively intact at least, though most had boarded up windows and locked doors.

You check the address again and head over to a large apartment building with a few lights visible through the front windows. The place had clearly seen better days but looked to have some regular maintenance and running electricity, which was more than could be said for most of its neighbors. You walk up a few stone steps to the front door and knock once before entering. Assuming it was okay to come inside you step into a short hallway with raggedy olive green carpet covering the floor.

At the far end was a big guy in a tank top sitting in a comically small metal folding chair in front of a stairwell who looked you over as you approached. As you got closer you noticed a large baseball bat studded with nuts and bolts propped up against the wall behind him. The guy honestly looked pretty intimidating, but you were here on business and determined to get inside by any means necessary. He pulls a toothpick out of his mouth and folds his arms as you go to address him.

[If your Speech skill is 2 or higher you manage to bluff your way past him by claiming to be a city investigator here to collect payment from the owner in exchange for covering up a crime. If not you have to pay him a small bribe. You lose $10.]

With muscles taken care of you quickly head up the stairwell to the fifth floor where Jenny's room was located. The smell of mildew was strong even in the hallway but you knew the quicker you searched the room the soon you could leave this place. After carefully stepping over a discarded syringe and some festering trash bags you come to room 504 and gently knock on the door so as not to disturb anyone. It was pretty late and the last thing you need was to cause a scene and attract unwanted attention.

When Jenny doesn't answer the door you draw your revolver and carefully turn the knob. To your surprise the door slid open without so much as a squeak from the hinges. Not missing a beat you walked into the tiny 3 room apartment and checked to see if anyone was here. It was hard navigating past all of the piles and stacks of junk but you managed to avoid knocking anything over as you did a quick sweep of the main room, bedroom and bathroom. Nothing.

Now that you knew the coast was clear you immediately began looking for the safe she had hidden somewhere. After nearly an hour of carefully moving around boxes, paintings and shelves you found it under a pile of dirty clothes in the bathroom tub. "Ugh, are you kidding me...?" you groan in frustration as you pinch your nose and try typing in the code the boss gave you. Unfortunately, it was incorrect and locked the handle in place.

[If your Science skill is 3 or higher or you have the Explosive Crafter perk you managed to pop the lock open. Inside were some loose bills and a few scrawled notes. You gain $235 and 3 Clues.]

After inspecting the safe you head over to the PC sitting on a desk in the main room next to a towering stack of old tapes, CDs video cards and DVDs. Working personal computers were a rare luxury in the wasteland and this model appeared to be both advanced and in good shape. You remembered hearing from a courier a while back that some of the biggest settlements have even managed to restore working internet for their richer citizens.

It was exciting to think that you might get a chance to see such an amazing feature firsthand but you were quickly left with disappointment when you booted the thing up and found everything still offline. It made since as Scrap City, despite being one of the largest settlements in the region, was still pretty small compared to some of the ones in the far east. "Maybe in a decade for so." you say solemnly as you look over the files on the desktop.

At least the password your boss gave you had worked this time. After reading over the documents you download all of the information onto a connected USB drive and remove it from the computer. You had seen some pretty cool info and knew it would fetch a high price to the right buyer, but the boss would probably ask to keep it. Oh well, you still had more work to do anyway. You grab a few intact magazines from a nearby stack and continue your work.

[You gain 2 Workin' Indoors, 1 Doctor Bags And Pill Bottles and 3 Clues.]

After getting all you can from the computer you head to the bathroom to take a leak and maybe find some more useful stuff. Aside from some rusty pipes, a tub full of old laundry and a safe there wasn't really a lot to look for in here. The medicine cabinet was empty, the mirror didn't have a false back like you'd hoped and the walls didn't conceal anything but maybe some mold and grime. Still, you take a few minutes to search and make sure.

[If your Stealth skill is 2 or higher you manage to uncover a small metal box hidden in the back tank of the toilet. Inside is Jenny's medicine stash and a personal note to pick up some more supplies. You gain 1 Aspirin, 2 Unlabeled Bottle Of Pills and 1 Clue.]

With the bathroom taken care of you move on to the bedroom. There should definitely be some nice stuff in here. You search all of the drawers, the closet and the shelves. You mostly just find things like worn out clothes, discarded computer junk and old magazines but there are a few cool things you take notice of as well.

[You gain 1 Guns And Bullets Without The Bullshit, 1 Ninja Boy And Gadget Girl, 1 Leopard Print Thong and 1 Clue.]

[If your Sex skill is 3 or higher you notice a highly suspicious looking shoebox near the back of the closet labeled "SPARE PARTS" and open it to find a nice little stash of "entertainment" items. You gain 2 Condoms, 1 New People New Passions, 1 Exotic Tastes, 1 More Than Just Butt Stuff, 1 Discreet Prescription, 1 Electric Massager and 2 Bag Of Batteries.]

[If your Melee skill is 3 or higher you manage to break the lock off of a footlocker under the bed and find several receipts and order forms from various local tech stores and pawn shops. You gain 3 Clues.]

[If you have the Lucky perk you accidentally stumble near the closet and pull down several tattered old clothes... revealing a rare outfit tucked away behind a large coat. You gain 1 Hazmat Suit.]

Finally, after searching all over the bed room you do a final sweep of the main room to see if you may have missed anything. You move around anything that isn't nailed down and keep an eye out for anything that may be hidden or suspicious looking.

[If your Stealth skill is 4 or higher you notice a small wooden box duct taped to the underside of a table near the couch and open it up. Inside you find several personal notes and a log of fees paid to a shady sounding individual along with a distinctive looking signature on one of the papers. You gain 5 Clues.]

[If your Traps skill is 2 or higher you notice that a lot of notes make reference to augments commonly seen on assassins and hitmen such as retractable blades and bomb dischargers. While Jenny seems mostly uninterested in these types of augments it does shed some light on where who she may have visited recently. You gain 2 Clues.]

[If you have the Master Chef perk you notice that Jenny has several expensive spices sitting in her cabinet and check the bottles. Instead of ingredients you find chemicals typically used in human augmentation and trace amounts of unidentified drugs. One of the bottles even has a short list of recent transactions done on behalf of a drug dealer with associations with several local thugs. Very interesting. You gain 3 Clues.]

When you're sure you've found everything you possibly can you add all the information you've uncovered and see if you can uncover a lead. It was clear that Jenny was indeed trying to skip town to avoid paying her debt, but she's been so busy it's hard to pin where she might be at now. After leaving the room you head downstairs to the guard and ask him a few questions about some of the names and places you learned about. He begrudgingly tells you what little he knows and offers to give you some directions for a little cash.

[You may pay $100. If you do you gain 3 Clues.]

With all of your resources exhausted you head back out into the night.
121121311111.title: Apartment Investigation

choices: [Speech 4] Claim you really are Jenny's friend
[Guns 4] Pull out your own gun and disarm him
1211213111111.content:
After assembling all of your clues and going over everything you found you noticed a few names kept coming up over and over. Apparently Jenny was working with some slavers sometime before she disappeared, quite recently too if the dates are to be believed. What an augment junkie would want to do with those scumbags wasn't clear, but her trips to a local pawn shop just outside the slums made a little more sense.

Several sources indicated that she bought most of her tech from this little store, including a few of her augments, quite impressive for such a small business.
