You had a feeling in your gut that this place was probably a front for something and probably heavily guarded, but with no other leads you'd have to head into the lion's den and hope for the best. After checking to make sure your revolver was loaded and ready for action you headed off to your next destination.

It was a fairly short walk, a little under fifteen minutes when you came to a slightly more lively neighborhood make up of poor folks and street bums huddled around barrel fires and sleeping on worn mattresses in tattered tents. Most people were in bed trying to get a decent amount of sleep but there were a few vagrants and drifters sitting around talking and sipping on cups of cheap water. There were a few different stores to be found and you didn't feel like wasting the time it would take to visit them all so you headed over to a few men in grimy shirts and baseball hats and asked for directions.

They seemed a bit distant at first but once you got to talking a man with a rag hat perked up and told you that he knew the place you were looking for. You are about to ask him to tell you where it is when he grins with a mouth full of crooked teeth and holds out his hand. Seems he wasn't interested in helping without a small kickback. You sigh and look the man over, he was clearly desperate and in need of the cash so it'd be hard to convince him to part with the info for free.

[If your Speech skill is 3 or higher you managed to convince the man that you are broke. If not you must pay him a small amount to get him to cough up the directions. You lose $25.]

After dealing with the men you wished them all luck and headed off down the street to the intersection and headed left down a cracked road lit up with dim streetlights. You kept an eye out for a placed called "New Machines" like it had said on the notes you had and found and breathe a sigh of relief when you come across a small brick building with a lit up interior. It was still open at least, that was probably a good sign.

You gently pushed the front door open and the soft ding of a bell drew the attention of the elderly shopkeeper reading a magazine near the back counter. "Oh, welcome! I'll be right with you!" he says as he marks his spot gets up from his chair to meet you. You give him a smile as he shakes your hand and escorts you over to the counter. "Did you come here looking for something in particular or would you like to see some of our new items we just picked up from a trade caravan?" he says excitedly as you look around.

The place may have been small but it was clear from the shelves and stacks of gadgets that this little old man had a deep knowledge of technology and was likely a professional when it came to repair and maintenance of things like computers and robotics. "Wow, so many mechanical doodads and gizmos. You must be a real master when it comes to tech stuff. I take it this is a specialty store?" you asked in an impressed tone.

The old man gives you a grin as he gestures to all of the spare parts lining his counter and stands back so that you can get a good look. "Why yes stranger, I've been working with machines my whole life. You hear about that plane that they got working up in Brownsand a few decades back? My daddy had a direct hand in that, him and his crew. I don't mean to brag, but when it comes to vehicles, computers or augments you couldn't be in better hands."

You smile at the mention of augments but try not to give away why you came here as the man holds up a fancy tool and begins listing its various features. You politely listen for a few minutes as the old man shows you some of his more popular items like miniature gun cleaning stations and food sanitizers before walking over to a shelf and pretending to be interested in something. When the shop owner walks over to ask if you found something you casually step back and pretend to think for a moment.

"Hmmm... you mentioned augments, didn't you? I've heard of those... quite expensive but supposed to be well worth the money." you say as the pawn owner raises an eyebrow. "I've had a few friends who got augmented, but it was never my thing. Bit of a waste of hard earned cash, if you ask me." you finish as you turn around to look at the front door. You could tell the guy who ran this place knew his stuff and would hate to lose a potential customer... especially one interested in something as expensive as augments.

The old man quickly grabs your hand and turns you back around. "Now now, I can assure you that augments are well worth the steep price, provided you get them from a proper medical professional such as myself. Is there any chance I could talk you into seeing what I have on offer? I just got a fresh shipment of top of the line goods from my supplier, excellent hardware I assure you."

You frown and pretend to be disinterested for a moment before turning to the door and back again. "Well, alright... I suppose it couldn't hurt to look." you say with a fake sigh. The man lights up upon hearing this and begins escorting you to the back door behind the counter. "Ah yes, that's the spirit young one! Just follow me, I promise you won't be disappointed!" he says as he unlocks the door and ushers you into a small back room styled like a medical clinic.

He asks you to have a seat while he hands you a clipboard listing all of the available augmentations he has available. You look over the list and wonder if maybe you should get an augment after all. The procedure didn't take long at all and you'd still have plenty of time to catch up to jenny. The choice is yours.

[If your Science skill is 5 you manage to impress the pawn owner so much with your knowledge of augmentation and robotics that he discounts all of his Augments by $100 for a one-time exclusive offer.]

=================
Neural Reflex Enhancer $250
Cyber Eye $250
Detoxifier Module $300
Steel Knuckles $250
Refined Grip $250
Foot Guards $250
Gel Muscle Infusion $500
=================

After looking over the various augments and deciding if cybernetic enhancement is something you're interested in you get up from the chair and follow the old man back out into the main room of the pawn shop. "Before I go there is one more thing I'd like to talk about, if you don't mind?" you ask as the man goes back to reading his magazine. He looks up for a moment, sighs, and then puts the magazine back down before turning his attention to you.

"Sure thing, what do you need to know? Want to learn more about augmentation technology?" he asks in a somewhat hopeful tone as you stretch your arms. "No thanks, I've learned plenty about augmentation for today. I know its late and we're both probably a little tired but I just had a few questions before I head home. First, do you know anything about a woman named Jenny Garland?" you reply as the man rubs his chin.

"Hmmm... Jenny? Yes... I may have had a customer with that name... or maybe it was a Judy? Julie? Anyway, why do you need this information? I'm not in the habit of disclosing personal info on my clients you know..." he says in a hesitant tone as if he's trying to hide something. You try not to grin as you think over your response. This guy definitely knows where she went, you just need to get the information out of him.

"Sorry if I appear nosy." you reply as you give him a smile. "You see, Jenny was a friend of mine... a close friend... and I think she might be in trouble. She's been missing for days and I just got word some casino thugs are after her." The old man grimaces as he puts his hand over his mouth. "Oh... oh no, I thought she'd have more time. Her old boss must really want to collect on her debt... which is why he sent you here!"

Before you can react the pawn owner pulls a silenced pistol from under his coat and levels it at your chest. "Fuck." you think to yourself when you realize how careless it was to lower your guard. "This guy is protecting her... but that also means he helped her escape." You put up your hands as the guy takes a step back and leans on his counter, never moving the gun an inch as he stares you down.

"Leave now. Jenny has already left. Your boss won't get his money and I don't care if he comes after me. If you go now I'll let you live, but forget about finding that girl. She's gone." he says in a worried tone. It was clear he was putting on a brave face to disguise his fear, but that could work to your advantage. "Easy now." you say as you take a few steps towards the door and think up your next response.
1211213111111.title: Following A Lead

12112131111111.content:
"I'll leave if that's what you really want, but I AM Jenny's friend. We worked together at the Sapphire Dancer casino, she was a stripper and I was one of the guards." you say as you take a few more steps back. The man's expression softens slightly as you force yourself to cry a few fake tears. "I... I'm glad she's safe, honestly... I just... I never got a chance to say goodbye."

The old man frowns as he looks you over. From what you could tell he was buying your lie and struggling to keep his gun on you. For all of his tech knowledge this guy was clearly a big softie at heart. "I-I'll go." you say with a sniffle. "Just let her know I'll miss her if you see her again." The man lowers his gun and curses under his breath. You frowns at you once again before putting the guy away and apologizes. "I'm sorry kid... it's just... Jenny has some bad people after her, I didn't want to take chances. She's lucky to have someone who cares for her like you."

You smile and wipe your eyes as he continues. "Jenny made an appointment with a group of slavers, horrible villains, to ship herself out of town in one of their undercover transports. She leaves tonight, youngster, I doubt you'll be in time to catch her... but I can give you directions." He pulls out a piece of paper and gives you an address near the far side of Old Town by the wall. "I'll warn you now, these people don't like visitors unless they're on business. Watch yourself and... good luck youngster. Tell her goodbye for me too."

You give the man a hug, pocket the directions and bid him farewell as you head back out onto the streets. It was still a few hours until dawn, but the place jenny was at was pretty far away so you didn't waste any time heading out. Even if she wasn't there she couldn't have gotten far, you'd track her down no matter what.

After rounding a corner you paused for a brief moment to catch your breath. All this walking was a real pain in the ass, though it would hopefully be worth it. You look up at a train yard surrounded by a rusted chain-link fence with a few wooden shacks set up on the dead grass and gravel. This looked like the place the pawn broker had described, you just hoped you weren't too late.

You head on up to the open gates and nodded to the guardsman in leather armor as you walked over. "Welcome stranger, most of our stock is spoken for at the moment but we're still accepting appointments. No lookie loos, however. If you wanna see the goods and don't have an appointment you'll have to cough up some cash." he says in a gruff tone as he lights up a smoke. You frown as you look up at the main building. You really didn't want to waste any more time.

[If your Speech skill is 3 or higher you manage to convince the man that you're here on business. If not you begrudgingly hand over $50 as insurance of your good behavior.]

"Alright, go ahead in." the man says as he hands you a small red badge. "Keep that on you at all times and don't cause trouble. If you behave like an ass you'll find yourself in a cage or in the ground. Looking is fine, but don't manhandle the merchandise or pester the guards unless you plan on buying. Lastly, don't forget to check back with me and hand in your badge before leaving."

You nod your head as you pin the badge to a free spot on your clothes and walk past the gate. Only a few guards were up and about at this hour, along with a couple slaves cowering in cages or holding pens. As a guard with a rifle walks by on his way to the security outpost you ask for a few directions and describe Jenny to him. "Oh, that hot little number? Yeah, she's spoken for I'm afraid, but she hasn't shipped out yet. Maybe you can convince the boss to sell her to you. Just head inside the station and look for the guy in the sunglasses and red suit. Can't fuckin' miss him" he replies.

You thank the guard and head inside. The interior of the station was connected to a short tunnel leading through the rubble wall surround Old Town, making it clear how most of the slavers moved their product. You walk past a row of cages filled with crying brats and weeping adults and head up a wooden walkway leading to a platform where a guy matching the guards description was talking to a woman in an army helmet.

After dismissing her you walked over and introduced yourself. "Hi, I'm looking for a girl you agreed to transport named Jenny. Any chance I could see her?" you ask as the guy shakes your hand. "That augmented chick with the cyber parts? I dunno, friend. Our company may deal in slavery, but we tend to keep our word. We promised to get her out of the city, going back on that deal wouldn't be good for business once folks found out about it."

You smile and mention the Sapphire Dancer along with the reason why you were sent out here in the first place, causing the guy's expression to light up. "Old DeWitt wants the girl for a debt, then? Alright, maybe we can work something out, but here's the rub. If we turn this girl over to you we need a guarantee she won't us any problems in the future for selling her out." he says as he checks his clipboard.

"I don't think anyone would hear from her again the way my boss was talking." you reply with a smirk. The guys grins and pulls a key out of his pocket. "Sounds good, got the key right here... now we just need to settle on expenses. What are you offering for her?" It takes a moment of bartering but you soon convince the guy to part with her in exchange for a cut of your pay. You both shake hands again and he hands you the key to her cell.

"She's being kept in the back, I'll send word not to load her container with the others. Unfortunately, our next shipment is scheduled for departure and leaves in the next half hour. You have until then to get miss Jenny out of here, otherwise my boss will come for her and load her up himself. Just because I can't be reasoned with doesn't mean he's willing to risk his business reputation. Remember: get her out in the next thirty minutes or just leave her. If you get caught I'll deny everything, understand?"

You take a deep breath, thank the slaver captain and head off to finally claim your prize. All your all-night ordeal it felt good to finally be so close to your target. After distracting a guard near the door to the back rooms you sneak in and carefully creep down a short hallway pass several small rooms. You turn around a corner and silently unlock the door you had been told about. As soon as the lock was free you closed the door behind you and relocked it in case a guard came by.

"Who's there? Is it time for me to leave yet?" came a soft whisper from a nearby shipping crate as a young woman pulled aside the lid and got out. "Ah, there you are! Jenny, I presume?" you exclaim as you turn to give her a friendly smile. "I'm here on behalf of Morgan DeWitt, your old boss."

The woman standing before you had a glowing blue cybernetic eye, short hair, a thin scar near her forehead and was wearing a mechanic jumpsuit. Aside from that, everything matched the photo you had seen perfectly, this was definitely your girl. "Oh no... what did you find me?" Jenny asked as she took a step back. "Relax, I'm not going to hurt you, I just need your stash." you reply in a comforting tone.

"M-My stash, you mean by cybernetics stash?" Jenny asked as she backed up against the wall. "Most of it's gone now, I sold it to afford this... please, just let me go. Tell you boss I'm dead." You frown as you put a hand on your revolver. "I'm terribly sorry, but I was already promised a big payday for this job." you reply. Jenny glares at you as she bites her lower lip.

"Alright, alright... how about this. I saved up a little money to help start a new life with, if you'll let me alone and tell your boss I'm dead I'll give it to you in addition to the location of my stash, deal?" she offers with a hopeful look. "You can still get your big reward for getting what my boss really wants and I get to walk away. The stash is what he cares about, not me. Just let me go."

You think it over as you lean up against the wall. The boss really did make it clear that the stash was all he wanted, you'd still get your money even if most of it was gone. However, he also made it clear that he wanted the girl, alive if possible, delivered to him as well if you wanted a big fat juicy bonus. Either way, your future would have a lost of cash in it. You looked Jenny in the face and gave her a smile.

"It's a deal, honey. Give me your savings and the location of your stash and I'll let you leave." you reply happily. Jenny breathes a sigh of relief and thanks you as she takes out a tiny leather pouch out of her pocket and tosses it to you. "It sucks I'm broke now, but i can make due. Everything is in there, the money and the password to my stash, which I hid in a dumpster near my apartment. You got what you wanted, now please go. They'll be coming for me any minute."

[You gain $300 and 10 Caps]
12112131111111.title: Last Stop

choices: Stay a little while and play a few games
12112131112.content:
"I'm sorry sir, but I'm heading out of town soon. I need to rest up and prepare for the next leg of my journey." you reply as you get up to leave. The bossman shrugs and lets out a sigh. H e was clearly disappointed but kept his word and let you walk to the door with no trouble. "Suit yourself then. Best of luck to ya kid." he calls as he swings his chair back around to look down on the subjects of his gambling empire. "Thank you, sir." you reply halfheartedly as you close the door and head back downstairs several dollars richer.

Just as you are about to walk out the front door you turn back around to face the casino floor where you could hear excited patrons winding cranks, piling chips and spinning roulette wheels... all hoping for their own big payday. You knew half the games in this place where probably fixed in favor of the house, but enough luck could overcome just about anything. After all the hard work you put in over the last few days you could definitely do with a bit of relaxation and maybe some additional spending money.

You look once again at the front door and then shift you gaze back at the games of chance on the main floor...
12112131112.title: The Lure Of Wealth

choices: [Stealth 2] Quickly select three cards without paying
121121311122.content:
As much as you needed a good time right now you knew it was best to get some rest and plan for the rest of your trip. You still have a lot of ground to cover and you've already wasted over a week just getting the funds to move past Scrap City. As much as you'd like to take your time, it wasn't luxury you currently had. Life was harsh in the wasteland and it was first come first serve even in the more civilized parts. The last thing you needed was to find out that this whole big adventure was for nothing because you arrived a day or two late.

You headed over to the Starlight Motel for one last night in Old Town and got up early the next day to find a way back to the Bluebrick. Your best bet was to head back to the tunnel that Lyle used to get you here in the first place. On your way back to the edge of the debris wall where you came in you come across a strange old woman in a fortuneteller outfit sitting at a small booth on the side of the street. She looked to be about 80 or 90 years old and was staring intently at a crystal ball despite appearing to be completely blind in both eyes.

"Youuu young traveler..." she suddenly speaks as you pass by. "Yesss, you who have come a place of sin and vice... come to meee..." A cool breeze blows by as she says the words and you feel yourself stopping in place right in front of her. Who was this old woman and why does she seem so... alien? "I'm not that young." you reply as you turn to face her. "But I'm not even half as old as you are."

The old woman laughs as she pulls out a deck of Tarot cards and begins shuffling them. "Will you one day be as old as I? Will you ever be rich? Marry? Have kids? Find true happiness? I know. I know all about youuuuu... your past... your present... your futureee..." she wheezes through her raspy laughs as you start feeling uneasy. "I can tell some. Not all. But for a priceee."

"You want to read my fortune?" you ask as you lean over and put your hands on the booth. The woman grins as she finishes shuffling the cards and spreads them out on the table in front of the crystal ball. "For a mere $30 I'll let you pick 3 cards and divine your future. What do you say? Do you want a bit of foresight... or do you want the future to remain a mysteryyy...?"

You look down at the dusty old cards and then to the grinning old woman. Can she really tell you about the future or was this some kind of trick?
121121311122.title: Insight Or Illusion?

1211213111223.content:
You were tempted to give the woman the cash just to see what she'd have to say but your better judgement told you that you might need that money later on. "No thank you." you finally say as the woman let's out a chuckle and scoops the cards back up. "So you'd like the future to remain a mystery, then? Ha ha haaa... very well, young one. I bid you great fortune on your journey." she replies, never losing her smile or sounding disappointed in the slightest.

"Farewell, then." you answer back as you turn towards the sidewalk ahead and continue onward to the entrance to the sewer. You mostly remember the way back to the main city but got lost for a few hours along the way and sprang more than a few traps, most of which were fairly harmless while others were deadly enough to have almost claimed your life several times.

[You lose 3 hit points. If your Traps skill is 3 or higher you lose 1 hit point instead.]

After so much time down in the dark it took your eyes several minutes to adjust to the afternoon sunlight shining through the skeletal buildings surrounding you. This was definitely where you met Lyle though, and it fairly easy to make your way back to the Bluebrick Hotel with your newfound and hard earned wealth. You wave to Dalton on your way up to your room and begin getting everything ready for the next big leg of your journey. When your work was done you fell asleep and dreamed of the sights you'd see beyond Scrap City.
1211213111223.title: Back At The Bluebrick

!!!!! IMPORTANT NOTICE PLEASE READ !!!!!

This "interactive game" is still under development with new changes and adjustments being made daily and will not be officially available for quite some time. In order to gather feedback I've decided to do a short "open beta" type of test and open this interactive for a brief time to readers. Because this interactive RPG is nowhere near finished expect dead ends to stories, outdated stats and effects and references to mechanics that haven't been implemented yet. This is purely for testing and feedback purposes. As such, please DO NOT rate, review or add chapters to this interactive. I have a set storyline in mind and will DELETE ADDITIONS ON SIGHT. I'm sorry in advance but that's just how this works. If you have any questions or comments please don't hesitate to send them. I'd like suggestions too but I can't make any promises. This period of "open beta" will last until April 1st 2020 after which Wasted will return to being private until chapter 1 is finished. Please take a moment to read what I've made so far, make a character and enjoy the story. Thank you.

!!!!!!!!!!


The world may have been destroyed, but that's no reason you can't party! In this interactive you must make a character who can survive this harsh new world and enjoy themselves while they're at it.


How To Get Started

First you'll need to make a character. Just fill out the a sheet with the following information and you'll be ready to start.

Name: Your name.

Gender: Your sex.

Reputation: Your reputation is how others see you in the world and affect certain choices you can make. It starts at 0 and either increases or decreases based on certain actions you take. Positive actions increase it and negative actions decrease it. The max positive reputation is 10 and the max negative is -10.

Skills: This is where things get a bit complicated. Copy all of the skills listed below and then assign them 1-10 points each. Be warned that each skill must have at the very least 1 point and your total number of points can't exceed 50, so choose carefully. Once you have all these points assigned move on to the last section.

----------------------

Science: Your skill with technology and understanding of how things work.

Nature: Your skill with plants, animals and the (un)natural world around you.

Speech: Your skill at communicating with other people.

Guns: Your skill with firearms and heavy weapons.

Melee: Your skill with close range weapons such as clubs or swords.

Stealth: Your skill at staying hidden and being inconspicuous.

Endurance: Your skill at staying alive and resisting harm and fatigue.

Sex: Your skill at pleasing the opposite sex... or the same sex. Whatever.

Immunity: Your skill at not being poisoned or infected.

Traps: Your skill at identifying, disarming and making traps.

----------------------

Perks: Last part, I promise. All you have to do is select up to 5 perks from the list below. Once you've done that you can begin your journey.

Lucky: Good things happen when you need them.

STD Resistant: You cannot be affected by STDs or gain them from sex.

Ammo Crafter: You can make your own special ammo.

Explosive Crafter: You can make your own bombs.

Drug Crafter: You can make your own drugs.

Master Chef: You are an excellent cook.

Doctor: You have some decent medical skills.

Sex Appeal: In all interactions with the opposite sex you gain 2 points to your Speech and Sex skill.

Same Sex Appeal: In all interactions with the same sex you gain 2 points to your Speech and Sex skill.

Honest Face: In all interactions with guards, police or benevolent authority figures you gain 2 points to your Speech and Stealth skill.

Loyal Thug: In all interactions with criminals and criminal authority figures you gain 2 points to your Speech and Stealth skill.

Tough Guy: You have 2 additional hit points.

Rainy Day Fund: You start each chapter with an extra $100 and 5 caps.

Pickpocket: For every page you spend in an Urban environment add $20 to your money before making your choice.

Hippie: For every cumulative 3 pages you spend in a Nature environment you recover 1 hit point at the end of the 3rd page before making your choice.

City Slicker: Whenever you're in an Urban environment you gain 1 point to your Gun, Melee, Stealth and Trap skills.

Redneck: Whenever you're in a Nature environment you gain 1 point to your Gun, Melee, Stealth and Trap skills.

Wastelander: Whenever you're in a Ruin or Wasteland environment you gain 1 point to your Gun, Melee and Trap skills.

Horseman Of The Apocalypse: Whenever you're in a Hazard environment you gain 2 points to your Endurance and Immunity skills.

Intimidating Presence: You can intimidate certain people to do what you want.

Cannibal: You can eat Human Flesh without any stat penalties.

Easy Breathing: You can avoid being poisoned by hazardous gases.

Booze Hound: You don't receive any negative stat penalties from drinking alcohol. (Addition still applies as normal.)

Junkie: You get +1 to all skills when afflicted with 3 or more Addictions. (Addiction penalties still apply.)

Straight Edge: You get +1 to all skills while unaffected with any Addictions.

Clean Living: All Addiction Chances (AC) are reduced by 1. (Addiction Chances already at 1 are not affected.)


When done your character sheet should look something like this:
------------------------------------------------------
Name: Steve

Gender: Male

Reputation: 0

Skills

Science: 4
Nature: 2
Speech: 7
Guns: 5
Melee: 3
Stealth: 4
Endurence: 8
Sex: 9
Immunity: 4
Traps: 4

Perks

Lucky
Sex Appeal
Doctor
Master Chef
Drug Crafter
------------------------------------------------------



How To Play

This interactive is already completed and is meant to be played like a game. Once you have your character sheet done take another piece of paper and make a stats sheet and write down the following:

Hit Points: Your health, when its all gone you die and have to restart the chapter from the beginning. You start with 5 hit points that can only be restored by certain events in the story itself. When you die and begin a volume again you restart at 3 points instead of the starting 5. So if you make it to chapter 4 at 1 hit point and die you restart chapter 4 with 3 hit points. There are ways to increase your maximum hit points in the story, but dying starts you off with only 3 even if you have a maximum of ten available, so keep an eye out for chances to recover your hit points.

Money: Below your hit points write Cash, Caps and Glowing Ore. You start out penniless and broke, but as you move along you'll gain some money that you can spend. Cash is common, caps are uncommon and Glowing Ore is rare. Make sure you keep track of what you have at all times since money changes often. (Money also carries over from chapter to chapter so be careful how much you spend. If you blow all your money early on you might not have what you need to buy stuff in later chapters...)

Items: This one is simple and easy. Just use the rest of the page to write down any items you receive while reading. Many items are similar so make sure you also spell them correctly. It would suck if you have to restart due to accidentally mistaking one item for another. One last note, you only need to keep track of items the story specifically tells you to. Important story items will be kept track of by the interactive itself.

When done your stats page should look like this:
------------------------------------------------
Character name

Hit Points: 5

Money

Cash: $0
Caps: 0c
Glowing Ore: 0 GO

Items


------------------------------------------------

Now you have everything that you need and all that is left to explain how to move through story. Each page of the story will be read like a normal interactive with two important additions to take notice of, the environment and instructions. The environment mostly only affects certain perks and is just for aesthetic affect otherwise. The instructions will be written [like this] and tell you what you need to do during each page.

In addition to "normal choices" that anyone can select are special choices that you need certain skills or perks to use. For example if a choice says [Speech 4] you need a Speech skill of 4 to choose it. If a choice says [Master Chef] you'll need that perk to use it. Many choices also have additional requirements such as [$50] which means you need to pay $50 cash for that option. [5c] means you need 5 Caps and [1 GO] means you need 1 Glowing Ore.

There are also Reputation choices, which require a certain level of Reputation to select. Choices like [Rep 6+] require a positive Reputation of 6 or higher to select while choices like [Rep -3] require a negative Reputation of -3 or more. Your good (or bad) name can bring with it a lot of perks... or drawbacks so make your decisions carefully.

Finally, the are special "double choices" that are easier to pass than normal choices. All the player needs to do to accept the choice is EITHER requirement listed. So if you encounter a choice that says [Sex Appeal / $50] you just need the Sex Appeal perk or $50 to pick that option. Simple enough? Good.


Shopping

What good is money if you can't spend it? At several points during the story the reader may buy items if they have the money. No two shopkeepers are alike so its important to carefully see what they have to sell. When a shop is available to purchase from it will be marked like this:

===================

Can Of Beer (2) $10

Glowing Ore $100

===================

The cost of an item will be displayed after its name as seen above. If an item has a number after its name (as seen above) it is to show how many of those items the shop has left to sell. Once the items are gone the shop is sold out and if an item doesn't have a number next to its name its the last one so you should consider buying it if you really need it.

You are now ready to begin the game. Have fun!


Resources

Here's an online dice roller if you don't have any at home: https://www.wizards.com/dnd/dice/dice.htm
